She has been involved in this enterprise for 22 years. Abrewa is married and has six children. Her husband works as a contractor. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abrewa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fresh smoked fish. In the long term, Abrewa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fresh smoked fish.

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
37-year old Shukufa temporary settled her family with two children in Xirdalan dormitory. She is  Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the war-affected region of  Azerbaijan Zangilan. Her family’s living condition is not good enough.
In the beginning she  retailed sweetmeats, candies, cookies, biscuit, gutab. Since 2000 Shukufa has been engaged in selling the clothes: overcoats and underclothes. 

Having borrowed 2 loans of $400-$500 from Komak Credit Union she significantly expanded her business,  to increase profits achieved progress in her business.The loans were paid back timely.
 Now she needs a loan of $800 to further develop her business, to buy new clothes: overcoats and underclothes.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Destiny O. is a young woman of 35 years. She is married with three  children. A LAPO client for over 6 years, she had proved her worth in her line of business. She needs the money ($800) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old with 7 children. Four years ago she separated from her husband. She maintains her household through work emboidering table cloths. She sells all her works to a neighbor who then takes them to sell in Cancun (a tourist area on the Mayan Riviera). She delivers her product every 15 days. With this loan she plans to increase her production and create more products, including some to sell within her own community and therefore have two sources of income. She is part of the Grupo Arcos 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

ROSA TIENE 45 AÑOS, SIETE HIJOS,DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO.ELLA MANTIENE A SU HOGAR TRABAJANDO EN LA CONFECCION Y EL BORDADO DE MANTA, Y LO VENDE TODO A UNA VECINA LA CUAL LO LLEVA A VENDER A CANCUN (LUGAR TURISTICO EN LA RIVERA MAYA). ESTA ENTREGA LA HACE CADA QUINCE DIAS. CON EL CREDITO ESPERA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y ASI PODER CONFECCIONAR MAS PRENDAS PARA VENDERLAS ELLA DENTRO DE SU COMUNIDAD Y ASI OBTENER DOS GANACIAS. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ARCOS 1.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
I have run a grocery store in my house for 4 years with which I pay for family expenses. Now I need to buy more products like bread, beans, rice, sugar and coffee to be able to sell products wholesale or by the pound. There is high demand for these products and I would like to better serve my customers, who are my whole community.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo una pulperia en mi casa hace 4 años, de la cual cubro los gastos familiares. Ahora nesecito comprar mas productos como: pan, frijoles arroz azuca, cafe para poder vender por mayor o librado. Ya que tengo mucho demanda de estos productos y quiero dar un buen servicio a mis clientes que son todos los de mi comunidad.

loans.use: To purchase bread, beans, sugar, soap, coffee, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Juana Esperanza

texts.es:
Hi, my name is Juana Esperanza. I run a small business out of my home selling chicken and sausages, which allows me to earn a living and tend to my family. Thanks to this business I'm able to help my husband with household expenses. Currently, demand for my products is growing daily and I need more capital to meet my clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola Mi nonmbres es Juana Esperanza, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de pollo y embutidos, ubicado en mi casa de habitación el que me permite generar ingresos y atender a mi familia, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares, actualmente la demanda cada día es mayor y necesito una mayor inversión para satisfacer a los clientes y no cuento con dicho capital.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, sausages, bologna and dairy products.

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en: Yanti is 30 years old and is married. She sells snacks and blended ice, and usually earns $5.50 - $6.50 per day. Her husband Firdaus is selling noodles in Jakarta, earning $10 per week. Yanti would like a loan of IDR 500,000 to buy more goods and increase the income for her children's education. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Chanthorn, 25, and her husband were married in 2006. They have no children. Chanthorn has been a weaver since she was 12 years old. It's a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a construction worker. Both husband and wife have not finished secondary school.

Chanthorn is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for weaving. As Chanthorn has successfully repaid previous loans, we feel sure she will repay this new loan as well.

loans.use: Buying silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Mrs. Rachael E. is 59 years old.  She is married, has seven children and lives in Benin City.  She sells soup items and foodstuff. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuff to sell.  She spent a year learning this business before starting her business in 2001. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy more soup items and foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine N. is a 40-year-old man. He is single and lives in Benin City. He sells female shoes and bags. He learned this business for 6 years and started in 2004. He solicits a loan of $675 to buy more female shoes and bags for sale. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more female shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Mboudy

texts.fr:
Mboudy is married and has been a member of the Village Bank of Ngollar for 5 and a half years. She has already received and repaid 11 loans without incident. She is asking for a twelfth loan to strengthen her business raising cattle. Mboudy has committed herself to repaying this loan at the end of 6 months in a single payment. The income from her business will allow her to take part in looking after her family. She is one of the best in her group.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mboudy est mariée, membre du BV de Ngollar depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle a déjà reçu et remboursé sans incident 11 prêts. Elle sollicite un douzième prêt pour renforcer son activité d'embouche bovine. Mboudy s'engage a remboursé le prêt au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance. Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de participer àl'entretien de sa famille. Elle fait partie des meilleures de son groupe.

loans.use: To buy livestock and food

loans.name: Janett's Group

texts.es:
Raida, Janett, and Hermelinda have been members of Los Ladrilleros de Compañia Communal Bank for a year.

Raida lives with her partner, is 21 years old, and has a one year old daughter. Janett is 28 years old, and lives with her partner and three children. Hermelinda is 34 years old, and lives with her partner and five children.

Raida, Janett, and HErmelinda are from the Compañía community, 40 minutes outside of the city of Ayachucho. Together with their partners they create artisan bricks and sell them to distributors in their community.

Raida, Janett, and Hermelinda need loans of 1250 soles, 450 soles, and 900 soles, which they will use to purchase sand, clay, plastic, tools, firewood, and to pay wages.

Raida, Janett, and Hermelinda would like to have houses of their own in the city of Ayachucho. They hope to produce greater quantities of brick that their children can be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Raida, Janett y Hermelinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía hace 1 año.

Raida es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hija de 1 año. Por otro lado Yaneth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos. Mientras que Hermelinda es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos.

Raida, Janett y Hermelinda son de la comunidad de Compañía que esta a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, ellas junto a sus esposos se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales y sus ventas lo realizan en su misma comunidad a intermediarios.

Raida, Janett y Hermelinda necesitan préstamos de 1250 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena, arcilla, plásticos, herramientas, leña y para el pago de peones.

Los sueños de Raida, Janett y Hermelinda son tener casa propia en la ciudad de Ayacucho, que sus hijos sean profesionales y producir sus ladrillos en más cantidad.

loans.use: Raida, Janett, and Hermelinda need loans of 1250 soles, 450 soles, and 900 soles, which they will use to purchase sand, clay, plastic, tools, firewood, and to pay wages.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Willy could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demand of his clients. That is to say he was able to buy everything in time, harvesting his crop as expected and marketing all his product.

Development of Business:

The 7 blocks that he possesses have permitted him to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products, such as corn. Ten years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Willy is 20 years old. He is Single. He does not have children. His dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of his aspirations is to buy more hectares of land to have more production and to market in other places.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan he will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of his location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=12649

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Willy pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 7 cuadras que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. 10 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Willy tiene 20 años. Es Soltero. No tiene hijos. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es comprar más hectáreas de tierra para tener más producción y comercializar en otros lugares.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=12649

loans.use: To buy necessary supplies to cultivate a winter crop.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana N., 65, is married with 9 children.  She has year(s) of experience in the shop business. She sells to the   days per week. She has  previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be Tala (~0 USD).  SPBD loans are Susana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase goods like mutton flaps,chicken,box of noodles etc.

loans.name: Fuianina

texts.en:
Fuianina A. is a 58-year-old married woman with 11 children. Her husband is self-employed. She has 4 years of experience in the grocery store business, and she sells her goods to the village people and the public at large 6 days per week. Typically, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 500 Tala ($208 USD).

She has received 5 previous loans from SPBD. In truth, SPBD loans are Fuianina’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from any of the traditional banks. She is hoping to use a portion of the loan proceeds to repair her house, while the remaining proceeds will be used for general business purposes (e.g., to buy goods for the store).

loans.use: To expand and improve her store by purchasing additional goods and to repair her house

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata C. is 43, married, has two children and has been a member of the Lyndiane 2 village bank for three and a half years. She purchases rolls of fabric and dye and then sells the dyed fabric. She would like to develop her business in order to improve her family’s standard of living. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatoumata C., 43 ans, est mariée avec 2 enfants en charge et est membre du banc villageois de Lyndiane 2eme depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle achète des rouleaux de tissus et des produits pour faire la teinture et vendre le tissu teinté par ensemble. Elle veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and dye

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas A. is 35 years old. He is married and has two kids who are currently in school. He is a retailer of auto parts, which he buys from spare parts dealers and re-sells to his customers. He enjoys his trade very much; however, he does not have adequate funds to support his business, especially with the current price hikes. He therefore needs a loan to remain in business. With this loan, he will purchase new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. He believes the loan will enable him to save more to finance his kids' education. He is a member of the community group called Anderson Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase stock of auto parts

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene C. is 42 years old, married with 4 children. Her eldest child is 16 years old while the youngest is 4 years old. She sells palm oil and washing soap.

The washing soap is used in washing pots and pans that have difficult stains. Magdalene produces the washing soap herself. She buys the palm oil from a palm oil company at Okomu. She hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of US$ 700 to buy more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Doña Adriana es viuda, tiene 60 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa y es madre D. 02 hijas ambas con familia, vive en el Jr. Grau Nº 636 del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo – Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca” – Yunguyo. A ún inicio obtuvo un crédito D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, con el que compró leña por mayor con todo el capital. A los 20 años D. edad formó su  hogar y con 21 años D. edad empezó con el negocio D. venta D. madera, leña a la fecha, lamentablemente su esposo falleció hace 23 años, desD. entonces ella sigue sola con su negocio, cuenta con dos trabajadores, desD. el año pasado aperturó su tienda D. abarrotes.

Con el crédito D. S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar madera con S/.1500.00 y leña con S/.1500.00 para ser comercializado al por mayor y menor.

Su sueño es dejar un capital a su hija menor para que pueda trabajar.

“Me acostumbré ir a las reuniones del Banco Comunal, porque nos encontramos con las demás socias, además nos capacitan y nos orientan”.manifestó doña Adriana muy contenta.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 60 year old widow, she completed primary school and is mother to two grown daughter who each has her own family. She lives at Jr. Grau Nº 636 in Yunguyo, Puno district and province. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Wiñay Marca” of Yunguyo. Initially she obtained a loan for S/.300.00 nuevos soles, with which she bought wool at wholesale, using the entire loan. At 20 years old she married and at 21 years old she began a business selling wood and firewood and continues selling today. Sadly her husband passed away 23 years ago, and since then she continues on with the business by herself, relying on two workers, as last year she opened her grocery store. With this loan for S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she proposes to buy wood with S/.1500.00 and firewood with S/.1500.00 to be sold at wholesale and retail. Her dream is leaving her youngest capital so that she can work. “I am used to going to the Community Bank meetings, because we meet with the other members, teach and train ourselves,” says a very content Adriana.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
La señora Alina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 123, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno  que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad vende gaseosas y se dedica a su hogar y a administrar su negocio. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas Kola Real, agua mineral, etc.

Alina esta muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que la apoyan, en especial con el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Alina belongs to the community bank "Beautiful View" located in Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 123, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 48 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children, two of who are now adults and one who is still her dependant. Her husband works as a bricklayer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in the amount of S/. 300, she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for two years. Currently, she sells sodas and dedicates herself to her home and operating her business. With this loan of S/. 2,500, to be paid back in 5 months, she will buy 10 boxes of Kola Real sodas, mineral water, etc. Alina is very appreciative of every person that supports her, especially the community bank Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of Kola Real sodas, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es: Dorotea tiene 48 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Ella es una agricultora muy alegre que inició su actividad desde los 23 años y desde entonces nunca dejó de producir, en este caso, calabazas, que vende en los mercados, ya que personalmente se dedica a venderlos y no dar a intermediarios, ya que le resulta más rentable vender por unidad que por cantidades mayores. Aunque siempre hay algo de dificultad en la venta, no deja de hacerlo con mucho entusiasmo. Dorotea inicia su crédito y está muy comprometida con las demás personas de su banco comunal para crecer económicamente. Ella empezará a cultivar nuevos productos y requiere de 300 soles para la compra de abonos para sus terrenos  de producción.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 48 years old and lives with her spouse and her two young children. She is a farmer who is very happy to have started her business 23 years ago. Since she has started, she has never failed to produce, in this case, pumpkins, which she sells in the markets. She sells them herself, without giving them to intermediaries, since it is more profitable to sell them individually instead of in large numbers. Although there is always some difficulty in the sales, this doesn't stop her enthusiasm for her work. Dorotea is beginning her loan and is very committed to the people of the communal bank for allowing her to advance financially. She will begin to cultivate new products and require 300 soles in order to buy fertilizer for her land.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de abono para sus cultivos

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima F. is 47 years old. She is married and has three children to whom she wishes to give the best. Muslima is very dynamic and cares for her family. She is a market vendor. She sells different kinds of hair accessories for girls and women in her little store.

Muslima tries to give her family as much money as possible to be able to cover the expenses of schooling and university for her children, as she is dreaming of allowing all of them to be well-educated. Today Muslima wants to expand her business and to increase the working capital to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 2500 Somoni (725 USD) for a term of 11 months. Having been loaned sums by IMON six times and having demonstrated herself to be an accurate client, Muslima promises to manage this loan with accuracy. Let’s support this dedicated mother so she can make her dreams become reality!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase the range of her inventory

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El Sr. Simón P. T., ingresó a la Institución por recomendación de su Sra. Madre doña Rosa T. cliente antigua, el se dedica al manejo de un transporte de Radio Taxi, su esposa es Empleada del hogar en la casa de su madrina, ambos se colaboran en los gastos del hogar. Aunque no tienen hijos, los gastos que ocasiona el mantenimiento de su movilidad, hace que ambos trabajen.
Él trabaja con Emprender desde hace tres años, inició sus ciclos con montos pequeños de 200 dólares y así sucesivamente, en algunas ocasiones solicita créditos mayores, tiene un historial bueno, considerándolo un cliente muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mr. Simón P. T. joined the institution as a recommendation by his mother, Mrs. Rosa T., a long time client. He operates a Radio Taxi, his wife is a housekeeper in her godmother’s home, and together they split their household expenses. Even though they do not have children, the expense of maintaining his vehicle forces them both to work. He has been working with Emprender for 3 years, where he began his loan cycles with small sums of $200 successively, and on occasion requests larger loans. He has a good payment history, making him a very responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New motor

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El señor Andres tiene 44 años, vive con su hijo, quien le ayuda a elaborar los detergentes , este negocio es vital para la familia, ya que es el sustento diario. Andres comenzo trabajando en una empresa que fabrica detergentes en donde aprendio el oficio .El se independiso aproximadamente hace 10 años y provee a las despensas del barrio . El necesita de este crédito para seguir elavorando mas productos ya que su negcio funciona muy bien. En el futuro desea comprar un vehiculo para realizar sus ventas en el interior del pais.
texts.en:
Andrés is 44 years old and lives with his son. The two of them make detergents to sell, which is their primary source of income. Andres began working in a business that made detergents, which is where he learned the trade. Approximately 10 years he began his own business and now supplies his neighborhood with detergent. Andres is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make his detergents, including hypochlorite, bleach, and sodium hydrosulfite. In the future his goal is to purchase a vehicle to transport his detergent to other parts of the country and sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make detergents, including hypochlorite, bleach, and sodium hydrosulfite, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que trabajan fuera, él vive en su casa con su esposa. Hombre multifacético, está avocado a los distintos trabajos. Se dedica es a labrar la tierra en pocas cantidades, a la compra y venta de carros de segunda mano, que en temporadas le resulta rentable. Además tiene una bodega, donde no gana mucho, pero con sus ganancias cubre los gastos de alimentación diaria, y ha implementado un teléfono público, lo que le ha permitido ser más concurrida. Asimismo, realiza el transporte de las cargas de los agricultores a la ciudad en el auto que logró comprar hace un tiempo atrás. Todas estas actividades le han permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos que ahora son profesionales, y que cada cierta temporada los visitan. Está feliz  por los trabajos que realiza, dice adaptarse a todo ello y nada le es difícil, mientras le produzca ganancias, él lo realiza. Guillermo en uno de los fundadores de este banco comunal, desde ese tiempo, 4 años, está en la presidencia, ya que le ratifican en el cargo constantemente por ser un buen líder, lo que demuestra en su cargo y con sus pagos puntuales. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de su bodega y comprar fertilizantes para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 59 years old, married, and has three children who all work in other places. He lives in his house with his wife. He is a multifaceted man who is skilled in a variety of jobs. He works the land in small plots and buys and sells used cars, which is sometimes profitable. He also has a store, which doesn't earn him much, but with his earnings he manages to cover the cost of his daily food and has installed a public telephone which has increased traffic there. He also transports crops for the local farmers to the city in a car he managed to buy a while back. All of these activities have allowed him to pay for his children's education who are now professionals, and they visit him every now and again. Guillermo is happy with all the jobs that he does, and says he has adapted and nothing is too hard for him and as long as he's making money, he'll keep on doing the same thing.

Guillermo is one of the founding members of his community bank and for four years has been the President, and is always elected because he is a good leader, which he demonstrates in his capacity as President and with his punctual loan payments. The money he is requesting is to increase the stock in his store and buy fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for his store, as well as fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur S.  a appris la soudure, il a ouvert en 2006 son propre atelier de soudure, il fabrique des fourneaux et des portes de maison qu’il vend à ses clients. Ne disposant plus suffisamment de matières nécessaires à la fabrication de fourneaux et portes de maison, il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des 15 tôles  20 barres de fer et d’autres matériaux. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses recettes. Il est un jeune homme célibataire et très dynamique
texts.en:
Mr. S. learned how to weld. In 2006, he opened his own welding workshop. He makes stoves, doors, and gates for homes that he sells to his customers. No longer having sufficient equipment and supplies needed for making these products, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 15 pieces of sheet metal, 20 iron bars, and other materials. Thus, he'll be able to augment his receipts. He is a young, unmarried man who is very dynamic.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheet metal and iron bars

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
S. Khanifa is a hardworking woman and, since 1993, has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Rudaki district. Khanifa characterizes herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of four children that she would like to offer an education.

Her biggest dream is to arrange the wedding of her elder son for which she works hard every day. To realize this dream, Khanifa now requests $1200 for the term of 12 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings. With your collaboration she’ll be able to crystallize her dream in a short time.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her range of vegetables

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora  has been a baker in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Hatutaki Maneno Group Loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $70 US.  She works for 8 hours a day.


She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania, her first, so that she can buy more wheat flour and sugar for her business. She is hoping that, with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money for future use, improve her home, and pay for her children's education.  


Dora is 50 years old, married, and has five children.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia C. is 40 years old and a mother of three children. She has a cassava farm. She tills as well as waters the plants to ensure a good harvest. Her husband, Samson C., is the one managing their business. They work as a team to provide for their needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. The fertilizers will help improve the soil condition. This will give her whole family a better income from their farm.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen C., 27, typically provides transportation services with his motorbike at local markets in Battambong Province with an income of US$ 3 per day. He lives with his wife and his only child who does not attend school yet. His wife is a good cook and earns an income of US$ 3 per day.

To make a better living standard, he and his wife want to take a loan of US$ 1000 to buy bamboo and wood to build a grocery store in front of their house to generate more income for the family's future use.

loans.use: buying bamboo and wood to buid a grocery store

loans.name: Lui

texts.es: Lui tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a pintar autos en un espacio que alquiló de un taller de mecánica; su trabajo es diario y sólo descansa los domingos, pues cada labor dura varios días para que el acabado sea lo más perfecto posible, ya que de eso depende la recomendación de sus clientes para adquirir nuevos contratos. Esta actividad le resulta rentable porque las personas pagan un buen precio por el servicio que les brinda y esto anima a Lui a planificar su futuro arrendando un local amplio donde cuente con espacio necesario para mejorar el servicio que brinda. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, en su grupo destaca como una persona colaboradora y perseverante. En esta oportunidad, Lui renueva su compromiso de seguir trabajando con responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de esmalte para carros y de una pistola para pintar.
texts.en:
Lui is 31 years old and lives in a rented house with his wife and son. He has painted cars for the past 3 years in a space that he has rented at a mechanic shop. He works everyday and only rests on Sundays. Each job takes several days to complete so that the finished product is as perfect as possible. He depends on customer recommendations to acquire new contracts. This work is profitable for him because people pay a good sum for the service that he provides. This encourages Lui to plan his future renting a spacious place where he has the necessary space to improve the service he provides. This is his sixth loan with MFP. In his group he stands out as a collaborating and perseverant person. With this opportunity, Lui is renewing his commitment to continue working responsibly in repaying his loans. The money that he is asking for will be used to purchase paint and a paint gun.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of car paint and tools for his work

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie D. est une jeune femme de 27ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle veut utiliser son prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de produis rafraîchissant à domicile puisqu’elle a déjà un congélateur. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de payer ses frais d’électricité et de subvenir aux différents besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Marie D., age 27, is married and the mother of 5 children. She wants to use this loan to sell refreshments at her home, since she already own a freezer. Her profits will enable her to pay her electricity bills and to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell refreshments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Abdull Qasem Group

texts.en:
Abdull Qasem is the group leader of Abdull Qasem Group. There are three members in this group and each of them would like to receive a loan for their business. They have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

Adull Qasem wants to take a loan for his business as a mechanic.

Asmatallah wants to take a loan for his business of carpet weaving.

Khadeja wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store.

They are all very happy with this small loan process in this poor city in Afghanistan. They thank AFSG and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for painting

loans.name: Huacchacunapac Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal HUACCHACUNAPAC; están ubicados en la comunidad campesina de Ccapana, en el distrito de Quispicachis, en el departamento de Cusco, a 4 horas de la misma ciudad el Cusco.

Nuestros socios son un grupo de 14 miembros, todos ellos alternan sus actividades principales con diferentes comercios, principalmente ellos son agricultores, tienen en su mayoría tierras de cultivo, de papa, maíz; seguidamente a esta actividad tenemos a los ganaderos, que son socios que compran ganados vacunos y los engordan y reproducen, para así mejorar sus razas o vender sus crías, también sacan derivados de la vaca, como son la leche fresca, el yogurt natural y queso de la zona; otros socios venden los productos secos, como son semillas, pallares, maíz, cereales, habas, entre otros. Nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para así seguir invirtiendo en mejorar su producción y su calidad de vida mediante sus actividades.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank HUACCHACUNAPAC live in the rural community of Ccapana, in the Quispicachis district of the Cusco region, which is four hours from the city of Cusco. This bank has 14 members who are engaged in a variety of business activities. Principally they are farmers, cultivating land to produce potatoes and corn. Others are engaged in the production of livestock; they purchase cattle and fatten them and reproduce them so that they can improve their breeds and sell their calves. In addition they produce dairy products from the cows, such as fresh milk and natural yogurts and cheeses. Other members sell dry products such as seeds, lima beans, corn, cereals and beans, among others. This group is requesting a loan to continue investing in improving their production and their quality of life through these activities. The group members appreciate and value the loan granted through these means, and commit to making the payments on the debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juliao Eugenio

texts.pt:
Julião T. nasceu em Chibuto Distrito da Província de Gaza, ao sul de Moçambique, tem 43 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos de 1 a 18 anos de idade, destes 5 vão à escola. Fez 7ª classe e não foi possível continuar devido à falta de condições financeiras. Vive numa casa própria com a família com a sua mãe.

Saiu de chibuto em 1983 a Maputo em casa de seus tios, para continuar com os seus estudos. Depois de casamento fixou a sua própria residência em Boane, onde reside ate data hoje.
Ė funcionário da Saúde em Boane ha mais de 18 anos, tem um salário mensal de 2.900.00MT. Para alem deste, presta serviço a terceiros com o qual consegue render ate 1.500.00MT e poupa algum na sua conta Bancária.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos, nunca levantou empréstimos em outras instituições bancárias. Este é o seu 4º credito na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00MT, com o qual pretende comprar cimento, barrotes, chapas, ferro e pagamento de mão de obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.500.00MT, 7.500.00MT e 10.000.00MT todos para a compra de material de construção.

O seu objectivo com este empréstimo, é melhorar a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial para venda de bebidas e produtos de primeira necessidade.
texts.en:
Julião T. was born in Chibuto district of the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is 43 years old, married and father of six children aged one through 18. Of these, five go to school. He finished seventh grade and was not able to continue his studies because of financial conditions. He lives in his own house with his family and his mother. He left Chibuto in 1983 for Maputo and the home of his relatives in order to continue with his studies. After his marriage, he settled down in Boane, where he still lives today. He has worked as a civil servant in the Department of Health in Boane for more than 18 years. He has a salary of 2,900 MT. In addition to this, he provides various services to others for which he earns up to 1,5000 MT, and saves some in his bank account. He got to know Hluvuku through friends, and has never taken out loans from other banking institutions. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 MT, with which he plans to buy cement, beams, sheet metal, iron and pay the workers. The previous loans were for 5,500 MT, 7,500 MT and 10,000 MT, all for buying construction materials. His objective with this loan is to improve his house and offer better living conditions to his family. In future, in plans to request more loans to build a business establishment to sell drinks and basic necessities.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (bricks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Mrs. Thai Chem Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of fourteen people, is located in Koh Kaev Kraom village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thai C. is the village bank president, as selected by the members. She is a rice seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are married and live separately.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell.

loans.name: God's Empowerment Group

texts.en:
Louza F. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God’s Empowerment. She is a 40 year old single mother of  2 children.  Her children are 15 and 19 years old and their educational levels 10th  and 12th  grade. Louza  also cares for her niece and nephew. Louza and her family live in the Shoe factory community, Gardnerville north of Monrovia, but she work at the Bernerville junction, north of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.

Louza is a graduate of the teacher’s college and a freshman in a University in Monrovia.  Her business is selling cosmetics. She sells cosmetics like roll-on, bath soap, body lotions, powder, and tooth paste to residents of Bernerville. She has been running this business for 3 years, and hoping to improve to a wholesaler and have branches around Monrovia,Liberia.

Louza talks to her customers in a good manner and her cosmetics are cheap in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business.  She started selling with savings from her daycare center and decided to build a shop.  Now, she needs a loan to improve business.

Louza dreams of giving her children, niece and nephew better education to prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize in bulk

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos, a los cuales ama mucho.
Ella posee una tienda snack donde ofrece diversos productos comestibles como golosinas, galletas, helados, entre otros. A Rebeca le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que tiene la comodidad de atender a sus clientes y hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Además se siente muy contenta porque su negocio va muy bien y cada vez va teniendo más clientela, pues está muy bien ubicada, cerca de la municipalidad de su localidad, lo cual hace que tenga buena cantidad de clientes.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y al igual que en su negocio, promete ser muy responsable y que no faltar al pago de las cuotas. Con el dinero solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda en esta época de verano.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 31. She lives with her life partner and their children; she loves them a lot. She has a snack store where she sells diverse food products like sweets, cookies, ice cream, and other things. Rebeca really likes her work because she has the convenience of waiting on her customers and doing the household chores. She also feels happy because her business is going very well. She keeps getting more customers. She is well located near the municipality in her area. That gives her a good amount of customers. This is her first loan with MFP. Just as she is in her business, she promises to be very responsible and not miss making a payment. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to better stock her store in this summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Okuambo Irene Badaru Group

texts.en:
Irene B. is fifty years of age and is a single businesswoman blessed with four children. She is also looking after two dependents, both schooling.

Irene has dealt in cassava flour since 2006. Due to the competition, she is purchasing quality cassava flour to win the attention of customers. With that, at least, her business is improving and she is even going to put grass on her hut (roofing).

Irene is an active and hardworking woman whose dream is to enlarge her business and perhaps build a house.

loans.use: To purchase quality cassava flour to win the attention of customers

loans.name: Soap Sellers Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Soap Sellers' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, who want a loan of Le 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 each) to enable them to improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses; sales will thus improve and so also will their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Fatmata K. on the left. Fatmata was born in Makeni. She is now age thirty-two, married with three children. Her husband is a businessman too, and her children are attending school. Fatmata produces and sells soap and has been in the soap business for four years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy soap producing materials like palm oil, caustic soda and plastic bowls.

loans.use: Buy working materials like palm oil, caustic soda, plastic bowls, etc.

loans.name: Moron

texts.es:
Jesús Ambio de 27 años de edad vive en casa de su padre quien se dedica a la agricultura, su madre es fallecida.El vive junto con su hermano quien aporta en los gastos de la casa ellos viven en Caserio Barrio Nuevo – Ocucaje.
El sr. tiene una hija de 6 años de edad la cual no vive con èl pero le pasa mensualmente una pensión de S/. 200 aparte que siempre esta pendiente de los gastos de su niña.
El sr. se dedica al transporte diario de 7.00am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años trabaja en el carro de su hermana quien  confía mucho en él.
El goza de buenas referencias desea el financiamiento para poder apoyar a su padre en la compra de insumos para la agricultura y tambien para la compra de uniforme y matriculas de su hija.  
Es una persona con bastante ganas de salir adelante cuentan con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que es una persona bien responsables.
texts.en:
Jesús Ambio, 27, lives in his father's house; his father is a farmer, his mother is deceased. A brother, who also lives with them, contributes to household expenses, too. They live in Caserio Barrio Nuevo - Ocucaje. He has a 6-year-old daugther who doesn't live with him. However, he pays a 200 sol monthly support for her and he is always conscious of his daughter's expenses. For the last 5 years he has been in public transport. He uses a car that his sister, who trusts him a lot, lends him. He covers the round-trip Ica-Ocucaje route from 7am until 9pm. He has good references and needs funding to help his father to buy farming supplies and also to buy his daughter's school uniform and pay her school enrollment fees. He is a person who has a great desire to succeed in life. His neighbors give him good references and state that he is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his father and to pay for his daughter's school enrollment fee and her school uniform.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing virtual credits for the Claro and Movistar cell phone services

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia  al lado de su esposo y sus 3 menores  hijos.Desde muy joven empezó a dedicarse a  los negocios, y esto la motivo para instalar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad .Desde hace un año se animó a empezar con el negocio  y actualmente es la mas  visitada  por sus clientes, ya que es una de las pocas tiendas  que tiene su localidad, esta es una gran oportunidad para ella, pues no descuida a  sus hijos y trabaja  desde la comodidad de su  casa. Su trato amable y los precios cómodos que ofrece la ayudan bastante para  garantizar el retorno de sus clientes. En el futuro  Blanca tiene pensado abastecer su tienda de mayor cantidad de productos para poder ofrecer variedad a  sus habituales clientes.Es el 13avo préstamo  que tiene y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando en su tienda, además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Blanca tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos comestibles al por mayor, ya que desea surtir bien su tienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 41, lives in her own home with her husband and three minor children. She has been a businesswoman since a very young age. She set up a grocery store a year ago and now her store is the most popular with her customers because it’s one of the few stores in her neighborhood; this is a great opportunity for her because she can work from the comfort of her home while watching over her children. Her fair prices and the kindness with which she treats her customers guarantee their return. In the future, Blanca intends to stock her store with a wider variety of products to offer her usual customers. This is her 13th loan and she is grateful to all the people that made it possible for her to continue working in her store; she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Blanca will use the funds to buy stock items at wholesale in order to stock her store very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 28 años, vive en su casa propia en  compañía de sus 2 hijas menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella. Desde muy joven, empezó a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y así aprendió todo lo necesario para cultivar la tierra y lograr que ésta brinde una buena producción. Cada día se despierta muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos de papa y arveja, previamente sembrados con mucha paciencia. Luego de varios meses de esfuerzo trabajo, la espera brinda sus frutos y recoge toda la producción que luego lo transportaría al mercado, en donde son comercializados a buen precio. Es así que han transcurrido 12 años dedicándose por entero a esta actividad. Manifiesta además que le gusta su trabajo porque puede continuar con la herencia que le dejaron sus padres, siendo esta propiedad que le ayudará a salir adelante en bienestar de su familia. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y acumular ganancias que le ayuden a cubrir la educación de sus hijas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy segura que éste aporte le ayudará a mejorar su producción. Asimismo la labor que realiza su grupo comunal es buena, por ser todos muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Rosario tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de semillas de arveja y fertilizantes para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Rosario is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her two young daughters. Since she was very young, she worked to help out her parents and thus learned everything she needed to cultivate the land and yield a good production. Every day she wakes up very early to tend to her potato and pea crops, which she previously planted with a lot of care and patience. Then, after numerous months of hard work, she hopes her efforts bear fruit and she can pick all her crops and transport them to the market, where she can sell them at a good price. This is what has transpired over the 12 years she has dedicated herself entirely to this activity. Furthermore, she says that she enjoys her work because she can continue the legacy passed down from her parents, as the land will help make headway for her family. In the future, she plans to plant larger quantities to increase her profits, which will help cover the costs of her children's education. This is her third loan cycle with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very certain this will help her increase her production. Her work with her community bank has been good, and all of the members are very responsible with their payments. Rosario is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of pea seeds and fertilizers to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with children and none of her children is in school. She resides in and owns a two-room house and stays with additional family members. Her monthly expenses include medication and rent for her business premises. She owns a restaurant in Mulago selling all types of food like Irish potatoes and cassava, mostly in the evening. She wants to use this loan to stock more food items like cooking oil, a sack of Irish potatoes, cassava and yams. She joined MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting timely loans. She aspires to acquire another plot of land and build a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like cooking oil, Irish potatoes, cassava and yams

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Preak Svay village, in Kandal province, twelve people have formed a village bank loan group. The members have selected Mrs. Kim K. as the village bank president. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Kim K. sells fish and vegetables. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve her business, she is seeking a loan to buy more fish and vegetables to resell. She is a widow, and supports four children by herself. Three of her children are attending a local public school, the fourth is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Aomara's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of four people who live in Steung Chrov Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Aomara V. has been selected by the members to be the group leader. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Aomara V. is a healer who can earn some money to support her family. To improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Aomara V. is asking for a loan to buy various medicines to resell. Her husband, Mr. Chab Brang, is a policeman who can get a low salary to support his family. Through their work, the couple supports three children, one of whom is a policeman, one is employed by a private company, and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy various medicines to resell

loans.name: Elva Del Pilar

texts.es:
Elva tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en Nueva Arica, un distrito dedicado principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la preparación y venta de comida, ella prepara alimentos en su domicilio y los vende a los trabajadores agrícolas que radican temporalmente en la zona, esta actividad tiene bastante demanda ya que ella prepara sus platos con buena sazón, los ingresos que percibe le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Elva desea adquirir más insumos para preparar más platos de comida y aumentar sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Elva es una mujer bastante responsable y que gusta mucho de su trabajo. En la zona donde reside sus vecinos la consideran una persona carismática y de confianza.
texts.en:
Elva is 30, married with one child, and lives with her family in Nueva Arica, a district dedicated primarily to agricultura activities such as livestock and tobacco cultivation. It is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has made and sold food. She prepares food in her home and sells it to the agricultural workers who settle temporarily in the area. This activity has a lot of demand as she prepares her dishes with good seasoning. Her income allows her to help her husband with family costs. Elva wants to acquire more ingredients to prepare more food and increase her sales. In order to achieve her goal she has requested her first loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Elva is a very responsible woman who lives her work. In her neighbourhood, her neighbours consider her to be a charismatic and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for food production and sales

loans.name: Fikret

texts.ru:
Fikret A. jivet v Absheron regione. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Fikretu 51 qod. Iz eqo detey 2 uje jenilis  i toka odnoy eshe 18 let i ona qotovitsya postupit v universitet na ekanomiku. 

On uje 10 let zanimayetsys etim biznesom. Ranshe on derjal ovec i prodoval ixniye koju i myaso. A seychas on reshil derjat korov i u neqo uje yest 2 korovi. no on xochet kupi eshe shtobi bilo pobolshe maloka dlya prodaji i pribil bila bi bolshe.  S dvuma korovami pribil malenkaya. I v budushem on xotel bi rpoizvodit i sir.
texts.en:
Fikret A. lives in the Absheron region. He is married and has 3 children. Fikret is 51 years old. Two of his children are already married, and one daughter, who is only 18 years old, is getting ready to get into a university to study economics. Fikret has been involved in this business for 10 years. Previously, he kept sheep and sold their skin and meat. And now, he decided to keep cows and already has 2 cows. However, he also wants to buy more cows in order to have more milk for sale and more profits. The profits are small with two cows. In the future, he also want to start making cheese.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Simon Bolivar

texts.en:
Simon Bolivar V. R. is 64 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 2 children, aged 20 and 22, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar. He is also the grandfather of 2 boys and a girl

Simon is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Simon works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, beans and peas. He purchases on Fridays and sells his products on Sundays in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Simon is asking for this loan to purchase compost and fertilizers for his blackberries and to buy land. He hopes this credit will help him to buy what he needs and pay for his children's studies. His dream is to enable his grandchildren to study and to purchase land to cultivate. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to dance and sing in his free time.

loans.use: To purchase compost and fertilizers for his blackberries and to buy land

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar Ernesto C. M. tiene 19 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. 

Oscar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, cacao, y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejora la situación económico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio para seguir adelante. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta practicar el deporte de futbol y boli.
texts.en:
Oscar Ernesto C. M. is 19 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents. He lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Oscar is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Oscar is a farmer, and he grows corn, cacao, and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. He is requesting a loan for farming. With the support of this loan his financial situation will improve. He dreams of buying his own piece of land in order to get ahead. A challenge that he has faced in his work is that his corn has diseases and insect infestations. One of these is specifically called “longosta” (locust). He likes to play soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Ankil Devi

texts.en:
This is 64-year-old Ankil Devi S.. She is married and has one child, aged 27. In 2006, Ankil Devi established a small restaurant business. Working seven hours a day, seven days a week, she is able to support her family. Ankil Devi has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Kiva partner, Patan Business and Professional Women, and used her most recent loan to purchase food ingredients. In the future, Ankil Devi plans to improve her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.
Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, Patan Business and Professional Women's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

About Patan Business and Professional Women
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buys goods and materials

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty T. is 32 and married with 2 children (ages 2 and 5).  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Beauty has many years of experience in this business.  Beauty needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Beauty joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Beauty's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Cristina Jose

texts.pt:
Cristina José Txavane comprou todo material acordado com Hluvuku e aplicou no proposito que se havia planificado.

Não foi possível pagar de acordo o calendário estabelecido devido ao atraso dos salários mas conseguiu pagar na totalidade e a sua obra esta decorrendo normalmente.

Houve mudanças na sua vida porque obteve mais um filho e com o novo empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Sente se feliz com o empréstimo porque esta conseguindo dar melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família. 
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua casa.
texts.en:
[After getting a previous loan with Hluvuku, the Kiva field partner] Cristina José Txavane bought all of the materials agreed on with Hluvuku and began work on the project she had been planning. She was not able to repay the loan in the established time frame because of delays in the payment of her salary, but she did eventually repay the loan completely and her construction project is still underway.

There have been many changes in Cristina's life, including the birth of another child. She plans to use the new loan, for 20,000 Meticais, to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, doors and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home.

Cristina is happy with the loan because it is allowing her to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, stone, doors and other items)

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natividad;  La socia tiene 37 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia  trabaja atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes, ella necesita implementar su tienda de abarrotes comprando harinas al por mayor, aceite, arroz, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar la tienda abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Natividad belongs to the Sr. De Tantamarca village bank; the bank is located in the Chicon district in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

Natividad is 37 years old and married with 4 children.  She runs a small grocery store but she needs to build up her inventory of goods; she needs to buy a number of items wholesale, including flour, oil, rice, and sugar.  She is seeking a loan to buy this merchandise to stock her store.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time promises to repay it punctually.

loans.use: Purchase inventory to stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Las Doncellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se integra de tres señoras, cada una con diferente actividad y se llama las doncellas, está ubicada en la localidad de Julián Grajales Municipio de Copaínala, Estado de Chiapas México. La razón del nombre es porque son unas Doncellas.

       María Isabel  G. Gutiérrez es la que se le tomo la entrevista tiene veinticinco años de edad es casada con el señor Isidro Solís Vega, en la cual han procreado una hija de la edad de tres años de nombre Lizani Janet  y que es un orgullo para ellos.

       La señora Isabel se dedica a bordar y tejer ropas de hilos de estambres y solicito el préstamo para comprar sus materiales como son: hilos, encajes, botones, para que así pueda elaborarlos con mejor calidad y pueda venderlo a un buen precio, para que con ello obtenga ganancias y mejores ingresos en su hogar.

       Lo que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue su familia ya que desde muy pequeña le gusta costurar, inicio con esta actividad hace tres meses ya que estuvo tomando cursos para mejorar sus bordados  y así obtenga más clientela y se interesen en sus ropas tejidas y pueda venderlas a un buen precio.

       Lo que ella quisiera es lograr a horrar para estudiar lo que es la sastrería y ser una modista profesional, para que con eso pueda diseñar más ropas de diferentes modelos  y obtenga mejores ganancias como también clientes en el negocio que está iniciando.
      
     Se integro al grupo por una invitación que le hizo su vecina la señora Alai R. Arias para formar parte del programa y solicitar un préstamo del cual pudiera trabajar y tener en donde dedicar su tiempo.

     Las personas que integran el grupo son las siguientes:

     María Isabel G. Gutiérrez: invertirá el préstamo para la compra de hilos, encajes y botones para elaborar sus ropas de estambre.

    María de Jesús García Zacarías: invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de joyas de oros, Como son: cadenas, pulsos, aretes, entre otros, para venderlo en las comunidades cercanas.

   Alai R. arias: invertirá el préstamo en la compra jabón de polvo y barra de diferentes marcas para venderlo en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
The group is composed of three ladies each with a different activity.  It’s called “Las Doncellas” (The Lasses) and is located in Julián Grajales, Copaínala municipality, Chiapas State, México.  The reason for the name is that they are Lasses.

María Isabel G. Gutiérrez is the one who was interviewed.  She is 25 years old and married to Mr. Isidro Solís Vega with whom she has a three year old daughter, Lizani Janet, who is their pride.

Isabel embroiders and knits clothes and asked for the loan to buy supplies like: thread, lace and buttons so that she can make them with more quality and sell for a good price in order to earn profits and better income for her home.

Her family encouraged her to go into this business because she’s liked sewing since she was a little girl.  She started the activity three months ago because she had been taking courses to improve her embroidery to obtain more customers who would be interested in her knitwear and be able to sell it for a good price.

What she would like to do is save up to study to become a tailor and professional dressmaker in order to design more styles of clothing and earn better income as well as have more customers for the business she’s starting.

She joined the group thanks to an invitation from her neighbor, Alai R. Arias, to join the program and request a loan to work and have something to dedicate her time to.

The group members are:

María Isabel G. Gutiérrez who will use the loan to buy thread, lace and buttons for her knitwear,

María de Jesús García Zacarías who will use the loan to buy stock items for her gold jewelry business: chains, bracelets and earrings, among other, to sell in surrounding communities,

Alai R. Arias who will use the loan to buy assorted brands of powdered detergent and bar soap to sell in her community.

loans.use: To buy supplies like: thread and buttons, among others, to make knitwear.

loans.name: Mary Ekua Donkor

texts.en:
Mary Ekua Donkor O. is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician. She sells cooked plantains and beans (a dish called "red-red") at Abura. She has been in this trade for two years. Mary assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will add the loan to her capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to buy a plot of land.

In this photograph, Mary is picking out the chaff from the beans.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Yroito

texts.es: Yroito tiene 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Carmen de 38 años y sus dos menores  hijos, que estudian en el colegio y  juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Este trabajador hombre se dedica desde hace 3 años a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarro, vehículo que es propio, dice que le gusta mucho esta actividad pues se entretiene bastante y tiene bastante acogida por la zona donde vive. Paralelamente a esta actividad también tiene un taller en su casa, donde fabrica piezas en cerámica al frío que son utilizados como adornos en las casas, dentro de este trabajo, su esposa le ayuda bastante cuando tiene pedidos grandes. Él se siente muy satisfecho, pues en ambos negocios obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su taller para producir en mayor cantidad sus piezas y de esta manera espera obtener mejores ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Yroito tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para continuar con su negocio de fabricación de piezas de adornos y también quiere mandar a refaccionar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Yroito is 39 years old and lives in his own house at the side of his wife Carmen, 38 years of age, and his two young school-aged children.  Together, they struggle to get ahead.  This hard-working man has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for the past 3 years with a motocar that is his own.  He states that he enjoys this activity very much as it is entertaining and he has a lot of demand in the area where he lives.

Concurrently, he has a workshop in his house where he creates ceramic pieces to be used as home decorations.  His wife helps him with this work when he has large orders.  He feels very satisfied since both businesses allow him to earn a consistent income, allowing him to offer his family a good quality of life.  As he is a very entrepreneurial man, he has future plans to expand his workshop to produce a larger quantity of his pieces, and therefore further augment his earnings.  

This is his first loan with MFP and he commits to making his installment payments on time, as he doesn’t want to fall out of favor with the people that made possible the support that will allow him to continue to advance.  Yroito plans to invest the loan he is requesting into purchasing materials for his business making decorative pieces.  He would also like to send his motocar to be refurbished.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making his decorative ceramics, as well as to refurbish his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo de 2 años, es soltera; la señora es empleada en la administración publica, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos. El crédito lo destinará a la refacción de una habitación y de la cocina en la casa de sus padres, para vivir más cómodamente.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her parents' home in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz, with her two year-old son.  She is single.  Maria works as a civil servant and uses her income to support herself.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan.  She will use her loan to refurbish a bedroom and the kitchen in her parents' house so that they can live more comfortably.

The socio-economic analysis that we have performed qualifies Maria for a loan.

loans.use: To pay to refurbish a bedroom and the kitchen in her parents' house

loans.name: Launh

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Launh T. who has been working in this sector since 1988. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US$2.50 per day. This humble couple has two single children who are students. This rice-growing season, the family planted rice two months ago and their rice is growing well. To improve her farming business, Mrs. Launh T. needs a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizers and seeds for doing dry-season rice-field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds for doing dry-season rice-field.

loans.name: Agnes  Nyambura

texts.en:
Agnes Nyambura G. is 58 years old single mother of two daughters who are all grown up and independent. She has been selling clothes and bed sheets as a primary business and sells peanut butter as well. This business has lasted for six years with a maximum profit of Kshs.4,200 per month.  

Agnes has never borrowed from any MFI and this is her first loan from KADET LTD which she intends to buy more second hand clothes and bed sheets for sale and buy bigger containers for packing peanut butter.

The additional income she plans to plow back into the peanut butter business so that she can have enough to sell to her customers, since the demand is very high.  In future she plans to grow her business and build a house on a plot she had bought some time back.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes,bed sheets for sale and buy bigger containers for packing peanut butter

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel A. A., tiene 37 años, es soltero con la madre, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.
