Victor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro, casa e ir a la playa.

Le gusta jugar indor, conversar con los amigos.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel A. A. is 37 years old, he is single and lives with his mother and his children in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos province. He has 2 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Victor engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. He buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and he also sells them every day at his house or in the market.

The loan he is requesting will be used to sow maize by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help him economically, as thanks to it he will fulfill his needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. He dreams of buying a car, a house and of going to the beach.

He likes playing indoor sports and chatting with his friends.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a mahamri (dumplings) selling business for the past two years, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours. Dzame faces a major challenge with seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate. She hopes to establish a selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman P. is 36 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and his school-aged son. Arman is a biologist, but because of his living conditions, he has been operating a clothes trading business for about fifteen years. He sells only men’s clothing in a rented place in the Vanadzor clothes market. He brings merchandise from Yerevan once a week and orders merchandise from China once a month as well. Arman’s wife helps him with the business, and so they are able to support their family and pay rent for their business location. 

Arman needs a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a spring-season clothing assortment for his business. This is Arman’s 3rd loan from Nor Horizon; he has repaid previous loans without delay.

loans.use: To buy a spring-season clothing assortment for his business

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es: Marjorie es una mujer que tiene cierto tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad. Su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa,  es su principal fuente de ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Desde hace mas de 7 años, que tiene este negocio, la buena administración que tiene han hecho que salga adelante. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes pues se acerca la temporada de clases.
texts.en: Marjorie is a woman who has been working with Fundación León 2000 for some time now. This is not the first time she takes out a loan as she is a very enterprising person who enjoys what she does. She buys and sells clothing for a living, this being her sole source of income. She has been in business for over 7 years, and her good managing skills have helped the business thrive. For this reason, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise like undergarments, pants, shirts, skirts, and suits as the school year approaches.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Jose esta ubicado en el Barrio San Jose de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el grupo esta integrado por 3 personas, dos mujeres y un hombre, todos ellos tienen bastante tiempo de conocerse y trabajar juntos, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
 
la señora Dania C. A. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, y es notable que lo a sabido administrar, luce bien ordenado y surtido.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que los precios de venta son accesibles para los habitantes de dicho barrio.

la joven Seydi Xiomara L. C. esta soltera y se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de perro, tajaditas de platano fritas y almuezos.
Seydi es una mujer luchadora y eficaz en sus negociaciones, es muy astuta y siempre cumple sus espectativas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas.

el señor Alex Adan C. A. esta soltero y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, desempeña esta actividad desde ya hace 4 años y tiene su clientela ya establecida.
el señor Alex utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio.

los integrantes de este grupo tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante con sus negocios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The San Jose group is located in San José neighborhood, in the city of San Lorenzo.  The group has three members: two women and one man.  They have all known each other and worked together for quite a long time.  We will now describe the different business activities that they pursue.

Dania C. A. is married and her business is selling essential food products.  She has a grocery store in her home and it is clear that she has known how to run it.  It is well ordered and stocked.  Her customers prefer her store since her prices are affordable for locals in the neighborhood.

Seydi Xiomara L. C. is a young, single woman.  Her business is selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, slices of fried plantain and lunches.  Seydi is a determined woman and efficient in her negotiations.  She is very shrewd and always fulfils her expectations.  She will use her loan to buy supplies for making her snacks.

Alex Adan C. A. is single and his business is selling essential food products.  He has a grocery store located in his home.  He has been in this business for 4 years and has an established customer base  He will use his loan to buy groceries to stock his business.

The members of this group have a great desire to get ahead in their businesses and provide their families with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, chicken, potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, green chilis, garlic, lemons, salt, beans, rice, corn, soft drinks, toilet paper, butter, margarine, oil, soap, milk, bananas, cabbage, tomato sauce, juice, candies, cheese, condiments, sausages, bread, coffee and cookies

loans.name: Jesefa Alejandrina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Josefa, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de  22 y 20 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella y su esposo tienen un puesto en el mercado de Santa Ana en el cual venden frutas como melón, sandia, piñas, papayas, plátanos, etc. Trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, nos cuenta que llevan 17 años que se dedican a esta actividad y que les va muy bien, las frutas compran a los agricultores o también en el mismo mercado a mayoristas.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas para la venta. Está en el Banco comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos han sido de gran ayuda.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Luz Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Santa Ana. This city is known for its beautiful scenery and beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

Here we met Jesefa who is 52 years old. She has a common-law marriage from which she has two children who are 22 and 20 years old. They are in college and still live at her house. Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a stand at the Santa Ana market where they sell fruits like melon, watermelon, pineapple, papaya, bananas, etc. They work every day from 5am to 3pm. She tells us that they have been in this business for 17 years and it has gone well for them. They buy the fruits from farmers or at the same wholesale market.

This loan is for the purchase of more fruits to sell. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans have been a great help.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy melon, watermelon, papaya, bananas, pineapple, and all types of fruit

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova L. is from the village of St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is 34 years old.  Nova is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Nova owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community.  Nova has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nova joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nova has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Nova is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk food.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nova from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and junk food

location.town: St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sarah has a business selling dry fish, which she has had for two years. She also has a second business of outside catering.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fish and cooking oil for making chapatti. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young sisters. In the future, Sarah hopes to build a house.

Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cooking oil for making chapatti.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
El cliente Félix Vílchez vive en el municipio de El Sauce del departamento de León. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y  trabaja actualmente en su propio negocio, el cual consiste en elaboración de albardas donde tiene su propio mercado, le vende a ganaderos de la zona, el negocio está ubicado en su propia casa de habitación  tiene 20 año de estar laborando en esta actividad.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de Paquetón, hierro, acido y estribos donde esto le permitirá elaborar mas albardas y venderlas a distinto comerciante de la zona y crecer con su negocio y mercado, ya que su cambio se ha notado con los financiamientos otorgado por Ceprodel. 

Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Felix lives in the municipality of El Sauce in the department of Leon. He has 2 children in his care and he currently has his own business. He makes saddles and he has his own clientele. He sells to the farmers in the region. His business is located in his home and he has been in business for 20 years. 

He will use his loan to purchase foam, steel, acid, and stirrups to make more saddles and to sell them to the different merchants in the region. He will grow his business and his market, especially because a change has been noticed through the help of the loans granted to him by Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). 

This will help him keep his family's well being.

loans.use: to purchase foam, steel, acid, and stirrups to make saddles.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where she has been farming for ten years. She sells her milk, beans, maize, and eggs to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family. 

Rose has requested a loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the dairy cow that she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from the sale of milk will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. She faces the challenge of diseases and food shortage during the dry season. She hopes to acquire at least five dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson, 36, is married to Rose; they are blessed with three children aged nine, seven and five years old. For the past ten years Nelson has been a crop farmer. The business earns him a monthly income of 18,500 KES.

This is Nelson’s third loan from KADET LTD; he has successfully managed to pay off his previous loans. He will use the funds to buy twenty piglets, pig feed, and also to dig a well.

Nelson will use the anticipated profits to buy another donkey to supply water to his neighborhood. He hopes to educate his children as well as operate a large-scale pork operation to supply big hotels in the country.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and to dig a well.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, Mwanaisha has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the availability of charcoal is lower compared to demand. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 Mwanaisha wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Cyr Castelan

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, marie et pere de 6 ans dont l'age varie entre 4 et 21 ans. A l'arret de ses etudes en classe de 3e, il se lance dans la vente des vaisselles en 1999. Il s'approvisionne dans les grands depots de la place, les magasins de chinois et libanais.
Il a des ventes regulieres de 50.000 a 200.000frs par jour, et a des strategies de ventes pour encourager ses meilleurs clients.

A l'octroi de son pret, il compte renforcer  son stock en achetant 10 douzaines de series de bols, 10 douzaines de series de verres de champagne,10 douzaines de verres de vins, des bols en porcelaine et services de tableset des series en aluminium
A l'avenir , il veut ouvrir un grand magasin de vaisselles, faire la vente en gros et details des couverts ,epargner et a la longue aller en Chine pour acheter de la porcelaine pour faire des livraisons sur place.
texts.en:
Cyr Castelan is 41 years old, married and the father of six children, aged 4 to 21. When he stopped studying after third grade, he opened a hardware store in 1999. He gets his supplies at the big warehouses and stores run by Chinese and Lebanese. He has a steady turnover of 50,000 to 200,000 CFA francs per day. His business strategy consists in developing customer loyalty.

When his loan is granted, he will use it to increase his inventory. He will buy 10 dozens of sets of bowls, 10 dozens of sets of champagne glasses, 10 dozens of wine glasses, china bowls, cutlery and aluminum tableware. In future he wants to open a large hardware store, sell cutlery wholesale and retail, save some money, and ultimately travel to China to buy porcelain hardware for resale at his place.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, china bowls, champagne glasses and wine glasses.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Del Carmen le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de construir la barda.
Doña Maria Del Carmen pagara el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo, de limpieza en una casa partículas. 
Desea que su familia este protegida y segura en su casa ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Maria Del Carmen needs a fence around the house.

She is applying for a loan to buy materials - cinder blocks, cement, and rods - and to pay the person who is in charge of building the fence.

Doña Maria Del Carmen will repay the loan with the income she gets from her job house cleaning.

She wants her family to be safe and sound at home and as a single mother with two children for who she is responsible, she wants the best for them.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, se dedica a la venta de medicina, vive con sus dos hijos en casa familiar, el negocio lo administra desde hace más de 20 años,  lo ha manejado de forma ambulante pero hoy en día tiene un local fijo en el mercado municipal.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicinas y  además comprar un estante para almacenar la mercadería, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar las instalaciones del negocio y poder atender de una mejor manera a los clientes.
Para él la aspiración es crecer con el negocio, generar mayores ingresos para su familia, y realizarse como comerciante.
texts.en:
Manuel sells medicine.  He lives with his two children in the family home.  He’s run the business for over 20 years.  He was a street vendor for a long time but now has a fixed locale in the municipal market.

He is asking for the loan to buy medicine and also to buy a display case to store his merchandise.  This investment will help him improve his business’ furnishings and to be able to provide better attention to his customers.

His wish is to grow in business and generate more family income and to become fulfilled as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy a display case and to buy medicine.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Corazon has a shop that sells spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for 21 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy spices & food seasonings for sale.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices & food seasonings for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 
Gina has a food shop that makes and sells native delicacies snacks such as biko, palitaw, and banana cue.  She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is 43 years old and lives in Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two school-age children. 

Felma runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. It is a habal-habal, as folks call it, that carries two to six passengers and normally is seen in rural areas, especially mountainous places. She has had this business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 from GDMPC to repair her motorcycle for better service.  

Felma has been a GDMPC member since 2010. This current loan is her fifth. All previous loans were repaid in full. 

In the future, Felma hopes to expand and improve service and seating capacity to have more income and sustain the everyday needs of the family. She plans to repair her house, too.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle for better service.

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.en:
38-year-old Reginalda earns a living through farming. She tills land in Trinidad, Bohol with her husband. They primarily grow rice crops to sell.

Reginalda has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. Reginalda hopes for this loan to help them achieve an abundant harvest.

Reginalda has six children between the ages of 7 and 18. She hopes to have a stable income that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es:
Luís Daniel tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nacaome, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo.
Luis se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 4 años, vende semitas, galletas, polvorones, pudines, pan blanco entre otros, los vende en diferentes barrios y colonias de Nacaome, siendo las pulperías y mercaditos sus principales clientes.
Luís Daniel utilizara el credito para comprar los materiales para la fabricacion del pan.
el sueño y anhelo de Luis es formar una cadena de panaderías y reposterías a nivel del departamento de Valle y Choluteca.
las ganancias las necesita para darle un buen estudio a su hijo y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luís Daniel, 32, lives in the city of Nacome.  He’s married and has a son.  He’s been selling bread for the last four years.  He sells “semitas,” “polvorones,” “pudines,” and white bread, among others.   He sells in various neighborhoods in Nacome; his main customers are grocery stores and small markets.

Luís Daniel will use the loan to buy bread baking supplies.  His dream and hope is to form a chain of bakeries and pastry shops at the departmental level in Valle and Choluteca.  He needs the profits to provide his son with a good education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 02 hijos en edad escolar.  La señora estudio educación secundaria.
Trabaja desde hace dos ciclos con el Movimiento Manuela R., su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de puertas, ventanas, etc, todo  de metales.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 400.00 nuevo soles, comprará fierro, tubos, fierro liso y angulares, en el negocio tiene trabajadores que la apoyan con los pedidos, nos cuenta que ella se presenta a licitaciones.
Su esposo trabaja en el municipio. 
Desea tener una empresa de techos y tener más maquinas para soldar, de esta manera tendrá más ingresos.-
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the communal bank “Bellavista” located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-age children. She is in secondary school. 

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela R. for two loan cycles. Her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevo soles which she invested in her business selling doors, windows, and different types of metals. With this loan of S/. 400.00 nuevo soles she will buy iron, tubing, and flat and angled iron. In her business she has workers who help her with her orders. She says that she takes bids. 

Her spouse works for the local government. She would like to have a roofing company and more welding machines, and this way she will get a higher income. What she likes about the communal bank is its responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy iron, tubing, flat and angled iron.

loans.name: Estela Yaneth

texts.es:
Estela tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos menores.

Desde hace tres años, ella ayuda a su papá en el trabajo de la agricultura, ya que él es vigilante de una funeraria en una ciudad y ella se queda trabajando en el campo. Para ayudarle a su papá con los ingresos del hogar. Ya que él viaja todos los días durante tres horas, se levanta a las 5:00 de la mañana y aborda dos buses, regresa hasta la noche, por lo no le queda tiempo para realizar los cultivos.

De donde viven hasta el lugar, donde tienen los cultivos caminan a pie treinta minutos. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, deben caminar a pie durante vente minutos y luego abordar un bus, cuando regresan a casa con los insumos, lo hacen en bus y luego los trasladan en carretillas de mano a pie caminando hasta su casa.

Estela solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar tres sacos de abono y tres litros de herbicidas, para cultivar 3500 metros cuadrados de maíz, que servirá para el consumo del hogar y el crédito será cancelado con los ingresos del papá. Teniendo los insumos a tiempo, obtendrían una buena cosecha y se ahorrara el tener que comprar el maíz. En un futuro Estela, pretende comprar una yunta de bueyes y todo lo necesario para la agricultura.
texts.en:
Estela is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents and two younger siblings. For the past three years, she has helped her father with the farming duties. He works as a security guard at a funeral home in the city while she stays and works in the field so that she can help her father with the household income. Estela’s father travels every day for three hours. He wakes up at 5am and boards two buses. When he returns home at night, he does not have the time to devote to his crops.

In the place where they live, it takes a 30-minute walk to reach the land where their crops are located. In order to buy farming supplies, they must walk 20 minutes before boarding a bus. When they return with the supplies, they must load their purchases onto wheelbarrows in order to get them home.

Estela is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy three sacks of compost and three liters of herbicides so that she can cultivate 3500 square meters of corn for household consumption. The loan will be repaid using her father’s income. By securing these supplies in time, they will achieve a good harvest and save money by not having to buy corn. In the future, Estela intends to buy a yoke of oxen and everything she needs for farming.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en: Nariman is a 37-year-old man who sells TVs, DVD players, vacuum cleaners, refrigerator and other electrical goods. He has 10 years of experience and his shop is very popular as it has a good location in the central market. He is married and has two children. He works from early in the morning till late night. He is very friendly and polite with customers. Nariman`s monthly income is 350 AZN. In Imishli city there are few shops which sells wide range of electrical goods and he has a lot of orders from customers. That is why he applied for 1000 AZN loan. He will use it to purchase high demand goods such as vacuum cleaners and washing machines.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum cleaners and washing machines to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Schekina-Power Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SCHEKINA-POWER est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Cica est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Cica est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Cica  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Cica est mariée à un certain Benoît. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à leur charge. Cica vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Cica vend depuis huit ans, du maïs, de l’haricot, et du pain dans un quartier du Bénin. Cica s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Cica sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SCHEKINA-POWER, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Schekina-Power group is made up of three people who live in the same quarter. This is the fifth time that the group has sought a loan from ALIDé, in order to boost their business. The group's leader, Cica, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 46 years old, lives in the Benin and is married to Benoît. She did not attend school. The couple has five children, all of whom attend school, and three of whom are in the couple's care. Cica lives with her husband and children. The couple look after the family's needs together. In order to see to the family's needs, for the past eight years Cica has sold corn, beans and bread in a quarter of the Benin. She sources her goods from a market in the Benin. In order to satisfy her clients and to boost her revenue, she and the other members of the Schekina-Power group are seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous four loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn, beans and bread

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Аъзамчон житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Аъзамчон занимается развозкой пассажиров по городу. Он в этой области уже шесть лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Azamjon lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has two children. His children are in high school. Azamjon works driving passengers around the city. He has been doing this work for six years. He is taking out a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Wilmer Efrain

texts.es:
Wilmer Efraín tiene 20 años de edad es casado tiene 1 hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 4 meses de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura, construcción, empleados locales. Las compra  y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la calidad de vida en el hogar, comprar semillas, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Wilmer espera obtener buena producción manejando y administrando bien el dinero del crédito. El sueño es poder tener casa y carro propio.
 Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es el clima, mucho invierno y en veces mucho verano.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval, día de la Madre.
texts.en:
Wilmer Efraín is 20 years old. He is married and has 1 child. He lives with his wife and with the 4 month old baby, in Guaranda Province of Bolivar.

The member is a member of the VRC Ventana which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in the parish of Julio Moreno which is in the canton of Guaranda, a distance of 30 minutes from the office. The residents of the community work in different fields such as agriculture, farming, breeding of animals (pigs, chickens, sheep), sales and construction.

Wilmer works in agriculture and in construction, locally employed. Buying and selling takes place in Guaranda. He is asking for a loan in order to improve his quality of life at home, buying seeds, fertilizers, supplies and compost. 

Wilmer is expecting to have a good crop, handling and administrating capably the money from the loan. His dream is to be able to have his own house and car.

The challenges that he has encountered is the weather, a long winter or sometimes too much summer. 

In his free time he enjoys the festivities of Carnival and Mother’s Day.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, supplies and compost in order to improve his quality of life at home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for six years. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Afiavi Bricette

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Bricette est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Elle distribue des plateaux d'oeuf dans un marché de la place et à d'autres bonnes dames de son quartier. Dans le but de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, elle a sollicite et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus consistants et de diversifier son activité, de mieux participer aux dépenses et aux mieux être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Bricette est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Elle distribue des plateaux d'oeuf dans un marché de la place et à d'autres bonnes dames de son quartier. Dans le but de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, elle a sollicite et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus consistants et de diversifier son activité, de mieux participer aux dépenses et aux mieux être de sa famille.

Married and the mother of two children, Bricette is the leader of the two-person group.  She distributes egg trays in the local market and to other women in her neighborhood.  With the goal of better satisfying her customers, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev.  She wants to make a more consistent profit and to diversify her business so she can help out more with the household expenses and an improved standard of living for her family.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Afiavi Bricette from  Benin

loans.use: buy 20 egg trays

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia lives in Rawalpindi with her family. A stay-at-home mother of three, she wants to contribute to her family financially. In order to fulfill her dream and give her children a better life she plans to start her own business of stitching clothes. So to become self-employed she has decided to seek a loan to help her buy a stitching machine to get her business started. She says her motivations are her children and she wants to become a role model for them.

loans.use: To buy a stitching machine

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a very responsible, working and lovely person; she works as taxi driver but she also sells beauty products by order. At weekends she sells tamales (It is a popular mexican meal), however even with this, Rosalinda does not cover all the home expenses, she is alone, so that she has to support her family payments. She comments that the maintenance of her taxi and her products are expensive, so that she does not have cash to be supplied them, so she does not have a bigger capacity of products that allows her to increase her sales and incomes.

Rosalia just wants to work to continue supporting to her family; she needs a loan of $750 USD to purchase merchandise that allow her to increase the capacity of her beauty products and the quantity of tamales. She needs your support and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Rosalia es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y entregada a su familia; trabaja como taxista pero además vende productos de belleza por pedido. Los fines de semana vende tamales, sin embargo aun y con esto, Rosalia no cubre con los gastos del hogar ya que ella sola enfrenta estos pagos. Comenta que el mantenimiento del taxi, así como los productos y los insumos de los productos que vende son caros y no tiene efectivo para abastecerse y tener una mayor capacidad de productos que le permita aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.

Rosalinda solo quiere trabajar para seguir ayudando a si familia, necesita de $750 USD para comprar mercancía e insumos que le permitan aumentar la capacidad de productos de belleza y la cantidad de tamales. Ella necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paulina O. is 40 years old, a woman full of life who does her business activities all day long through. She hopes to receive a loan of $800 to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more creates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is originally from the town of San Juan de Dios, in the state of Nuevo León. He is married and has three children, ages 10, 13, and 15. Looking for better opportunities, Francisco left his village to live in the city of Monterrey, trying to find a way to offer a better quality of life to his family. He observed that his new neighborhood did not have a shop selling the necessities to his neighbors, so five years ago he decided to open his own business selling groceries.

With the help of his family, he has succeeded in making his business grow. In order to offer better service, Francisco is soliciting a loan for $650 which he will use to buy merchandise in order to increase the variety of his products. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. Francisco is grateful for your generosity and that you are willing to be part of his business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Francisco es originario de la localidad de San Juan de Dios, en el estado de Nuevo León, es casado y tiene tres hijos de 10,13 y 15 años de edad. En busca de mejores oportunidades Francisco salió de su pueblo para vivir en la ciudad de Monterrey, tratando de encontrar la manera de ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, observó que en su nueva colonia no había una tienda que cubriera las necesidades de los vecinos, así que decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, desde hace cinco años.

Con la unión familiar han logrado hacer crecer su negocio, y para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio, Francisco solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, para incrementar la variedad de sus productos, él se compromete a devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Francisco agradece tu generosidad y que aceptes ser parte de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Many storekeepers and shop owners know Carol R. when people speak of her. Twenty-four years old and single, Carol contributes to the financial support of her family. At the age of sixteen, she was taught by her grandmother how to weave and make handicrafts and that’s just what she does for income. When everything is complete, the product is then sold to public stores.

Carol's heartfelt gratitude goes out to her elderly grandmother for imparting her knowledge to her granddaughter as well as to S.P.B.D. for this loan. It has been used to better the outcome of the products sold. When the money is plenteous, Carol will think of settling down.

loans.use: Establish Micro-Business

loans.name: Norma Suyapa

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Norma Suyapa. I make fried snakes at my home and then sell them at the local market in my city. I've been dong this job for a number of years, earning income to help with expenses and increasing my family's income. Thanks to God this business has helped me earn a living and allow me to take care of my daughter and tend to my husband. My greatest desire is to improve our living arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombres es Norma Suyapa, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de Chicharas y Chicharones, (productos para el Consumo Humano), los que elaboro en mi casa de habitación y los distribuyo en el Mercado Municipal de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos familiares. Gracias a Dios este negocio me permite generar ingresos y lo mas importante es que puedo cuidad a mi hija y atender a mi esposo, Mi mayor deseo es mejorar mi vivienda.

loans.use: Purcahse pork loins, firewood and plastic bags.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma I. F. is a 32-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. She runs a retail shop selling food items and household utensils. She has been doing this business for the past seven years, and now wants to expand her shop into a bigger supplies shop. Fatuma is in need of $325 to help expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Anorjon

texts.en: Anorjon is an experienced businesswoman as she has had her business of selling curtains for over 5 years. Her husband and son are her business partners. Her husband is responsible for making purchases from Dubai, Saudi Arabia. She, with her son, sells curtains at her business place in J. Rasulov market, Tadjikistan. Her business is going well and she has many constant clients who make orders according to their individual styles. She has attracted many clients by the variety of her curtains. Now she is requesting extra capital for making the next purchase of modern curtains.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 rolls of curtains of different sizes, from 1.5 to 3 metres wide.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana is 50 years old. She lives with her family in Aley. Joumana helps support her 4 children. She knits and produces scarves, bags etc. Joumana needs to buy material to create more work to sell. This is the first time Joumana is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy material for her work

loans.name: Cécile Fifonsi

texts.fr:
Miss Cécile Fifonsi M. was born on September 8, 1985 in COTONOU in the LITTORAL area in southern BENIN. She is single and has no children and sells household soaps, biscuits, sardines and other items in MISSEBO (a market in DANTOKPA). She is a very moral person and and her clientele grows from day to day. She needs this credit to meet the increasing needs of her customers and to answer the competition.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle Cécile Fifonsi M. est née le 08 septembre 1985 à COTONOU dans le Département du LITTORAL au Sud du BENIN. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et vend au détail des savons de marseille, des biscuits, des sardines et autres à MISSEBO (marché connexe à DANTOKPA). Elle a une bonne moralité et fait partie de celles de nos clients dont la clientèle s’accroît au jour le jour. Elle a donc besoin de ce crédit pour faire face à la croissante demande de sa clientèle et aussi pour répondre à la concurrence.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 cartons of BF et FANICO soap

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna is 22 years old and is single woman. Husna is a cosmetics seller. She started her business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Yoeun S. and his wife married in 2001. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family lives along Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Yoeun and his wife have been weavers for six years. It’s a skill they learned from their relatives. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village who sells them  in Phnom Penh. Besides weaving, Yoeun buys horse for resale as well.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase silk materials for weaving and for buying horses to resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy horses for resale.

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti Y. is a 39 year old lady who is in the food stall business for almost 10 years. The items she offered, include drinks, indonesia fruit salad and vegetables with boiled leave covered rice. Her daily activities started by going to the market at 7:00 AM to buy ingredients for her food stall, like: vegetables, tofu, peanuts, etc at the Adat Market in Pamungan village. After all food items to be sold are finished, Siti Y. opens her food stall at about 9:00 AM. Usually busy time are between 9:30-11:00 AM, where her food stall is filled with good ladies customers from mothers and young ladies who like to taste the indonesian salad, and other customers who like to taste the vegetables with boiled leave covered rice. From this business Siti Y. could save part of her profits for additional capital. She likes to enlarge her food stall, therefore needs additional business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Siti Y. adalah seorang wanita berusia 39 tahun yang menekuni usaha warung makan selama hampir 10 tahun. Adapun makanan yang dijualnya seperti minuman, rujak buah dan lontong sayur. Kegiatannya sehari-hari adalah dimulai dengan pergi ke pasar pada pukul 07.00 untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk keperluan warungnya seperti sayur, tahu, kacang dan keperluan lainnya di Pasar Adat Desa Pamungan. Setelah semua makanan yang akan dijual telah siap, Siti Y. baru membuka warungnya pada pukul 09.00. Biasanya antara pukul 09.30 sampai pukul 11.00 merupakan jam sibuk, dimana warungnya dipenuhi pelanggan baik dari kalangan ibu-ibu dan remaja putri yang ingin menikmati rujak, dan pelanggan lain yang ingin menikmati lontong sayur. Dari usahanya ini, Siti Y. bisa menyisihkan dari sebagian keuntungannya untuk dijadikan modal lagi. Dia berkeinginan untuk membuat warungnya lebih besar lagi, karena itu ia memerlukan modal tambahan.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Manambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Iliganoa

texts.en: Iliganoa A., 36, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancakes, pork cakes, and ice cakes business. She sells to the villagers and general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Iliganoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will also help her with her many family obligations. Her husband works as a laborer for the Government and also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To buy materials to start a business i.e.  bag of flour, bag of sugar, box mutton flaps, and flavorings

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur S. is a 27-year-old man who has been selling tableware, vacuum cleaners, irons and other products in the small village of Sabirabad since 2000. Most of his customers are brides and recently-married people. This kind of store is very popular in Azerbaijan. Seymur would like to expand his business so he has applied for a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are students. She lives with her husband Edinson, who is a sales clerk and who always supports her in her business. Monica sells jewelry products (earrings, necklaces, hoop earrings among other types) as well as a variety of plush items, caps, clothing etc. She has been doing this for 5 years, taking up several hours a day. She very much enjoys her work, since learning the art of jewelry has been going very well for her and she is happy to see her business grow little by little.

Her desire, and her motive for requesting this loan, is to rent another shop and have a clothing shop, since it is a profitable business, particularly where it is located in a commercial zone. In the future she wants to be a large-scale exporter of these products, both of raw materials and completed jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Mónica tiene 40 años, es madre de dos hijos que están estudiando y vive junto a su esposo Edinson, quien es trabajador dependiente, y siempre la apoya mucho en su negocio. Mónica se dedica a vender productos de bijoutería (aretes, collares, aros, entre otras variedades) además de variedades de peluches, gorros, ropa y otros. Hace esto desde cinco años, ocupándole varias horas al día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aprende este arte de la bijoutería, y ya que le va muy bien y se siente feliz al ver que crece poco a poco.

Su deseo, y el motivo por el que pide este préstamo, es para alquilar otro local y poner una tienda de ropa, ya que es un negocio rentable, sobre todo en el lugar donde este encuentra ubicado, porque es una zona comercial. En el futuro quiere ser una gran exportadora de estos productos, tanto en materia prima, como en la joya trabajada.

loans.use: To rent additional business space in order to sell clothing

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine and sells women's clothing and footwear in the local market. Irina has a nice variety of women's clothing and footwear items. She is very cheerful and friendly. Her first goal is to please her customers, which has added a lot to the success of her business. Irina's reasonable pricing policy helps her keep loyal clients and attract new customers.

Irina has been an entrepreneur for 10 years. Loans she has received and repaid from Nadiya Ukraine have also played a big part in the growth of her business. Presently, she has over $4000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $3000. Monthly net profit is about $600.

Today Irina is requesting a loan of 1500 Grivnas to increase assorted inventory. This financial assistance will help her increase her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it help Irina get the necessary inventory and attract more customers, but it will help her provide a stable income for her family and meet all their needs.

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Talbi

texts.ru: Назарова Талби жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 48 лет, замужем, имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается производством кисло-молочной продукцией.Реализует продукцию соседям и на  местном рынке. В данный момент вырос спрос на ее продукцию и она решила купить дойную корову. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
N. Talbi lives in the area of Vaxdat. She is 48 years old, married and has 7 children. She also has a high school education. The client is involved with the production of sour milk products. She sells her good to her neighbors and at the local market. At the current moment the demand for her products has risen and she has decided to buy a milk cow. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Ni Kadek Wiastini

texts.id: Menjadi peternak babi memang sudah ditekuni Kadek Wiastini sejak sebelum menikah karena tinggal di pedesaan kebanyakan beternak babi sudah turun-temurun dalam setiap keluarga. Meskipun suaminya sudah bekerja tetap sebagai seorang pegawai tetapi keseharian Kadek Wiastini tetap ikut berusaha baik di ladangnya maupun dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya. Sebab himpitan ekonomi terasa semakin berat saja, ditambah lagi harus menyekolahkan anaknya yang masih SMA serta menanggung seorang anaknya lagi yang belum bekerja. Melihat peluang dari beternak babi yang bisa menghasilkan keuntungan yang bagus maka Kadek ikut dalam program DINARI yang memberikan permodalan kepada para peternak babi di pedesaan. Pinjaman pertama dengan DINARI ini sebesar Rp.5000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Pinjaman ini digunakan Kadek untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi penggemukan sebagai langkah awal dalam meningkatkan populasi serta pengembangan usahanya selain memang sudah ada induk babi di kandang miliknya. Pinjaman ini juga akan digunakan untuk membeli persediaan pakan selama 5 bulan kedepan. Dengan harga bibit per ekornya Rp.350.000,- diharapkan nantinya bisa dijual minimal Rp.1.500.000,- per ekor setelah 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Keuntungan yang dicapai per bulan diharapkan berkisar Rp.200.000,- sehingga bisa menambah penghasilan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Kadek Wiastini started farming pigs even before she got married. Pig farming is a common family tradition in her village. Her husband works as a private employee, but Kadek Wiastini still works diligently in the family farm. She feels that economic condition is getting more difficult, furthermore she needs to pay high school tuition for her child. Ni Kadek Wiastini joined DINARI foundation's program and sought technical and financial help to develop her skills and productivity. She is seeking $500 6-month loan that she plans to use to purchase 4 fattening piglets. She also own a breeding pig at her farm. She will also use the loan to purchase feeds for the next 5 months. Each piglet costs $35, and she hopes that it can be sold for $150 when mature. She hopes the additional $20 projected profit can be used to increase her family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Cerro de Pazco Nº 249, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de odontología. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de joyas. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de productos de bellezas. Se dedica a su hogar y a la administración de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará perfumes, talos para cuerpos, colonias para bebes y niños, etc. 

Esmeralda se siente contenta por todas las cosas buenas que le pasan. Gracias a su habilidad su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Esmeralda belongs to the “La Positiva” community bank, located at Jr. Cerro de Pazco Nº 249, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali province. She is the 36 year old mother of 3 minor children who she still cares for. She is married, and her husband works as a dentist. With the first loan of 300 soles which she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in jewelery sales. She has been working with the community bank for 6 years. Currently she works selling beauty products. She works running her business, and as a homemaker. With this 1000 sol loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase perfume, body powder, scented lotions for babies and children, etc. Esmeralda is please with all of the good things that have happened to her. Thanks to her skill, her stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfume, body powder, scented lotions for babies and children, etc..

loans.name: Mrs. Vandy Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The group consists of eighteen people who live in Char village in Kandal province. Each will use the loan for different purposes. One of these loans is an end-of term loan. The remaining seventeen require monthL. payments.

Mrs. Vandy L. is a village bank president and the group leader. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children.Two of her children are employed at a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school. Mrs. Vandy L. sells dessert in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients for her delicious desserts. Her husband, Mr. L. Sambor, is a farmer. He cultivates rice on a small piece of land.

loans.use: to buy ingredient to make desserts

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar A. is 51 years old. He and his wife have three children and they live in a small village near Sabirabad city. In order to support his family, Bakhtiyar purchases cattle for breeding and then he sells them for meat. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. His eldest son is grown up enough to help his father in his business, which is the main source of income for the family. Bakhtiyar is requesting a loan of 1200 USD in order to purchase two more calves and the necessary fodder. The loan will be paid back over the next 15 months.

loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Charo Miluzka

texts.es:
Charo es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Charo es soltera y tiene 30 años, estudiante de Obstetricia, Charo vende ropa de niños al por mayor y menor, sus ventas los realiza en la feria de Huanta y también en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además viaja a otras ferias.
Charo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos.
Los sueños de Charo son realizarse profesionalmente, ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda en la ciudad de Huanta.
texts.en:
Charo is a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. Charo is single, 30 years old, and is studying to become an obstetrician. Charo sells children clothing in bulk and individually. She sells in the Huanta market and also in the city of Ayacucho, and she also travels to other markets. Charo needs a 1000 soles loan which will be used to purchase polo shirts. Charo's dreams are to fulfill her professional goals, to expand her business, and to have a store in the city of Huanta.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of polo shirts

loans.name: Isabel,

texts.es:
Desde hace quince años Isabel se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y extracto de rana. Además de este puesto también tiene otro propio en el mismo mercado. Este último lo alquila a una compañera. Sin embargo, dentro de poco piensa abrir una nueva tienda ahí. En la cual tiene pensado vender ropa y productos de bazar. 
Isabel tiene una familia conformada por sus cinco hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja vendiendo repuestos de carro. No obstante, actualmente solo se encarga de criar a su última hija de un año y medio, sus demás hijos ya son independientes económicamente. 
Ella ya lleva cinco años con los prestamos de EDAPORSPO, gracias a ellos ha podido aumentar su mercadería y mejorar la infraestructura de sus dos puestos.
texts.en:
For 15 years Isabel has been selling natural products and frog extract. Besides this location she also has another stall in the same market. The latter she rents to a friend. However, she is thinking of opening a new store there soon. She would like to sell clothing and other products there. Isabel has a family made up of her five children and her husband, who works selling auto parts. Currently she is raising her youngest daughter, age 1 1/2, and her other children are economically independent. She has been working with EDAPORSPO for 5 years, and thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to increase her merchandise and improve the infrastructure of her two stalls.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria del Refugio inició el negocio por que le gustan las ventas ya que ella anteriormente trabajaba en un negocio similar. Comenzó el negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años  primero fue adecuando su domicilio para poder exhibir toda la mercancia de modo que pudiera tener enfriadores y exhibidores, y comenzo con la venta de  refrescos y botanas después fue incluyendo abarrotes y otros articulos que sus clientes le iban solicitando.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $8000 que pagara en 6 meses, ya que se descapitalizo debido a una enfermedad de un familiar, y tuvo que ocupar la mayor parte de las ganancias que habia obtenido a lo largo de los años por lo que va a utilizar este prestamo para volver a surtir sus productos y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria del Refugio started in business because she likes sales and she used to work in a similar business. She started the business about 5 years ago, first out of her home where she made some changes that allowed her to show her merchandise and having freezers and counters, so she began selling soft drinks and fajitas to which she later added groceries and other articles that her customers requested. She needs a loan of MXN $8,000 which she will pay back within 6 months, since her capital has been diminishing due to the illness of a relative, for which she had to utilize the major part of her profits. She will use this loan to replenish her stock and continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools and planks

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis S. is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. They are currently pursuing education in primary school and junior high schools. Mavis’ husband works as a tailor with a specialization in school uniforms. She lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities.

Mavis trades in textiles fabrics and second-hand clothes. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes, most especially, skirts, blouses and ladies' slippers and shoes, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells in the market square of her community. She says she has a small shed in which she sells.

She has been in this business for three years and wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and shoes. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually, make very good profits. She is a member of a trust group called Mawuli.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and fabrics

loans.name: Mukalazi Safina‘S Group

texts.en:
Safina is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is 47 years old and married with eight children aged between 18 and 32. Two of her children go to school while the others are working. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with twelve people. Safina also takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Safina is a poultry famer and works from her home in Kulambiro. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Safina buys her chicks from Biyinzika famers and uses public transport to and from Kampala and Owino market where she gets chicken feed. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and water. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality.

Safina has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her fifteenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more feed and chickens. Safina is aspiring to own 2,000 chickens on her farm.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chickens

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is from the village of Purok 3, Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old, married, and has four school-age children. To make a living, Elena has a "sari-sari" or general store in which she sells daily-use products, like shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, to the local community. She has run her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more home products to sell.

location.town: Purok 3, Resthouse, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia believes that the fruit derived from her hard work is the sweetest of all. She, being a hardworking mother, feels great to see the success of her children in their own chosen careers. She is blessed with eight children: her eldest child, Sherwin, 28, is already contented in his handicraft business in Cebu; Sherly, 26, is now working abroad as a caregiver; Shari Davis, 22 years old, is a fourth-year college student taking up Industrial Technology; Sandy, 20, is also studying in college, taking an Education course; Sand Lover - 15, and Silver Valy - 14, are both studying in high school; Silverio Jr. - 9 and Sidney May - 5 are both studying in the primary level. Through working diligently and patiently, Simplicia hopes that all her children will have attained a quality education someday. She is married to Silverio and he works as a furniture maker.
 
Simplicia and her husband are helping one another in their furniture making business. She displays her products in different places to attract more customers to buy their furniture. They have to work hard in order to support the education of their six children. Simplicia needs additional capital of at least PHP 10,000 to purchase wood that they need in making furniture. She is also planning to start a poultry business for additional source of income.

Simplicia hopes that they can provide for all their children’s needs because it is their goal to give them an education. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support their business to improve it so that it becomes progressive. All their efforts and sacrifices are dedicated to their children.

loans.use: To purchase wood that they need in making furniture

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Josephine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Victoria Roxana

texts.es: Doña Victoria Cuá tiene 24 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Consumo Diario”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de vender productos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria Cuá is 24 years old, is married, and sells general products. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband work together, and they have an employee working with them. For 6 years, they have sold products from their home, which is located in Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her clients’ demands are growing, but the economic conditions in which she finds herself do not allow her to increase her capital. For this reason, she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, which she will use to buy primary materials and, in this way, increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family and allow them to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business (selling general products)

loans.name: Josifina

texts.en:
Josifina M. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay Camiguin. She is 57 years old, and is married with three adult children. To make a living, Josifina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josifina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josifina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josifina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia Delfina, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, es casada 2 tiene hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se encarga de la crianza de animales menores, ella cría cuyes al por mayor para luego venderlos y algunas aves de corral, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital para mejorar su pequeño negocio.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. is a hair dresser. Agnes owns her own beauty salon where she sells hair products such as hair creams, wigs and wiveons in addition to doing hair dressing. Her beauty salon is located in Abotoase. Agnes has been selling is a hairdresser and sells hair products such as hair creams, wigs and wiveons since 2006.



Agnes has received schooling through junior high. She is married with 2 children. She is responsible for paying school fees and feeding the children.



Her loan will be used to buy other assorted cosmetics and hair products for use at her salon. With the new profit from her expanded business, Agnes plans to save for the future!

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy other assorted cosmetics and hair products for use at her salon.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 40 years old and married with four children. She has run an embroidery business in Nairobi for two years, creating tablecloths, and ladies clothes. She describes her business as stable and having a pleasant environment. She is requesting a loan for KES 50,000 to buy a Janome machine and a Singer machine. In the future, she hopes to also purchase a printer and to build a rental home, as she expands her business.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy Janome and Singer machines.

loans.name: Saio

texts.en:
This is Saio K., a 32-year-old married woman from Wilberforce (an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone). Saio has two children, one boy and one girl, both of whom attend primary school; her husband a mechanic in Freetown. She has been a client of LAPO for some time now, and has taken out one previous loan. She is a member of a LAPO union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders. 

Saio sells her goods by walking in Freetown. She sells caustic soda (a product used by many Sierra Leoneans to make soap and cleaning supplies) and palm oil. With her first loan, she expanded her inventory of the same goods. With her new loan, Saio hopes to increase her profits again by expanding the inventory of current products.

loans.use: Purchase additional supplies of palm oil and caustic soda for sale

loans.name: Tenjil

texts.en:
This micro-entrepreneur is a seaman’s wife named Mrs. Tenjil R.. She is 27 years of age and is a resident of Mantic, Tangub City. Unfortunately, the couple still has no child yet. They wish to have a baby someday to complete their family.

Even if she is receiving a monthly allotment from her husband and earning an income from her parcel of riceland, Tenjil still loves to engage in business because she doesn’t want to depend solely on her husband’s income. She opened her little sari-sari (variety) store a year ago. Now she is earning an average income from her store of P1,500 a month which contributes to her income.

Tenjil joined Paglaum MPC a year ago and is so thankful and indeed, feels it a great honor to be a member of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

For her 2nd loan, Tenjil is applying for P35,000 to finance the cultivation and production of her parcel of riceland and to add to the capital of her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To finance the cultivation and production of her riceland and to use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana C. R. de 29 años de edad, vive en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad, su prima, una tía y su abuelo. Roxana posee una venta de camisas y pantalones para hombre, los cuales los comercializa desde hace 6 años. Cada día Roxana se dispone a vender lo más posible, todo por el bienestar de su pequeña hija, debido a que es madre soltera ella deber trabajar muy duro y poder brindarle una vida estable a su pequeña, así mismo debe aportar para los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de ropa, sobre todo para esta época navideña en el cual las personas cuentan con mayor disponibilidad para comprar, Roxana desea poder aumentar sus ventas y contar la capacidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Roxana C. R., age 29, lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad together with her l5 year old daughter, her cousin, an aunt, and her grandfather. For six years, Roxana has had a shop selling men’s shirts and pants. Each day, Roxana gets ready to sell as much as possible, all for the benefit of her little girl. Because she is a single mother she has to work very hard to be able to offer a stable life to her daughter. At the same time, she has to contribute to the household expenses. This is why she is applying for a loan which will allows her to purchase a greater quantity and variety of clothes, especially for this Christmas season in which people want a greater variety of items for purchase. Roxana wants to be able to increase her sales and her ability to offer a better life to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing of different colors and sizes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
