Ramona B. is from the village of Poblacion in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Ramona is widowed and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Ramona manufactures and sells nipa huts, houses with a bamboo frame and a thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm. Ramona has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ramona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ramona is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be Ramona's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née en 1981 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mais Emilienne vit a Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 15 ans.  Mariée à AREMOU Céfou, un chauffeur, Emilienne est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Emilienne n’a fait que l’école primaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure.  Emilienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cotonou et le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Depuis près de 4 ans, Emilienne exerce ce métier de coiffure et parallèlement à cette activité, Emilienne vend des produits de beauté et de coiffure à la devanture de sa maison.  Emilienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Emilienne a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter plus de produits de beauté. Dans l'avenir, Emilienne envisage acheter sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
A. Emilienne was born in 1981 in Ouidah, a historic town in Bénin. However, she has been living in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, for 15 years. Married to AREMOU Céfou, a driver, Emilienne is the mother of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school.

Emilienne only attended primary school and then learned hairdressing. She lives with her husband and children in Cotonou, and she and her husband share in providing for the family. For almost four years, Emilienne has been working at hairdressing, and at the same time, she has been selling cosmetics and hairdressing products outside her house. She gets her products at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin.

Emilienne has already received and correctly reimbursed one loan from ALIDé. She is requesting another loan to bolster her business and buy more cosmetics. In future, Emilienne plans to buy her own plot of land.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hairdressing products and cosmetics

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en:
Nana adjoa E. sells smoked fish at Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Nana adjoa has been selling smoked fish for some time now. She helps her husband pay school fees, bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process (smoking the fish) for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process (smoking the fish) for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Yolanda son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y equipar su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank "Nobleza" (nobility).

Yolanda lives with her partner. She is 33 years old and has three children.

Yolanda has a store in her house where she sells groceries, an activity that she carries out every day. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Yolanda's dreams are to offer a good education to her children and to furnish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Thierno Bocar

texts.fr: Monsieur Thierno Bocar N. est un jeune commerçant  de 27 ans qui habite dans la localité de Baye Laye à Guediawaye. Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2009.Il a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Il a démarré  son activité de commerce en tenant une table  devant chez lui. Mais par la suite il s’est oriente vers le commerce de denrées en gérant  une boutique d’alimentation générale. Il capitalise une expérience  de 13 ans dans son activité. Les moments les plus intéressants  de son commerce coïncident  avec les week-ends et les fins de mois. Monsieur N. sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer ses marchandises et augmenter son fond de roulement. Son objectif est de satisfaire le maximum aux besoins de sa clientèle.  Ainsi son prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son offre de  produits et de maximiser ses bénéfices  de sorte qu’il sera en mesure de mieux faire face aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Thiemo Bocar N. is a young businessman, who is 27 years old and lives in the town of Baye Laye in Guediawaye. He has been a member-shareholder of the U-IMCEC savings institution since September 2009. He has already benefited from a loan. He began his commercial activity on a table in front of his home. However, he then turned to the food business managing a general grocery store. He has built up an experience of 13 years in this business. The most interesting times in his business are the weekends and the end of the month. Mr. N. is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs to build up his stock of goods and increase his working capital. His aim is to satisfy customer demand to the maximum. His loan will allow him to increase his product offer and maximise his profits so that he will be able to provide better for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Lusvi Francisca

texts.es:
Lusvi tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, caracterizado por su geografía accidentada y por que la mayoría de sus habitantes se encuentran dispersos en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace tres años decidió crear un negocio que le permitiera obtener ingresos permanentes para apoyar a sus padres y salir adelante. Fue asi que empezó a vender golosinas de manera ambulante. El negocio tiene muy buena acogida debido al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, durante el tiempo que viene trabajando en esta actividad, su negocio ha ido creciendo y consolidándose.

Lusvi desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres, haciendo algunas refacciones y terminando de construir la casa en donde viven, ella ha creído conveniente poner piso a su vivienda ya que actualmente su piso es de tierra, siguiendo este objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Lusvi es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre vela por el bienestar se su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria e inatalar un negocio en su propia vivienda. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lusvi is 41 years old, is single, and lives with her family in the Olmos district. It is an area of rugged geography where most people live in dispersed rural areas. It is part of the Lambayeque province and is an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Three years ago, Lusvi decided to start a business that would allow her to have a permanent income and help support her parents. She began by selling sweets as a roving vendor. The business was well received due to the good way she relates to her customers. Since that time, the business has grown and consolidated. Lusvi wants to improve the quality of life for her parents by making some repairs and finishing construction on their house. She would like to install a floor, as the current floor is make of dirt. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme for a loan of 1500 soles. Lusvi is a hardworking woman and she always looks out for the well being of her family. Her greatest desire is to continue growing her business and install a store in her own house. She has worked with Edpyme before and has always been punctual and responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a floor in her house

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la coiffure, en 2006 elle a ouvert  son propre atelier de coiffure, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de produits cosmétiques qui lui réussit bien la demande de produits cosmétiques est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de mèches tissages et divers produits cosmétiques.
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Avec les profits de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady learned the hairdressing trade and in 2006 opened her own hairdressing salon. She complemented this business later on with the sale of cosmetic products, and this has worked well. The demand for cosmetic products is high, and for this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES, in order to buy hairpieces, hairweaves and various cosmetic products. She is married and mother to three children. With the profits from her business she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairpieces, hairweaves and various cosmetic products

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Mrs. Sophon P. is 43 years old and lives in Kor village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bunly Chea (pictured), are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Bunly Chea receives a small salary from construction work. This couple has four children; one is a silk weaver while the other three are students and also help their parents with farming.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land

loans.name: Khemsan

texts.en: Mrs. Khemsan N. is a 30-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Choes village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice.  To help with the farming, Mrs. Khemsan N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay out for labor to plow her farm. Her husband, Mr. Vy Ngoy, is a sugar palm maker and a cow middleman who earns a small income to support his family. This couple has two children, who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and have her farm plowed

loans.name: Laura Yesenia

texts.es:
Laura tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona dedicada principalmente a actividades agrícolas como la ganadería y el cultivo de tabaco, se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, ella adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Chiclayo y en Cayaltí, Laura trata de ofrecer productos de calidad y brindar un trato amable, gracias a estas acciones se ha hecho conocida en el medio y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes que prefieren comprar en su negocio.

Laura desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan alcanzar su objetivo.

Laura es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre se esfuerza para ayudar a sus padres a salir adelante. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y honrada.
texts.en:
Laura, 34, is single and lives with her parents in Nueva Arica district, a mostly agricultural area where the main activities are cattle-raising and tobacco growing; it’s located an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last three years she has run a grocery store located in her home. She acquires her stock in Chiclayo and Cayaltí; she tries to offer high-quality products and provide pleasant customer service. Thanks to this, she has become well-known in the area and currently has a group of regular customer s that prefers to buy in her store. Laura wants to expand her business buying more merchandise so that her sales will increase and thus her profits will too. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa, therefore, for a 2000 new sol loan that will help her reach this goal. Laura is a hard-working woman who always strives to help her parents get ahead. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a level headed and honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of blender

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana pertenece al Banco comunal Sarita y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones y los ahorros voluntarios además que la distraen mucho las reuniones.
Ana es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años, Ana tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía. Además Ana junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con la cual trabaja su esposo. Ana solicita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo y limón.
Ana vive en casa alquilada y desea tener casa propia, tener un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the Sarita community bank and what she likes best are the the skills she has picked up and saving. She also enjoys the meetings. Ana is partnered and has a 2-year old son. She operates a stand in the city's Abasto market where she sells vegetables, work that she does from 5 in the morning until noon. She and her husband also operate a moto-taxi business. Ana is applying for a 1600-soles loan that she use to buy pumpkins and lemons for resale. Ana lives in a rented house and she would like to have a house of her own. She also has a "carro" (car or cart?) for her husband's work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es:
Dora Clemencia R. C., tiene 24 años.  Es soltero  y vive con la mama, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Edison.

Dora es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Dora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños seguir adelante con la bendición de Dios y el apoyo de la cooperativa San Jose. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dora Clemencia R. C. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her mother in Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. She has a son named Edison.

Dora is a member of the Communal Bank “Valle Alto” (High Valley), which is located in the district of Voluntad de Dios and an hour and half away from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture. This the second loan they have received from Cooperativa San José.

Dora is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and beans. She buys her supplies each month in the city of Ventanas and sells her products at the Peña commercial market which is in the same area.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans. She views this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams include moving forward with God’s blessing and the support of Cooperativa San José. The challenges she faces include the pests and diseases that can impact her crops.

Dora enjoys working so that she can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Urkupiña Group

texts.es:
“URKUPIÑA” es el nombre de una Asociación Comunal que está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Panamericana, cuenta con nueve integrantes, ocho socias y un varón.

La presidenta de la asociación, Silvia es madre de tres niños, se dedica a la artesanía en joyas. Ella aprendio este oficio en un Curso de Joyería que pasó hace tres años, para reforzar este aprendizaje ve  programas de la televisión que tratan de la elaboración de joyas.  Su primer préstamo es para la compra de material.

Las otras personas que integran la asociación comunal tienen negocios diferentes, como: producción de chompas y chalinas, ventas de cosméticos, elaboración y venta de muebles, venta de madera, venta de cosméticos en variedad, costura de vaqueros, venta de queso y leche, venta de artículos de limpieza.
texts.en:
“URKUPIÑA” is the name of a community association that is starting its first cycle in the Panamericana center. It has nine new members, 8 women and one man. The association president, Silvia, is the mother of three children. She works in artisanal jewelry. She learned this profession in a jewelry course three years ago. To reinforce what she learned, she watches television programs about making jewelry. Her first loan is to purchase materials. The other people that make up the community association have different businesses, such as: making sweaters and shawls, selling cosmetics, making and selling furniture, selling wood, selling a variety of cosmetics, sewing bluejeans, selling cheese and milk, and selling cleaning items.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Harriet has a business selling dried fish, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fish to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy more food at home.  In the future, Harriet hopes to own a house for her family.     

 Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to expand a business and become self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie D., from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 50 years old., married, and has five grown children. To make a living, Lanie owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant, she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Lanie's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora, con mucho deseo de seguir trabajando aunque es de edad muy avanzada. Su negocio que inicio hace varios años la venta de ropa, zapatos, peluches que junto a Afodenic ha logrado prosperar debido a su tenacidad de venta como atreves de los financiamientos que la institución ha otorgado. 
Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poco dinero y con ayuda de su esposo, una vez que opto al crédito todo marcho mejor ya que logro vender más, lograr captar sus clientes, y es con lo que ha alimentado a sus hijos.
Hoy en día, casi todos sus hijos trabajan y la ayudan económicamente lo que está contenta.
Con este préstamo invertirá en ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos Avon. Ya que parte de sus ventas,  el setenta por ciento son al crédito y por encargos lo que le pagan a la quincena y va moviendo su capital.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising woman who really wants to continue working even though her age is so advanced. The business she started several years ago sells clothes, shoes, and stuffed animals, which, along with Kiva partner Afodenic, has prospered thanks to her tenacity in selling and the loans that the organization authorized.

When she started the business, she did it with little money and with the help of her husband. Once she took a loan, everything went better because she was able to sell more and attract more customers. Through this she has supported her children.

Nowadays, almost all of her children work and help her financially, so she is content.

With this loan, she will invest in clothes, shoes, and Avon cosmetics. Seventy percent of her sales are made on credit, which are paid within two weeks, so she has cash flow.

loans.use: She sells cosmetics, clothes and shoes, which she wants to stock up more on so she will have better sales and help herself more, since everything costs so much.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario y el Sr. Jaime son un matrominio muy unido, ellos tienen un negocio con el cual se sustentan, viven humildemente en una casita que les ha costado mucho trabajo tener, ahora ellos necesitan reparar el techo del baño y poner el vitropiso por que cuando llueve se les transmina el baño.
texts.en:
Rosario and her husband Jaime are a close married couple.  They have a store that supports them.  They live humbly in a small house that they worked very hard for.

They currently need to repair the roof of the bathroom and put in tiles because when it rains, it leaks into the bathroom.

loans.use: Roof repair and tile installation

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Milagro De Jesús está conformado por Maura de 32 años y Perfecta de 66 años por lo que juntas han sabido salir adelante, a pesar de las diferentes actividades económicas Maura se dedica a venta de refrescos y cerdos por lo que tiene más de 5 años de tener este negocio porque siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios, en el caso de Perfecta  se dedica a una abarrotería, pues tiene 12 años de tener esta actividad, por lo que no ha sido muy fácil mantener a su hijos y familia. Ambas son personas muy responsables por lo que están solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo  para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: The 'Milagro de Jesús' communal bank is made up of 32 year-old Maura and 66 year-old Perfecta who have known how to get ahead together in spite of the fact that they have different business activities.  Maura sells soft drinks and pigs.  She has been in this business for 5 years because she has always been keen to make sure her children pursue their studies.  Perfecta has a grocery store.  She has been in this business for 12 years and it hasn't been easy for her to support her children and family.  Both women are very responsible and they are requesting this loan to use as working capital, to buy supplies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
MarceL. es socia del bancomunal angel, que inicia su 4to ciclo con 10 scoias. MarceL. tiene 29 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, L. mayor tiene 12 años y L. ultima 5 años; elL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropas como casacas, pantalones, polos y chompas, este negocio lo viene realizando desD. hace 4 meses en el centro comercial Mariscal Cáceres en un Stand que es propio, este stand lo consiguió con L. ayuda D. sus amiga ya que le hizo un traspaso del Stand.
Antes D. realizar este negocio, MarceL. se dedicaba a L. venta D. salchipollo, L. única dificultad que elL. tiene es L. poca mercadería ya que es reciente el negocio.
El préstamo que solicita lo va emplear en L. compra D. ropas D. L. estacion como pantalones y casacas.
MarceL. es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 4 ciclos y lo que más le gusta D. las reuniones D. su banco comunal son las capacitaciones por que gracias a ello aprenD. más. L. meta D. MarceL. como Presidenta en este ciclo,  es que las socias sean mas cumplidas en sus pagos y en sus asistencias.
texts.en:
MarceL. is a member of the Angel community bank.  The bank is starting its 4th round with 10 members.  MarceL., 29, has 4 children who range in age from 5- to 12-years old.  She has operated a business selling clothing--jackets, trousers, shirts and sweaters--for 4 months, selling from her own stand in the Mariscal Caceres market.  She got the stand from a friend who leased it to her.  
MarceL. used to earn a living making and selling "salchipollo" (a traditional dish).  The main obstacle for her now is that she doesn't have enough merchandise to stock her clothing business because it's just getting off the ground.  
MarcelL. will use this loan to buy seasonal clothing.  Trousers and jackets, for example.  MarceL. has been a member of FINCA Peru for all 4 rounds and what she most likes about the meetings are the skills that she's learned.  Her goal, as president of the group for this round, is for all the members to be up to date with both their payments and attendance.

loans.use: compra de ropa de la estación

loans.name: Akossiwoa

texts.fr: Akossiwa a 28 ans. Elle est née à Lomé et vit à Hédzranawoe. Elle exerce la vente des assiettes et plastiques où elle tire assez de revenus. A travers son activité, elle a remboursé déjà beaucoup de crédit. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle revend en suite ses marchandises au marché de Hédzranawoe et compte dans cette activité près de 5 ans. Le crédit sollicité permettra d’accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 28 years old. She was born at Lomé and lives in Hédzranawoe.She has a plate and plastics store from which she makes a quite a good income. Through her business, she has already repaid several loans. She buys her stock in Ghana at Accra and at the big market in Lomé.She sells her wares at the Hédzranawoe market and has been working at this activity for about 5 years. The loan requested will permit her to enlarge her business.

loans.use: purchase of plastic goods and plates

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. Marie Rose’s husband is a technician and they both work hard to provide for their family. Marie Rose owns a small shop where she sells hardware and spare parts for construction. This is her 10th successful month in business! 

Marie Rose has requested a loan to buy more construction supplies to sell in her store. She plans to use any profits she makes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more hardware and construction supplies

loans.name: Jacinta Nicolasa

texts.es:
Jacinta Nicolasa C. A.  tiene 34 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con el hijo,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jacinta Nicolasa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Jacinta Nicolasa C. A.  is 34 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and son.  They live in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of San Jacinto Communal Bank, which is located in the Campo Alegre precinct near Quare parish which belongs to Baba Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers growing short-season crops like corn and rice.  This work takes a great deal of time.

Jacinta Nicolasa grows corn and rice.  She buys products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa markets and sells her products in López market.

She is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The loan will help her to meet her needs.  She faces challenges like pests, crop diseases, and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a field.

Jacinta likes to play sports.

loans.use: Farm supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; de profesión sastre, pero actualmente trabaja como chofer asalariado con un minibús de su padre.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas ya que las que actualmente tiene están en mal estado y para continuar trabajando necesita que estén bien.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, y el análisis socio económico lo califican para ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Mr German lives in his parents' home with his wife and children in the Tembladerani zone, in the city of La Paz. He is a tailor by trade, but currently works as the paid driver of his father's minibus.

The requested loan is for the purchase of tires, as his current tires are in bad condition. In order to continue working, he needs them to be in good condition. This is his first loan from Impro, and the socio-economic analysis has concluded that he can receive a loan.

loans.use: the purchase of tires for his minibus in which he transports passengers.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa Isabel tiene dos hijos de 13 y 17 a su cargo, su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva yleña, la mayoría de sus productos los ofrece de manera ambulante ya que diariamente obtiene nuevos clientes. Inicio este medio de vida  trabajando en una zona franca con el paso del tiempo es que ha comprado más cosas y así empezar a formar este medio de vida que ahora es tan necesario. El motivo del financiamiento para comprar pantalones, shorts, faldas, y leña ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y además tiene ciertos encargos.
texts.en:
Rosa Isabel has two children aged 13 and 17 in her care.  Her business is selling new clothes and firewood.  She makes most of her sales as an itinerant street vendor and she attracts new customers every day.  She started out working in a free-trade zone.  Over time, she has bought more products to sell and she works in this field of business which is now so important to her.

Rosa Isabel is requesting this loan to buy pants, shorts, skirts and firewood since the summer season is approaching.  She also has some orders to fill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nyakahanga Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: N. John is the leader of the Nyakahanga Tukore Group, Ntungamo. He is 57 years old and married with 8 children. John has operated a business selling agricultural produce such as beans, maize and coffee for 5 years from his store in the Ngomba trading centre. He employs two people to help him in business. John is a determined and social person, traits which have won him more customers. He is able to make a weekly profit of 200,000 UGX. John says that before a friend introduced him to produce selling, he was only selling to traders from his farm. However, he now also knows how to make more money as he also buys from other farmers. He needs a loan to be able to buy more beans and coffee for restocking.

loans.use: to buy more beans and coffee

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor  Carlos R. es un hombre trabajador, esforzado, emprendedor, buen esposo y padre de familia. El desde hace cinco años tiene un autolavado el cual inicio con un pequeño caramanchel actualmente gracias a su ardua labor y los préstamos ha ido aumentando.
R. con el crédito comprara jabón líquido, cera para auto, engrasante y algunos productos para auto que empezara a vender.
texts.en:
Carlos R. is an enterprising, hardworking man, a good husband and father.  For the last five years he has worked in his car wash that he began with a small stall.  Now, thanks to his hard work and the loans, business has increased.
R. will use this loan to buy liquid soap, car wax, lubricants, and some auto products that he will start to sell.

loans.use: Liquid soap, sponges, car wax, etc.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: La Sra. Abelina , es cliente nueva, esposa de un cliente antiguo quien firma como codeudor, la señora tiene un puesto de venta de carne en el mercado de la zona de Mallasilla, la señora tiene hijos que son casados, solo un hijo joven que esta bajo su cuidado, el crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de carne de cerdo y de Pollo , el esposo es arenero, pero esta temporada solo se dedica a sacar piedras del rio, lo que le trae poco ingreso, con tal motivo la Sra. Abelina tiene que trabajar para mantener a su familia, la Sra. Es una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Abelina is a new client, but is the wife of a previous client and co-signed with him. This lady has a post selling meat at the market in the Mallasilla neighborhood. She has children who are married, and only one young son still in her care. The requested loan is to purchase pork and chicken meat. Her husband does dredging work, but this season he is only removing rocks from the river, which brings in little income, so Abelina has to work to support her family. The lady is very hardworking and is grateful to the organization for the support offered.

loans.use: to purchase pork and chicken meat.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años, es una trabajadora que inicio hace un año vendiendo legumbre un día los cliente del pedían más cosa que decidió abrir una pequeña tienda.

Ella empieza a labora desde las 6:00 a m a 10:00pm todo los días. Le afecta mucho la delincuencia ya que por el sector donde vive es peligroso. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mas producto para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, cuadernos, etc. Ella en un futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y poner más adelante una papelería con la tienda y así darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and is a hardworking woman who began selling vegetables a year ago. One day, the customers wanted more things so she decided to open a small store.

She begins work at 6am and finishes at 10pm every day. The delinquency affects her a lot, as the area where she lives is dangerous. With the loan, she wants to buy more products for her store such as rice, sugar, notebooks, etc. In the future, she wants to build a cement house and set up a stationery store with the grocery store in order to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and notebooks

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael P. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling educational and learning booklets in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Michael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of booklets and books. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more booklets and books to sell

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en: Nelsa is a young entrepreneur who lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She makes a living by running a farm which her parents gave her. Her main crop is rice, but she also runs a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as canned goods, noodles and soap. Nelsa works hard to improve her farm and increase her income, and has applied for this loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and new items to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and items to sell in a sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothing for his business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He sells house hold consumptions like beans, rice, and sugar. Juma faces a major obstacle of high cost of transportation in his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase two sacks beans and two sacks of sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks, beans, and two sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 6 years, Phoebe has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of opening another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, and detergents for her store. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra. Albina, ella es la presidenta del comité, vive en la cuidad Concepcion.
La presidenta se motivo en la idea de producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una vision de que a través del comité estarian alcanzando el progreso de cada una.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras, Nombrandolo COMITÉ VIRGEN DEL CARMEN. 
El comité cuenta con diez (10) miembros, donde la mayoria se dedica a pequeñas actividades desde la venta de minutas como: empanadas, marineras, butifarras, chipas, tortas, dulces  de tal manera que puedan octener mayores ingresos para sus familias. 
Solicitan el crédito para poder comprar ingredientes para los productos alimenticios que venden como ser carne, especias, huevos y demás.
Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Mrs. Albina, the president, who lives in the city of Concepción.  The president wanted to help her friends by giving them the idea that each one could progress if they formed a group.

They were all happy to establish the women entrepreneur group called "COMITÉ VIRGEN DEL CARMEN".  There are ten members and most of them have small businesses selling food items such as pies, seafood, sausages, chips, cakes, or sweets to obtain more income for their families.

They are requesting a loan to buy ingredients for their food products such as meat, spices, eggs, etc.  They all hope to be able to get ahead for their individual and community development.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as meat, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with five children between the ages of six and 21. All of her children attend school. Irene stopped her education at grade five. For the past two years, Irene has been selling used clothes at the local market. She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. 

Irene is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of used clothes to sell. In the near future, she plans to build a house and continue to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
En un pedacito de tierra, Jhon Jairo, un joven emprendedor oriundo de El Carmen de Víboral  al oriente de Antioquia tiene un espacio destinado para la cría de vacas las cuales las comercializa en el municipio. 

A sus 34 años de edad y consciente de la necesidad de ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, Jhon Jairo espera con el paso del tiempo convertirse en un ganadero reconocido de la región. 

Actualmente, este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar terneros de levante con el fin de engordarlos para obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
On a small plot of land, Jhon Jairo, a young entrepreneur from El Carmen de Viboral to the east of Antioquia, has a small space designated for the raising of cows which he sells in the municipality.

At the age of 34, aware of the need to offer his child a better quality of life, Jhon Jairo hopes to become a well-known rancher in his region, with time.

Currently, this entrepreneur needs a loan for the purchase of calves for raising with the goal of fattening them to obtain a good income.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening.

loans.name: Chriss

texts.es: Chriss, de 28 años, está casada con Ángel. Ambos tienen una hermosa hija, Angelis, de dos años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo arduo en el sembrío, abonamiento y cosecha, es el compromiso que asumió Chriss hace 9 años; pues según afirma desde muy niña, gusto del campo y producir la tierra, ahora ella tiene más de 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra plátanos a gran escala, los cuales cosecha 2 veces al mes. Lo que más le gusta a Chriss, es poder negociar sus ricos plátanos por medio de los intermediarios, los cuales gustosos le aconsejas nuevos mercados donde ella puede expandirse y poder ofrecer sus frutos. Por ello más adelante desea convertirse en una agricultora reconocida. Ya dio su primer paso, sembrando café que espera, le brinden frutos el próximo año. Además de emprender un negocio propio en asociación de hermana; sus planes son vender ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños. Don está segura le irá muy bien. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera salir adelante junto a su banco comunal que constan de personas comprometidas con el progreso. Razón por la que se compromete en ser puntual con las cuotas. Chriss de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para fortalecer el crecimiento de sus viveros de café y la parte sobrante en sus cultivos de café que están en pleno crecimiento.
texts.en:
Criss, 28, is married to Ángel.  They have a beautiful, two-year-old daughter, Angelis, together.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle).  

Nine years ago Criss took on the commitment to hard work planting, fertilizing and harvesting because she affirms that ever since she was a little girl she enjoyed the countryside and making the soil productive.  Now, she has more than 2 hectares of farmland where she grows bananas in large scale that are harvested twice a month.  What Criss likes best is negotiating her delicious bananas with middlemen who gladly advise her about new markets that she can expand into and sell her fruit.  Because of this, she’d like to become a well-known farmer in the future.  She’s taken the first step toward this by planting coffee that she hopes will produce a good harvest next year.  She’s also started a business of her own in partnership with her sister: selling clothes for men, women and children where she’s sure she’ll do very well.

She’s a member of the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza del Palomar” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where she hopes to succeed with her communal bank which is composed of people committed to progress and which is the motivation for her to be punctual with her payments.

If Criss were to get your support, she’ll use the requested money to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to strengthen her coffee nursery and whatever’s left over for her coffee plants which are in full growth phase.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Alnie

texts.en:
Alnie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Alnie has been in this business for eight years. Alnie earns more income from services (manicure & pedicure).

Alnie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Zurakan's Group

texts.en:
Zurakan is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 years old and unfortunately is a widow. She has raised five children, all of whom are employed. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zurakan started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. The retail trade of fruits and vegetables brings her enough money to meet her daily needs. She applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to increase the commodity turnover for her business. With the money received from the loan, Zurakan will purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, with the profits gained from the business she plans to purchase a container. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a  28 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 4 years, he has been operating a boutique to make a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy trousers and jackets. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he can access business loans easily.

loans.use: To buy trousers and jackets

loans.name: Ri

texts.en: Ri sells cake, eggs, shampoo, soap, etc. She is 29 years old with two children. Her youngest son is still in school. She started her grocery store five years ago. She also raises pigs on the side. This is her first loan with VisionFund. With this loan, she hopes to increase her daily income from the grocery store, to raise more pigs, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to increase her grocery stock.

loans.name: Martha Aryera

texts.es: La señora Martha, es habitante del municipio de Veracruz, junto a su esposo e hijos, los cuales necesitan de su apoyo, su esposo labora actualmente como comerciante, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta laborar las ganancias no son muy buenas para comprar materiales de construcción; ya que ella quiere que comprar cemento, arena, piedrín, bloques , entre otras cosas para terminar de hacer el muro de su vivienda ya que tiene quiere privacidad .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo para poder cumplir sus metas y proyecto .
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a resident of the town of Veracruz. She lives with her husband and children who need her support. Her husband currently works as a merchant. Her plans for her family include improving their living conditions. Doña Martha sells clothing and shoes. Throughout the entire time she has been working, her earnings have not been good enough to buy construction materials. She wants to buy cement, sand, gravel, blocks, and other supplies so that she can finish building a wall around her home to provide privacy.

Martha is grateful for the funds provided by AFODENIC so that she can accomplish her goals and complete this project.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a privacy wall around her home.

loans.name: Katerin Frida

texts.es:
Katerin es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  La señora estudio educación superior.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de prendas de vestir para su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles comprará ropas para niños como overoles, camisas, chompas pantalones y jeans, la mercadería la compra en Desaguadero junto con su amiga  y la vende en la ciudad de Puno.  Nos cuenta que paralelamente también trabaja en un foto estudio.
La señorita desea abrir una tienda bien surtida de prendas de vestir de diferentes modelos, marcas y diseños.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la solidaridad y la capacitación que les dan sobre temas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Katerin is a member of the "Bellavista" communal bank, which is located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 19 years old, and is single without children.  She is studying in higher education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last year.  Her initial loan was for 500 New Soles, money which she invested in purchasing items of clothing for her business.

With this new loan of 1,500 New Soles she will buy children's clothing such as overalls, shirts, sweaters, pants and jeans.  She buys her merchandise in Desaguadero with her friend, and sells it in the city of Puno.  She tells us that she also works in a photo studio.

The Señorita wants to open a store that is well-stocked with clothing of different styles, brands and designs.

What she likes about the communal bank is it's unity and the training that's given on business-related topics.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing such as overalls, shirts, sweaters, pants and jeans.

loans.name: Sisimukha A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha A Group in Western Kenya! Lena is the facilitator of the Sisimukha A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lena takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lena had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lena was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lena and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Lena will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture, the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Norlito

texts.en:
Norlito believes in the saying try and try until you succeed. There is no harm in trying, because he believes that the only failure in life is the failure to try. Norlito is 47 years of age, married and has five school-aged children.

Norlito is engaged in planting rice. Aside from planting rice, Norlito also manages a hog-raising business. He has been doing it for 14 years. His secret of long duration in managing his business is trying and trying until he develops his expertise in doing this type of business.

Norlito wants to maintain his hog-raising business. He had difficulties in sustaining his hog feed. That’s why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed for his hogs. He wishes to become a successful businessman and borrower, as well.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs

loans.name: Moreen's Group

texts.en:
Moreen's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Moreen is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Moreen has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells fresh produce, plates, and glass. 

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more matooke (plaintains) and glasses, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Moreen's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more matooke (plaintains) and glasses

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is married with two children.  Glenn is 43-year-old and lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, The Philippines.

Glenn owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale to earn a living.  He has been doing this for five years and every month he earns PHP 15,000 from this work.  He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in future.

Glenn has been a member of GDMPC for a year.  In the future, Glenn hopes that his children will have finished their studies and that he will be able to gain double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus hijos ya no viven ellos, ella administra una tienda y un molino, trabaja todos los días y sus clientes son vecinos de los alrededores, unos llegan por el servicio del molino y otros por comprar productos en la tienda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un estante y mercadería para la tienda: boquitas gaseosas, dulces, galletas, pan, maíz entre otros productos que son demandados por los clientes, esto le permitirá aumentar su calidad en el negocio, brindando una mejor atención a los clientes.
Ella quiere en un futuro estabilizar su condición con el negocio, proveyendo para su familia una mejor condición económica a través de los préstamos.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband; their children no longer live with them.  She runs a store and a mill.  She works every day and her customers are neighbors from nearby.  Some come for the mill services and others to buy products in her store.

She is asking for a loan to buy a display case and merchandise for the store: snacks, soft-drinks, candy, cookies, bread and corn, among other products that her customers ask for.  This will allow her to increase the quality of her business providing better customer service.  In the future, she wants to stabilize her business’ condition providing a better economic situation through the loans for her family.

loans.use: to buy a display case, snacks, soft-drinks, candy, cookies, bread and corn.

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en:
Samneang is a 25-year-old, married man. He and wife reside with their one child in Takeo province, Cambodia. He explains that he also looks after his mother.

To earn a living, he is a driver for a local organization. His wife is a garment worker.

Samneang is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase cows to raise and resell when they are bigger. In the future, he would like to run a sewing shop for his wife and send his kid to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora. Vive en casa alquilada junto a su pareja John de 30 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Yovana trata de luchar contra las  adversidades del destino y  olvidar la inestabilidad familiar que aqueja su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva en el negocio, a pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino, supo sobresalir del mal momento. Desde hace 07 años que trabaja de forma independiente, es mas agradece a Dios, por darle esa oportunidad de mostrarse  ante sus demás competencias, desde luego que hoy tiene un puesto, donde vende ropas para todo el público en general, en efecto reconoce que lo esta beneficiando de forma positiva, ya que sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo, la clave de su éxito, radica en la calidad y el precio de su producto. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar y por ello que recurre a los préstamos para seguir surgiendo y abastecerse de mercaderías. Con el tiempo piensa alquilar un espacio en las galerías para poder vender con mayor rapidez y así exhibir toda la ropa hacia el publico, según lo gustos y preferencias. Este es crédito número 13 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy jovial y pone la chispa para salir del aburrimiento. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para poder incrementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Yovana, 25, is a charismatic, hard-working woman who lives in a rented house with her common-law husband, John, 30, and their three beloved children to whom they want to give the best quality of life.  Yovana tries to struggle against the adversities of fate and forget the family instability that affects her home.  She is a woman with character and a competitive attitude in business.  Although she has had some setbacks along the way, she has always known how to overcome a bad moment.  For seven years she has been working independently.  She is thankful to have the opportunity to show what she is capable of, and now has a stand where she sells clothing to the public in general.  She claims this is very positive for her since sales have increased over time.  The key to her success is the quality and price of her products.

She is conscious of the fact that she has a long road ahead of her so she is requesting a loan to be able to keep an inventory of merchandise.  In the future she wants to rent a space at the shopping center so she can sell more quickly and exhibit all the clothing for the public to see.  This is her 13th loan through MFP.  She is happy to know that she can count on another loan to continue growing.  She is a very cheerful member of her communal bank and always adds a note of humor to any dull moment.  She plans to use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy more clothing to increase her shop's stock.

loans.use: To buy more variety of clothing.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 27 años que vive en Santo Domingo con su marido y sus tres hijos. Santo Domingo es la cuarta ciudad más grande de ecuador, esta ha experimentado un crecimiento acelerado en los últimos 15 – 20 años debido al hecho que se encuentra en un punto estratégico que une varias ciudades de la costa y la sierra ecuatoriana. Santo Domingo se centra alrededor de actividades agrícolas y comerciales. La ciudad tiene un clima húmedo tropical y tiene la particularidad de ser un centro donde conviven varias diferentes culturas y tradiciones. 
María trabaja junto con su esposo en el taller de cerrajería que él tiene. María trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias, y en el pasado ha asistido a una capacitación de Fundación Alternativa. El préstamo al que María está buscando acceder estaría destinado a la compra de materiales como aluminio y planchas de metal; si María consigue esto, podría expandir la capacidad de su negocio mejorando así sus ganancias lo que le acercaría a su sueño de alguna vez tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Santo Domingo with her husband and her three children. Santo Domingo is the fourth largest city in Ecuador and it has rapidly grown in the past 15 to 20 years, due to the fact that it's located in a strategic spot uniting various towns of the Ecuadorean coast and mountains. Santo Domingo centers around agricultural and commercial businesses. The town has a tropical humid climate and it has the particular trait of being a centre where many different cultures and traditions live together.
María works alongside her husband in his locksmith's workshop. María works an average of 10 hours a day, and in the past she has attended one of Fundación Alternativa's training courses. The loan María seeks to get would be used to purchase materials such as foil and metal plates. If María achieves that, she would be able to expand her business and therefore improve her profits. This would move her one step closer to her dream of someday owning a house of her own.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's business by purchasing foil and metal plates.

loans.name: Samir Johan

texts.es:
Samir es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su madre, Samir pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Turismo, la cual le sirve de mucho en su trabajo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Samir trabaja como Guía de Turismo en un hotel de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 9 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el conocimiento que poses y por su experiencia.
Samir se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tratamiento médico que necesita su madre, ya que ella se encuentra muy delicada de salud, de esta manera Samir espera poder aliviar las dolencias de su madre y mejorar su salud, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y así poder lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia en el centro de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Samir is 21 years old, single, and lives in Nazca with his parents and brothers.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to his effort and support from his mother, Samir was able to study a tourism career, which helps him greatly.  In his free time he likes to relax, listening to music and at times prepare a delicious “Seco de Res” dish to share with his family.

Samir works as a tourist guide in a hotel in the city.  He works every day from early morning and can work for about 9 hours.  He feels comfortable doing this work and believes that things are going well for him because of his knowledge and experience.

Samir is very grateful to Kiva and thanks to the assistance, he will be able to cover his mother’s medical expenses; her health is fragile.  In this way Samir hopes to relieve his mother’s pain and improve her health.  He will continue to work hard to get ahead and be able to achieve his great dream of having a home of his own in the center of town.

loans.use: to  cover his mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: W_F_Sirende_Rosebeta Juma Group

texts.en:
Rosebeta is a 43-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2015, Rosebeta has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Rosebeta described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rosebeta’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 4 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ognian

texts.en: Ognian I. is 49 years old. He is married and has a son. Ognian and his family have a small coffee shop on the main street of Lubenova Mahala (It is a small village that is 22 km far from Sliven). Ognian also plants 24 decares land on which he grows tomatoes only. All tomatoes that he produces, Ognian sells on vegetable markets of Sliven and Bourgas. Ognian needs this $ 2000 loan to make repairs on his coffee shop.

loans.use: To make repairs on his coffee shop

loans.name: Chabwasi

texts.en: Chabwasi is 35 years old, married, and has two sons. He sells goats at a famous goat market in Vingunguti. He buys these goats from wholesalers and resells them retail. Chabwasi learned that he has to buy a flock of more than 15 goats in order to get an adequate profit margin. An average goat is sold at USD 16. Chabwasi is in need of USD 750 as working capital to buy the stock he desires and pay for a hut where the goats are kept before being sold. It is expected that the supply of goats in the country will decrease due to fear of an outbreak of “Rift Valley Fever."

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.en:
Maria is a married mother of three. Her husband works for a local business, but his salary is low and insufficient to cover all the household expenses. Five years ago, Maria started her own business selling cosmetics and lingerie in order to earn extra income to help her husband pay the bills. Little by little, her customers have increased, along with her orders.

Love for her kids and faith in her husband motivate Maria to keep her business growing, and now she's requesting a loan of $250, which she will use to purchase supplies to be able to meet the demands of her customers. You can improve the quality of life for Maria and her family and help her children finish their studies. Contribute to the development of this business. Maria is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Margarita es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar. Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de los estudios de sus hijos, Magui decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y lencería des de hace cinco años, poco a poco sus clientes se han incrementado al igual que sus pedidos.

El amor hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso con su esposo motivan a Magui a seguir creciendo, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia y ayudar a que los hijos de Magui puedan finalizar sus estudios, contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and lingerie

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Martha Isidora

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Martha Isidora. I have a small grocery store in my home which I opened one year ago. The business generates the income that I need to pay for the expenses of my 2 children, because I am a single mother. Thanks to the business I can take care of my family and at the same time generate the income necessary to pay for expenses and other debts to my providers. At this moment, I need to expand my offering because high season is getting closer and I don't have enough capital to make this investment.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Martha Isidora, cuento con una pequeña pulperia de venta de abarroteria, ubicada en mi casa de habitación desde hace 1 año, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mis 2 hijos ya que soy madre soltera, gracias a este negocio puedo atender a mi familia y generar ingresos para los gastos y demas compromisos con proveedores. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada buena y no cuento con el capital suficiente para realizar tal inversión.

loans.use: To buy refreshments, sweets, cookies, juices, sugar, rices, and instant soups.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur is a 23 year old internally displaced person from the town of Khankendi in Azerbaijan. He started his own business recently with his own resources. He now wants to borrow $1000 to buy additional inventory to enlarge his business, increase his earnings and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Tobuy inventory

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en: Asenati is married and the mother of seven children. She is working very hard selling eggs, drinks, and popcorn all around town and the village too, because this is the only source of income she’s getting now. She walks around the town area six days a week and she rests on Sunday. She earns almost $95ST net profit per day. She wishes to apply for her second loan in order to start a fast foods stall at the market, because she’s tired of walking around every day. Thanks to help from this program she is comfortable raising  her family, especially her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food vending business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 40-year old married mother of five living children. She lives with her husband who is also a small-scale businessman in Nyamasaria in Kisumu, Kenya. She operates her cereal business along the Kisumu-Nairobi highway. She started her business in 2000. She normally buys and sells dry maize (corn) to her customers. Over the years, she has been able to generate enough income, especially during the dry season when selling prices are high. Her hard work, perseverance, good reputation, and seven years in business along with a well-established client base ensure that her business will continue to grow. She has applied for a loan of US $600, which she plans to use to purchase an additional stock of cereals in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and transport grains such as wheat, quinoa, habas, and cebada

loans.name: Busei A South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Alice B..  She is currently in the business of farming and selling silver fish, and is requesting a loan to start trading big fish like nile perch and tilapia.  Alice is 34 years old and is married with a husband works as a builder.  She has 5 children ranging from age 8 to 15, and her children go to school.  Each week, Alice makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to bank the money and save it for future use.  Alice has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to uplift her poultry and fish trading business, and the loan was paid back on time.  

Alice is joined in her small group by Hadija N., Zida N., B. Zaituni, and Aidah S..  Hadija N. has a business in selling sweet potatoes and wants to expand to trade a variety of produce.  Zida N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase fixed assets in the shop.  B. Zaituni operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to rent another permanent place for business.  Aidah S. is currently in the grocery business and is requesting a loan to set up a bigger stall.

loans.use: To expand both farming and fish business

loans.name: Teddy's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Teddy is 43 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 10 and 8 years old. Teddy is a tailor, a business she started many years ago. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in batik selling.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan N. is 30 years old and has lived with her family for over 10 years in Kampong Cham province. She has two children who are students. She raises the family’s income by selling fish in a busy market, normally receiving $4 of profit per day. Actually, she sells fish only in the morning and, afterwards, she is a good wife cooking food for the whole family and sometimes teaching her children after school. Her husband, Pen Sarun, 34, is a taxi driver (Kampong Cham to Phnom Penh) and makes $5 a day.

To expand the business and facilitate transportation, she would request a loan. Part of the loan will be used to purchasing more fish for her fish-selling business. With the remainder, she will buy a motorbike for shipping the fish.

Chan N. appears in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and a motorbike.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. is 52 years old. She is married with 6 children. She is enthusiastic about her business and family. She acquired the skills of the trade from her mother. Christiana sells sand, gravel, and granite. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO micro finance for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $450 to assist her in buying more sand, gravel, and granite to meet the demands of her customers. She desires to lift her family above poverty.

loans.use: To buy more sand, gravel, and granite

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale A., 46, is married with 9 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has received one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Tafale’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also has a vegetable garden as part of her business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Hul L., 46, is widowed and raises ducks behind her house in Trapeang Prey Village, Siem Reap Province. She bought small ducks to raise and sells their eggs and meat as well. L. wants to expand her business to increase her family’s income, so she now is asking for a loan to purchase more ducks to raise. The loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise

loans.name: Aroumo Diminga

texts.fr:
Aroumo Diminga S. is married, 56, and a mother of 6. She would like to use this loan, her first, to contribute to her family’s daily expenses in order to improve her family’s living and health conditions. She intends to make a profit by selling vegetables and various foods at the neighborhood market. She will repay her loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Aroumo Diminga S. est mariée, âgée de 56 ans et mère de 06 enfants.
