Elle souhaite avec ce prêt qui est son premier participer quotidiennement aux dépenses familiales afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle compte rentabiliser son activité de vente de légumes et produits divers au marché du quartier. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and diverse foods

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru:
Шамсиддин 1973 года рождения. Женат и имеет 3   детей. Чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет дополнительным доходом решил заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Он арендовал торговую точку на рынке для продажи детских игрушек. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя Шамсиддин вырученные деньги с бизнеса, пускал в оборот. В его ассортименте разные игрушки, начиная от погремушек для новорожденных до конструкторов школьного возраста. Также в продаже имеются игры развивающие интеллектуальное мышление ребенка. 
Свои товары он закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Для увеличения ассортимента хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони для увеличения товаров.
texts.en:
Shamsiddin was born in 1973. He is married and has 3 children. In order to increase his household income, he decided to start an entrepreneurship. He leased a retail outlet at a market to sell children’s toys. Growing his entrepreneurial experience, Shamsiddin invested his profits back into his business. His goods assortment includes various toys, ranging from rattle toys for infants to construction sets for school-aged kids. He also sells games that foster intellectual development of children. Shamsiddin buys his goods at the Corvon wholesale market in Dushanbe. He would like participate in the Kiva program and obtain a $900 loan in order to increase his goods inventory.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children toys

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca I. has a store in the Agbado Market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sews and sells clothing materials. She purchases the clothing materials from Onitsha market.  Franca sews school uniforms for school children. The demands for her tailoring service is high and she is determined to retain her customers. She requests a loan of $700 to buy more clothing materials for sewing and selling. Franca is 48 years old and she is married with a 15 year old child. She says thank you .

loans.use: To buy more clothing material for sale

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum T. is farmer in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  She has 2-hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living.  On this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because of infertile soil.  To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sum T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and fuel.  

Mrs. Sum T. is a 45-year-old widow with a child who owns a small grocery store in the local market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Tapiche Nº 697, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos mayores de edad y es casada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de aguajes. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y con la venta de frejol cocido, los cuales le brindan ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 15 sacos de aguajes, 1 saco de frejol regional y canario. 

Isabel manifiesta que recibe ayuda del banco comunal. Agradece a todas aquellas personas que confiaron en su talento para los negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel belongs to the community bank "La Positiva," located at Jr. Tapiche Nº 697, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and a mother of seven grown children and she is married. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the sales of aguajes (a fruit of Peru). She has a six-year history working with the community bank. Presently she has the same business and added the sales of cooked beans (Peruvian style), which offers her good earnings so she is able to repay her loan with punctuality. With this loan for 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in five months, she will buy 15 sacks of aguajes, one sack of regional beans and one sack from the Canary Islands. Isabel says that she has received help from the community bank. She is thankful for all the people who trusted in her business skills.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 15 sacks of aguajes (a fruit of Peru), 1 sack of regional beans, and 1 sack of beans from the Canary Islands.

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi: Chi  Cao Thị O. 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị O. còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt cá, đây cũng là công  việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập  chủ yếu cho gia đình chị. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để mua thêm lưới phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá tăng thu nhập cho gia
texts.en:
Cao Thị O. is 42 years old, a TYM fund member since 2004. She and her family raise animals, cultivate and fish. The later is their main source of income. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy fishing net to improve their fishing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fishsing net

loans.name: Nusrat Begum Ghulam Hussain Group

texts.en:
Nusrat begum baji is 46 years old and married. She resides in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived here for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is G. H. and he is a driver by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Nusrat is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is a mason. The other boys are getting education from a school near the house. Nusrat begum baji is employed in an embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses and sells them in clothing markets. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.

Nusrat has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan again to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband, so that he is able to keep all of the money that he earns.

Nusrat is a group leader of some women in her locality. Allah rakhi baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sakina baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es:
Ileana María O. M. tiene 48 años, su estado civil es acompañada, y tiene tres hijos 14, 12, y 10 años, respectivamente. La actividad económica de Doña Ileana es la venta y elaboración de repostería, como pasteles, cosas de horno y sopas de leche. Hace siete años que Doña Ileana ha operado este negocio en su propia casa, y lo inició por iniciativa propia por lo que necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona responsable desde la edad de 18 años. Doña Ileana decidió ofrecer sus productos en la escuela donde estudiaban sus niños, ya que así le fue más fácil por lo que tenía que dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y al mismo tiempo dejaba sus productos.
Los propósitos de Doña Ileana son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que estos sean lo mejor y les agrade a los clientes por lo que esto le dará buena fama. Por esta razón, el financiamiento de Kiva será para capital de trabajo ya que lo necesita para la inversión de materia prima como huevo, harina, y mantequilla levadura, ya que estos productos están muy caros. Después de ganar las ganancias para reembolsar el préstamo, sus sueños son de establecer un negocio de repostería en su casa de habitación y así podría generar más empleos ya que no podría realizar todo el procedimiento solo.
texts.en:
Ileana María O. M. is 48 years old, partnered, and has 3 children ages 14, 12, and 10. Ileana makes and sells pastries, such as cakes, baked goods, and ‘sopas de leche’ (bread soaked in sweet milk and sprinkled with cinnamon). Ileana has been managing her business in her own home for the past 7 years; she began this business by her own initiative given that she needed to generate income for her family and has always been a responsible person since the age of 18. Ileana decided to offer her products in the school where her children were studying, as it was easier for her because she had to drop of her children at school and at the same time dropped of her products. Ileana intends to improve the quality of her products so that they are the best and her clients enjoy them, which will give her a good reputation. For this reason, the Kiva loan will be used as work capital given that she needs it to invest in basic materials such as eggs, flour, butter, and yeast, since these products are very expensive. After earning the profits to pay back the loan, her dream is to establish a pastry business in her home, and in that way she could generate more jobs given that she will not be able to carry out all work on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic pastry making materials such as eggs, flour, butter, and yeast.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Gertrudis es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Gertrudis se dedica a la venta D. alfalfa que compra D. los productores, sus ventas los realiza D. tienda en tienda para lo cual cuenta con un carro. Además Gertrudis cría cuyes que venD. en los diferentes recreos.
Gertrudis necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alfalfa.
Los sueños D. Gertrudis son mejorar su casa y tener a toda su familia unida.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Gertrudis is 48 years old and married with one son. Gertrudis sells alfalfa that she buys from producers. She makes her sales by traveling from store to store, for which she needs a car. Gertrudis also raises guinea pigs that she sells in various "recreos" (privately owned village centers for recreation and food). Gertrudis needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of alfalfa. Gertrudis dreams of making improvements to her home and of having her whole family united.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of alfalfa.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. sells food supplies and groceries like milk, milo, canned products and more at the Elmina first port.  She has received a primary education.  Mary is a single parent with five dependents.  She has been selling groceries since 1991.  Mary is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.  Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies and groceries to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of food supplies and groceries to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Trésor Plus Group

texts.fr: Odile N. vend de la braise dans un quartier le plus peuplé, situé au nord de Kinshasa. Son capital actuel est de $150. Son affaire génère un bénéfice de $11 par semaine. Odile a commencé sa première activité commerciale en 2000. Après s’être divorcée avec son mari en 1998, elle a traversé une période économique très difficile avec sa fillette de 8 ans. Elle a commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $20. Son activité consistait à faire des omelettes et du thé aux clients. De 2000 à 2008, son chiffre d’affaire a atteint $200. Son capital a connu une baisse en 2009 à cause de l’instabilité de la monnaie. Le nouveau crédit a permit à  Odile  d’acheter trente sacs de braise pour revendre afin d’accroitre son bénéfice. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un dépôt de braise à livrer aux détaillants. Odile a 43 ans, divorcée et mère de quatre enfants dont une fillette de 8 ans qui étudie, habite avec elle.
texts.en:
Odile N. sells charcoal in a very populous neighborhood situated north of Kinshasa. Her present working capital amounts to US$ 150. Her business makes a profit of US$ 11 per wek.

Odile began her first business in 2000. After divorcing from her husband in 1998, she and her 8-year-old daughter came through a very difficult economic period. She began her business with an initial capital of US$ 20. She was selling omelettes and tea to her customers. From 2000 to 2008 her capital rose to US$ 200.

She had a drop in capital in 2009 due to the instability of the currency. This new loan has permitted Odile to buy 30 sacks of charcoal for re-sale so as to increase her profit. Her dream is to open a charcoal depot so as to supply retailers.

Odile is 43, divorced, and the mother of 4 children, of whom one daughter of 8 years old lives with her and is enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 30 sacks of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa area with his wife and their four children. Omar has been working as a carpenter for four years. Omar requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase wood for his work. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.

Omar considers himself special in his business because he does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and the public. Omar decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Omar will use the loan to purchase wood for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is a caterer. She bakes and cooks African foods. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Toyin lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya de l’association Benkadi AMIDEF sont tous des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ayant en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire. Tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments, d’huile alimentaire, d’atiéké, des fritures,  des brochettes et des plats alimentaires. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre, 9 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire, 3 sacs d’atieké, 1 paquet d’ingrédients, 1 sac de riz, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaire et 1chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et  dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  comme épargne et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya of the association Benkadi AMIDEF are all married women who average 36 years of age and 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer needs and are now on their seventh solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid. The group members operate diverse businesses, including the selling of condiments, atiéké (dried fermented cassava), fried foods, kebabs, and culinary dishes. With this new loan, they intend to buy five 100-kg sacks of potatoes, nine 20-liter drums of cooking oil, three sacks of atiéké, a packet of ingredients, a sack of rice, three packets of condiments, and a cart-load of firewood. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold for the most part in cash transactions at the different markets of Sikasso and in the districts. Their customers are composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be put into savings, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Namatovu Margret Group

texts.en: Margaret is the leader of 5 members of a group.  She is 46 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 22 and 32 years. One of her children goes to school. She resides with five people in a five-roomed house that she owns. Margaret takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, in the outskirts of Kampala. Margaret sells second hand clothes, door to door, in Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people.  She works six days a week. Margaret buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala, and incurs some transport costs. Her major monthly expenses include medication for the family, school fees and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Her main challenges include the rainy season, which stops her daily routine of selling door to door. Margaret has been with MCDT for over six years and requesting her twelfth loan, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes. Margaret is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: increase on her inventory to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Ma Brigida

texts.es:
la sra. Ma Brigida S. se dedica a la venta y produccion de tortillas, actividad que tiene de realizar hace varios años, ella tiene 58 años de edad, todos los dias se levanta temprano para empezar a elaborar sus tortillas, tiene dos empleadas que le ayudan a la produccion de las mismas. 
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos ya que ella por su edad no puede laborar en ninguna empresa, para las personas de la tercera edad es dificil conseguir trabajo, ella se siente muy feliz porque todo le va saliendo bien, tiene muchos deseos de superarse y tener una vida justa y comoda.
necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ma Brigid sells and makes tortillas. She has been doing this for many years. She is 58 years old. Each day she gets up early in order to begin making her tortillas. She has two employees that help her make them. This business is her only form of income. Because of her age she is not able to work in a business. It is difficult for older people to get a job. Brigid is very happy because everything is working out well. She has a strong desire to succeed and to have a just and comfortable life. She needs a loan in order to buy raw materials that will be used to make her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood, coal, water and lime.

loans.name: Ajuse

texts.en: Ajuse is 37-years old and happily married. Ajuse makes and sells blocks for building houses. Ajuse has been in the business since 1990. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Ajuse is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more cement and sand to make more bricks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and sand

loans.name: Restetita

texts.en:
Restetita P. hails from the beautiful town of Jala-jala, Rizal province in the Philippines. she is 32 years old and married to Luiso, who is a fisherman and 39 years old. She is a mother to three; all females. The eldest daughter is 16 years old, while the youngest is 10 years old.
While her children are still small, she wants to strive hard and start a business that could sustain the needs of the family. In 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with hopes of having acces to capital to start a business. When she recieved her previous loans, she invested those in Hog Raising. She cultured pigs for four months and sell it to the market. The price of pigs in the country is high because of the demand of the pork.
She is so happy when her investments returns in double. She just need rolling capital to sustain the needs of the pigs especially its foods.
Now on her 6th loan, she proposes a loan of 35,000 pesos as additional capital for her hog raising business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for five piglets, sacks of assorted feeds (food), vitamins and for transportation expenses.
She is hopeful that her business will grow and she dreams of having a pig farm somdeday. She really aspires of sending her children to school until they finih college and find jobs.

loans.use: To pay for five piglets, sacks of assorted feeds (food), vitamins and for transportation expenses.

loans.name: Sumaq Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sumaq Warmikuna que significa Mujeres Bellas inicia su tercer ciclo con 14 socias. Las socias son D. L. comunidad D. Yanama que se encuentra a 30 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, calzados, verduras, abarrotes en general, comidas, artesanías, animales menores, lubricantes, cosméticos y frutas.
	
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 6,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, verduras, carnes, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sumaq Warmikuna” (which means Beautiful Women) is starting its third loan cycle with 14 members. They are from Yanama, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho.

The members are engaged in different retail businesses selling grain, shoes, vegetables, groceries, food, handicrafts, small livestock, lubricants, cosmetics, and fruit.

They need loans of different amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles for a total of 6600 soles for the entire Communal Bank. With their loans, they plan to buy wheat, barley, rice, sugar, vegetables, meats, and fruits.

The members hope to expand their businesses, own their own homes, and see their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, rice, sugar, vegetables, meats, and fruits

loans.name: Magie

texts.en:
Magie is 30 years old. She is married to Baltazar Sr., a farmer, and they have two children: Ejay - 4 years old, a preschool student and Baltazar Jr. - 5 months old. They live in Barangay Salay, Angadanan, Isabela, a peaceful and environmentally friendly area.

Magie has managed a typical retail store for almost five years and her weekly income is PHP 500. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional capital.

When she has enough income, Magie plans to have a livestock business next month. She said: "We should learn how to value money, especially when you have a lot of obligations."

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with three children. She is an entrepreneur from Kamenka who runs a small business selling food items in the local market. Svetlana sells groceries, tea, coffee and fruit. She owns a nice big vending kiosk with good quality refrigerated coolers and a wide selection of groceries for sale. She has been in this business for ten years. Currently, Svetlana has about 60,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 7,000-8,000 Grivnyas a month.

At present, Svetlana is requesting a loan of 16,685 Grivnyas to purchase fresh fruit which always sells well in the cold season. Svetlana has promptly repaid nine previous loans without any delinquencies which characterizes her as a responsible client capable of current loan repayment. One of Svetlana’s long-term plans is to open her own little grocery store. She has already purchased land for construction work on it.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her café business

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: G. Delphine est née le 10 Septembre 1978 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Delphine est mariée à MEDIN Mathieu, un mécanicien auto. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Delphine vit ensemble depuis quatre ans avec ses enfants et son mari à Hèdomey à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Delphine a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Depuis 3 ans, Delphine mène comme activité, la vente de divers en gros (boîtes d’allumettes, lait, savons, etc.) au marché de Cococodji et de Cocotomey, deux villes situées à proximité de Cotonou. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Delphine fait ses approvisionnements. Delphine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pour accroître son activité et gagner une grande part de marché, Delphine sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Delphine was born on September 10, 1978 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin.  She is married to Mr. MEDIN Mathieu, an auto mechanic.  The couple has two children who are both in school.  For four years, Delphine has been living together with her children and husband in the Hèdomey district in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.   Delphine stopped going to classes in primary school.  For three years, she has been running a wholesale business selling a variety of goods (boxes of matches, milk, soaps, etc.) at the markets in Cocotomey and Cococodji, two cities located near Cotonou.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she goes to stock up.  She has benefited from an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid.  To grow her business and to win a large market share, she's requesting a second ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 boxes of soaps and 6 boxes of matches

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem is 36 years old, married with 3 children; his youngest child is 3 years old. Kazeem’s children are schooling. His wife sells sarongs to support the home. He is a tailor and he makes lovely Nigerian designs for his customers. His greatest joy in his business is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sew more clothes for his customers. This is the high season for his tailoring skills and he hopes to make more profits during this season. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda B. D. A. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en San marcos. Vive junto a su esposo. Ella posee un comedor en el cual venD. desayunos y almuerzos, dicho negocio esta ubicado en el centro D. San Salvador, lugar el cual es muy transitado y hay muchos negocios, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar granos básicos, frutas, verduras y bebidas heladas, D. manera que pueda brindarles una mayor variedad D. comida a sus clientes. Yolanda es una señora muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza por hacer la mejor comida es por esto que cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales disfrutan D. sus alimentos. Ella desea aumentar sus ventas y poder contar con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yolanda B. D. A. is 59 years old and lives with her husband in San Marcos. She has a small restaurant where she sells breakfast and lunch. Her business gets a lot of clients because it is located in the center of San Salvador, a busy area with lots of other businesses. She would like a loan to be able to buy basic grains, fruits, vegetables and cold drinks. This way she can proviD. a greater variety of food to her clients. Yolanda is a hardworking women and tries to make the best food. This is why she always has lots of clients that enjoy their meals. She would like to improve her sales and see a rise in her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buys basic grains, fruit and vegetables

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Ariuntsetseg

texts.en:
Ariuntsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her daughters, aged 16 and 12, both attend a local high school while her husband is currently unemployed.

Ariuntsetseg operates a grocery trading shop in one of the rooms of her house. She started her business in 2006 by extending her house in order to conduct her business. In the future, she wants to sell not only grocery products but also toiletry and household goods too. She says, "I am planning to build another house that can be used just as a shop as soon as I can earn enough money for my daughters' education."

Ariuntsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase consumer goods for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Soberana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Soberana está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María Antonia S. García quien vende dulces tradicionales como cajetas, leche burra, melcocha etc. Ella inicio este negocio para apoyar en los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus cinco hijos de 18, 14, 12, 10 y 3 años respectivamente. 

 Josefa del Carmen P. desde hace más de diez años hace y vende comida y refrescos. Mientras Margarita de los Ángeles M.  en 2003 instalo un pequeño taller de calzado.
texts.en:
The “Soberana” (Sovereign) Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is María Antonia S. García, who sells traditional sweets such as “cajetas” (a sweet gelatin), “leche burra” (toffee made from milk), “melocha” (molasses candy), etc. She started this business in order to help pay for household expenses and the education of her five children (ages 18, 14, 12, 10, and 3 respectively).

Josefa del Carmen P. has been selling food and beverages for more than ten years. Meanwhile, Margarita de los Ángeles M. has been operating a shoe store since 2003.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José R. de 23 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 1 hijo de 8 meses.

El empezó hace 4 años atrás, porque tuvo un accidente en la empresa que trabajaba y lo jubilaron a temprana edad, con el dinero de la jubilación compro algunos víveres y empezó a vender afuera de su casa.

Ahora el tiene una tienda bien surtida, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 el promedio diario de clientes tiene 21 clientes. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, cola, lácteos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Twenty-three year old José R. lives in the Suburbio de Guayaqhil neighborhood. His house is made of cement and has all the basic necessities. His wife is a homemaker and together they have an 8 month old child. Four years ago he had an accident in the business where he worked and they retired him at a young age. With the money from the retirement he bought some provisions and began selling them outside his home. Now he owns a well-stocked store. He works every day from 6am to 9pm and sees on average 21 customers a day. One of the difficulties that he has is the crime in the area where he lives. With this loan he would like to buy rice, soda and dairy products for his business. In the future he would like to expand his store in order to be able to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, soda and dairy products

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El Señor  Saul tiene 25 años de edad actualmente vive en Santo Corazon, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, el señor es cliente de emprender con sus ateriores creditos que saco a comprado una parcela donde vive y trabaja el siembra sorgo para hacer escobas, poroto y maiz donde el saca sus productos a vender al mercado central de El Torno. El solo mantiene el hogar ya que su esposa es ama de casa, El credito solicitado lo quiere para la siembra de papa un nuevo reto para el, el cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por su apoyo. Es una persona joven y trabajador responsable que paga sus cuotas puntualmente, Un Padre que quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul is 25 years old and lives in Santo Corazon. He is married and has three children. He has had previous loans that he used to buy a parcel of land in the neighborhood, where he lives and works. He raises sorghum, to make brooms; and corn and beans, and sells his products in the central market in El Torno. He maintains his home himself, since his wife works as a housekeeper. He is asking for this loan in order to plant potatoes, a new venture for him. He is grateful to our institution for its support. He is a young, hard working man who pays his debts on time, and a father who wants a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato raising supplies

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is an ambitious single lady who has been selling video tapes and DVDs in Machakos, Kenya. She also provides typesetting and photocopy services. She has one employee to assist her in the business.  She hopes to grow her business and buy a plot where she can put up her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of Kes 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy blank video tapes, CDs, cartridges and printing paper.  She dreams of becoming the main supplier of stationery in Machakos and offering the best quality services.  She hopes to create employment for more people.

loans.use: To purchase blank video tapes, CDs, catridges and printing paper

loans.name: Olga Amalia

texts.es: La Sra. M. trabaja en el acilo de ancianos Hogar San Antonio, ella se encarga de brindarles cariño y ayuda a estas personas de la tercera edad, devenga un salario no alto pero la llena de satisfacción el poder atenderlos, ella es madre de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad. Con esto le provee de su alimentación,  su vestuario y la poca comodidad que tiene. Se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito el cual utilizara para la compra de medicamentos, ya que unos de sus hijos lo tiene enfermo y el deseo de la Sra. M. es que su hijo este sano.
texts.en:
Ms. M. works in the “Hogar San Antonio” senior citizens’ center. She is in charge of caring and helping the elderly. She earns a small salary. It’s not very much, but being able to help people fills her with satisfaction. She has two young children. Her salary allows her to pay for food, clothing, and the few comforts that she has. She is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL which she will use to buy medicine for one of her children, who is sick and she wants him to be well.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine for her son

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O. is from the village of Brgy. Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing catering services in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 30,000 PHP will be used to purchase the materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be the seventh loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the materials needed to provide more catering services

loans.name: Buene Fe Group

texts.es:
El comité Buena Fé se formo después que varias señoras se unieron y decidieron formar un nuevo comité en el barrio. 
Desde el primer fin de semana de su conformación están realizando actividades de tal forma a cancelar de manera el crédito que obtuvieron.
Están muy contentas ante la posibilidad de organizarse y progresar de manera comunitaria.
Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de artículos en el barrio en el cual residen así como en los lugares donde estudian. 
Una de las integrantes se dedica  a la venta de ropas,  ella viaja hasta la Argentina para traer sus mercaderias ya que en vecino país las ropas son mucho mas baratas trayendo en gran cantidad la ganancia es mayor.
Ella distribuye ropas para muchos negocios inclusive para otras  integrantes del comité que se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Solicitó el préstamo para realizar el viaje y así traer mas mercaderías para la temporada otoño- invierno (camperas y otros tipos de abrigo)
texts.en:
The "Buena Fé" savings committee was formed after various women came together and decided to put together a new neighborhood committee. Since the first weekend of their working together, they have carried out activities in order to pay off the loan that they received. They are very happy about the opportunity to oraganize themselves and progress in a community spirited way. The women who make up this committee work selling products in the neighborhood in which they live as well as in the places where they study. One of the members sells clothes. She travels to Argentina to fetch her merchandise because in this neighboring country clothes are much cheaper and she purchases them in bulk so the profits are greater. She sells clothes to many businesses, and also sells for other members of the committee who deal in clothing. She is requesting a loan in order to make the journey to Argentina and bring back more merchandise for the autumn-winter season (jackets and other types of warm coat.)

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To travel and buy clothes for the autumn-winter season such as jackets and other warm coats

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit K. is 33 and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Ly (pictured with him), is 30. They have been married for ten years and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are in school and the other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Tit and his wife have been farming for seven years. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village. Tit does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. That is why he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to make these purchases. He will also use a part of the loan to buy a water pumping machine to spray his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a water pumping machine

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan In Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province consisting of five people who make up a group loan. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that can improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Phally Y. is the group leader as selected by the other members. She is 38 years-old.  She is a white wine maker and also breeds pigs. Her problem is that her pigsty is too old to use.  Therefore, Mrs. Phally Y. is applying for a loan to build a new pigsty. Her husband, Mr. Sovanareth Brach, is a government worker. From these activities, they support five children who are all attending local public school.

loans.use: To build a new pigsty.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mr. Chim C. is a local farmer who grows a few vegetables to earn a living. He is 44 years old and has established a small family home with other family members. His wife works on the field with him. They are good parents who have tried to earn money to feed their four children since they were young. One of their children is now married and the other three are single. The approaching rainy season is the time Chim C. would normally grow his crops, but he does not have enough supplies to use on his farm. For this reason, Chim C. is applying for a $250 loan to help him buy supplies to plant vegetable crops.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow vegetable crops.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som L., 33, sells various kinds of grocery inventory out of her home to earn a living. She buys the items in bulk from wholesale suppliers and sells them retail to people who are her nearby neighbors. Som L. is a single mother who has given birth to two kids, both of whom are going to secondary school. She currently has an oldest sister who lives with her and helps her with the business. 

Som L. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Som L. wishes to have more money to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Nhorn

texts.en: In Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province has a person, Mrs. Nhorn O. was born in 1954. She is a farmer who owns two point five-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. In her field has some problem because is infertile soil and it has a lot of insect. So to improve production, Mrs. Nhorn O. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rest of the loan she rents plow machine to plow her field. Her husband is a battery charger who can earn some money to support his family. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is attending in local public school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lesbia Del Carmen tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, actualmente se dedica a la compra venta de sal por quintal, también se dedica a la venta de leña pues se siente muy contenta de buscar el medio de vida. Ella realiza este negocio con apoyo de su esposo, el que la distribuye en un camión en otros departamentos del país. Pues es con este nuevo financiamiento pretende comprar mayor cantidad de sal, lo cual le generaría mayores ganancias y con esto seguir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Mantener este negocio es muy importante para ella, pues es la única fuente de empleo para mantener el hogar.
texts.en:
Lesbia Del Carmen is 34 years old and has two children. She sells salt for the garden and firewood and is happy to be able to make a living this way. Her husband helps her with this work--he has a truck to deliver the goods to different parts of the country. With more financing, Lesbia and her husband hope to buy more salt so they can generate more income and thereby improve their home and make more space for their children. Keeping up this business is essential to them, since it is the only way they have to maintain their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Rosejen

texts.en:
Rosejen D. is from the village of Manano. She is 47 years old. Rosejen is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Rosejen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Rosejen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosejen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosejen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Rosejen is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosejen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es: Hilaria tiene 45 años y vive en la Mz. E en Huaycán, es casada y tiene 1 hijo, DesD. ya hace 8 años que trabaja con Edaprospo y hace solo 4 meses presidenta del grupo “Virgen D. Copacabana” el cual es conformado por 15 personas que también son devotas a la misma virgen, eh ahí el origen el nombre del grupo. Hilaria vendía ocasionalmente quesos D. casa en casa y también se dedicaba a trabajos D. limpieza ocasionales, mas desD. hace 5 años que trabaja D. lleno en la compra y venta D. Quesos que trae desD. Huarochirí, la calidad D. este producto y el capital brindado por Edaprospo le ah conseguido un buen grupo D. clientes y D. mercadería para abastecerlos, mas ella espera poner su propia tienda D. venta para así ayudar D. una mejor forma en los estudios superiores D. su hijo.
texts.en:
Hilaria, 45, lives on block E in Huaycán. She’s married and has a son. She has been collaborating with Edaprospo for 8 years and for the last four months has been President of the “Virgen D. Copacabana” communal bank which has 15 members also devoted to that Virgin, thus the group name. Hilaria used to sell cheese occasionally from home and also did cleaning jobs sometimes. But, for the last 5 years she has been working fulltime as a cheese merchant. She brings them from Huarochirí. The quality of the product and capital from Edaprospo has secured a good group of customers and merchandise to supply them. However, she hopes to set up her own store so that she can better support her son’s higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Eastern Wao Poblacion, Wao municipality in the province of Lanao del Sur on the Mindanao islands. Mary provides multi-purpose cab services to local community members; her husband is the driver. Mary has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Mary joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to buy materials needed to provide service. Mary is requesting a new loan, her second from HSPFI, of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La Sra. Laura vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en San José de Chiquitos, es una población declarada patrimonio cultural de humanidad, es conocida como las misiones jesuíticas, desde su corta edad se traslado a la capital Cruceña donde estableció su negocio de venta de muebles de fierro, hace unos tres año que se dedica a esta actividad su esposo es comerciante de productos ocasionales, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería por fin de año, vive en casa prestada, por lo que su deseo es tener su propio domicilio.
texts.en: Laura lives in the city of Santa Cruz.  She was born in San José de Chiquitos, a town that was declared to be a cultural world heritage site, known for its Jesuit missions.  When she was young, she moved to the capital, Cruceña, where she established her first business, selling iron furniture, which she has been dedicating herself to for about three years.  Her husband is a salesman.  They have three school-aged children.  This loan will be used to purchase merchandise for the end of the year.  They live in a home that they rent and their dream is to one day have a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ruth Oneida

texts.es: La sra. Ruth y su esposo son personas que trabajan en una maquiladora por lo cual desean poner las telas mosqueteras a su casa y construir la barda para proteger su patrimonio ya que salen muy temprano a trabajar y regresan al atardeser y su casa permanece sola gran parte de el dia y vieron en este prestamo la manera de realisar su proyecto mas rapido.
texts.en: Ruth and her husband work in a maquiladora. They wish to put mosquito nets in their home and build a fence to protect their assets since they leave very early to go to work and return in the evening and their home remains empty for a large part of the day. They saw in this loan a way to accomplish their project more quickly.

loans.use: Build a fence and buy mosquito nets.

loans.name: Patricia De La Cruz

texts.es: Patricia D. La Cruz C. D. P. 43 años D. edad,  resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, quien se destaca por ser un hombre muy trabajador, y así mismo junto a dos hijos. Patricia se dedica a la elaboración D. tamales, un platillo típico el cual esta hecho a base D. masa D. maíz, la cual se rellena con verduras y se envuelve en hojas D. huerta D. guineos, los cuales posteriormente comercializa D. forma ambulante, así mismo sus hijos le ayudan vendiendo algunos tamales en su casa D. habitación, Patricia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. mayor cantidad D. tamales, todo con el enorme deseo D. aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: 43 year old Patricia lives in the department of San Vicente. She lives here with her husband, who stands out as a very hardworking man, and with their two children. Patricia makes tamales, a typical dish maD. from a corn dough which is filled with vegetables and wrapped in banana leaves. She then sells the tamales around town and her children help by selling some tamales from their home. Patricia is requesting a loan so that she can buy raw materials for making a greater quantity of tamales, all because she has an enormous desire to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making tamales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase iron, galvanized tubing, electrodes, and paint

loans.name: Zeidy

texts.en:
Zeidy is a 37 year old mother of two who lives with her family in San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica. In the community where she lives, there is a lack of full time job opportunities. Zeidy has taken it upon herself to create a way to generate income in an effort to improve living conditions for her family. Zeidy is in the business of pig rearing. She hopes to use this loan to invest in the purchase of livestock and animal feed. Zeidy works with her husband to ensure the good health of her animals. Together, they clean and feed the pigs twice a day. 

Zeidy has already spent some time studying business administration. Her goals are: to continue her studies and obtain a university education, achieve financial independence and open her own business one day. The main challenges that Zeidy faces, with respect to her pig rearing activity, is a lack of working capital. This loan will help to address this challenge. Likewise, the fluctuating prices of livestock and the market price for pork products has a great impact on the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock (pigs) and animal feed.

loans.name: Panji

texts.en:
Y. Panji is 60 years old. He is married with 6 children. Panji and his whole family are farmers. He plants wheat, onion, potato and other vegetables. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. At the same time he raises cattle. 

Thanks to his savings, Panji was able to arrange the marriage of his elder son. His sons are now adult and are his biggest supporters. They help him in anything they can and help take good care of the crops. A client is on the far right side of the picture. With this loan, Panji would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand his irrigation system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of chicken, oil, rice, beans and pop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Christine has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more vegetables. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Christine hopes to expand her business. Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play netball.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
La señora Ida es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias, del distrito de Callería, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad.
Lleva 12 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo: cosméticos y perfumería.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más productos; 5 colonias, 3 potes de crema, 3 champús, 2 colonias para hombre, 2 lociones para después de afeitarse, 5 labiales, 2 rubores, 2 sombras. 3 lápiz delineadores y 5 esmaltes.
La señora Ida vende sus productos para poder sentirse útil y pueda comprarse algunas cosas que ella necesita, gracias a sus ventas ella puede aportar para los gastos de su hogar.
"Manuela ramos les da la oportunidad de poder trabajar a todas las mujeres que lo desean".
texts.en:
Ida is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 60 years old, married and has four adult children.

She has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos for 12 years.  She sells products via catalogue: cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use this 2500 new sol loan to buy more products: 5 colognes, 3 jars of cream, 3 shampoos, 2 men’s colognes, 2 after shave lotions, 5 lipsticks, 2 blushes, 2 eye shadows, 3 eyeliner pencils and 5 nail polishes.

Ida sells her products to feel useful and to be able to buy a few things she needs.  Thanks to her sales she’s able to contribute to household expenses.

“Manuela Ramos gives all the women who want to work the opportunity to do so.”

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell via catalogue.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Gloria después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica atender su salón de belleza, ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza donde realiza peinados, cortes, cambio de color de cabello y muchas cosas más. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Gloria invertirá el dinero del préstamo para comprar mas materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo champus, colorantes, tijeras y muchas cosas que necesita para el salón de belleza. El sueño de Gloria es comprar su casa y abrir un salón de belleza moderno. 
 
Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 40, has three children and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing her housework, Gloria works in her beauty salon. She has a small beauty salon where she does hairstyling, haircuts, colour changes and many other things. She has done this work for 20 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into it.
Gloria will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of more materials for her work, such as shampoos, dyes, scissors, and many other items that she needs for the beauty salon. Gloria's dream is to buy a house and open a modern beauty salon.

Gloria belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank and is grateful for the opportunities offered. She promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her work, such as shampoos, dyes, scissors and many items

loans.name: Rosa Catalina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, vive con su familia y dos hijos D. 18 y 14 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Jiquilisco desD. hace 10 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar gas, maíz y leña, estos materiales son los necesarios para que ella pueda realizar las ventas diariamente. Con este préstamo podrá adquirir la materia prima y continuar en el negocio.
El objetivo D. doña Rosa es dar a sus hijos el estudio necesario para que se puedan defender y mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa, who is 42 years old, lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután, She lives with her family, which includes two children of 18 and 14. She sells tortillas. Her business has been located in the municipal market of Jiquilisco for 10 years.

She is applying for a loan to buy gas, corn, and firewood. These materials are necessary for her daily sales. With this loan, she will be able to acquire her basic materials and continue her business.

Rosa's goal is to give her children the necessary education so that they can be independent and improve their future.

loans.use: Buy gas, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es: Aurea, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis de 44 años, que es chofer y de su joven hija, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante se esfuerzan a diario por salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de desayunos y menús a algunos trabajadores que laboran cerca de su casa. Cada día antes de las 8 de la mañana sale con su pequeña carretilla a ofrecerles desayuno a sus comensales que por lo general están en diferentes negocios de la zona. De esta manera sirviendo sus desayunos (bebidas calientes y panes con distintos rellenos) y jalando su carretilla, se la pasa toda la mañana, y cuando termina, al mediodía, se dirige satisfecha con sus ganancias a su casa. De esta manera ayuda a su esposo con los constantes gastos del hogar, y a veces cuando su hija no estudia la ayuda en el negocio, pero generalmente lo realiza sola. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a brindar menú a los mismos comensales que les ofrece desayunos. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio e instalar un puesto de venta de desayunos y comidas en algún mercado de su zona. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Aurea tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor para continuar preparando sus desayunos y comidas, pues quiere mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Aurea is 41 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband Luis who is 44 years old and a driver.  She also lives with her young daughter.  They all have a great desire to get ahead in life and work hard every day to achieve this.

For 3 years, Aurea has been selling breakfasts and lunches to workers who work near her home.  Every day, before 8.00am, she goes out with her little cart to offer breakfast to her customers who generally work in local businesses.  She spends the whole morning serving her breakfasts (hot drinks and buns with different fillings) and pushing her cart.  When she finishes at midday, she returns home, satisfied with the money she has made.   In this way, she helps her husband with their never-ending household expenses.  Sometimes, when her daughter is not studying, she helps her in the business but she generally works alone.

In parallel with her breakfast business, Aurea also provides lunches to the same customers who buy her breakfasts.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to expand her business and set up a sales location in a local market where she can sell her breakfasts and meals.

This is Aurea's third loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time as she doesn't want to let down the people who made her loan possible because this money will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Aurea plans to invest her loan money in buying ingredients wholesale so that she can continue preparing her breakfasts and meals as she would like to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making breakfasts and meals

loans.name: Roserielle

texts.en:
Roserielle E. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zambonga del Sur. She is 19 years old. Roserielle is single. To make a living, Roserielle owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing in the local community. Roserielle has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Roserielle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roserielle is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase pillowcases, blankets and other products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roserielle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pillowcases, blankets and other products for sale

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Josefina is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Josefina buys and sells green bananas in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Josefina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas. This will be the first loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet S. lives in the Kalerwe neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom attend school.   Annet has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Annet    sells her products from home by means of retail.  Annet is requesting a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bunches of bananas.  The main business challenges for Annet include thieves and seasonality.  Her goal for her business is to start selling on wholesale only.  She would also buy a plot of land.   Annet lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon K. is forty-seven years old, married, and they have three children between fourteen years old and three years old. His business is located at Eregi in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area found in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the sugarbelt region.

Simon cuts and sells timber to other timber sellers and carpenters in the area. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is getting a permit for cutting down trees. However, he works very hard and engages in planting trees to keep his business doing well and to ensure that his business is not detrimental to the environment.

He is using his loan of 40,000 KES to buy a power saw to grow his business. His dream is to better his business and provide a good education to his children. He describes himself as focussed and persistent.

loans.use: to buy a power saw

loans.name: Elizebah

texts.en:
Elizebah is 25 years old and married with two school-aged children who both attend school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 3 years in western Kenya. Her farm produces milk and tomatoes which are all sold locally. 

She has requested for this loan of 31,200 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's livelihood. Her primary challenge has been the high cost of artificial insemination which she cannot afford. In the future, she plans to acquire quality dairy cows that will improve her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El señor Víctor es artesano de zapatos de cholita su taller es en su mismo domicilio realiza los zapatos y después lo comercializa  en la feria 16 de julio los jueves y domingo ya esta con ese trabajo mas de 10 años tiene mucha experiencia  también tiene empleados que dependen de su trabajo solicito el crédito para mas material  por que le llegaron contratos para las fiestas de 16 julio y agosto    es cliente nuevo  vive en el alto por la zona alto lima en  domicilio  propio, es una persona muy amigable tiene muchos clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Víctor is an artisanal “cholita” (indigenous woman) shoe maker; his shop is in his home.  He makes the shoes and then sells them at the Thursday and Sunday 16 de Julio market.  He’s been in this line of work for over 10 years and has much experience.  He also has employees that depend on his work.  He requested the loan for more materials because he’s gotten contracts for the July 16th and August holidays.  

He is a new client.  He lives in his own house located in El Alto’s Alto Lima sector.  He is a very friendly person and has many customers thanks to the good work he does.  He’s grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy artisanal shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Perfecto Alberto

texts.es:
Perfecto Alberto tiene 65 años, es soltero vive con una  hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Perfecto  se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Disfruta mucho escuchar musica nacional.
texts.en:
Perfecto Alberto is 65 years old, single, and lives with one of his daughters in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Perfecto is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Perfecto is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  He doesn't face any great challenges in his work.  His dream is to own his own home.

Perfecto very much enjoys listening to Ecuadorian music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Thessane Armen

texts.fr:
Cliente de 30 ans,célibataire sans enfant.Après l'obtention de sa licence, n'ayant pas pu trouve du travail , elle commence une pâtisserie , ou elle fait des beignets, brioches, pains au lait, elle vend en moyenne 18.000 a 25.000 fr par jour, ses gâteaux sont vendus en détail et en gros dans les différents marches et parfois dans les boutiques d'alimentation de son quartier.

A l'octroi de son premier prêt elle compte s'approvisionner en produits de première nécessite comme 2 sacs de farine, 1 bidon d'huile de 25l, 50kg de sucre,25kg de lait, de la levure , du sucre vanille et des palettes des œufs.

Pour mieux écouler ses produits , elle use de plusieurs stratégies,faire des bon prix, gentillesse a la clientèle.
Pour le futur elle pense ouvrir une petite pâtisserie et embauche une autre personne qui va travailler avec elle, épargner pour pouvoir réaliser ses ambitions d'ouvrir un salon de the un jour.
texts.en:
A 30-year-old client, single with no children.  After earning her degree and being unable to find work, she launched a pastry business where she now makes beignets, sweet breads, and milk breads.  She brings in an average of 18,000 to 25,000 Congolese francs every day.  She sells her cakes both retail and wholesale in various markets, and sometimes in little food shops in her neighborhood.

She plans on using her first loan to purchase some basic supplies: 2 bags of flour, a 25-liter jug of oil, 50 kg of sugar, 25 kg of powdered milk, yeast, vanilla sugar and cartons of eggs.

She has several strategies for moving her products, including low prices and friendly customer service.

In the future, she plans on opening a small pastry shop of her own and hiring another person to work with her.  She also wants to save money to fulfill her dream of one day opening a tea room.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar, bags of powdered milk, jugs of oil, bags of flour and cartons of eggs

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 26 años, es una mujer viuda, madre de un hijo llamado Miguel de 04 años de edad, viven en casa de sus suegros y lo que más desea  es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su querido hijo. Ingrid a su corta edad ya vive en carne propia lo que es el sufrimiento, hace 01 año su pareja falleció por causas naturales. Desde entonces Ingrid aprendió a trabajar muy duro para cuidar a su hijo. Ella es odontóloga y trabaja en el centro de Salud Santa Rosa, pero el fin de semana aprovecha para vender ropa. Gracias a su esfuerzo y las ganancias obtenidas trata de educar y brindar un alimento adecuado a su hijo. Por otra parte agradece a los financistas por depositar su plena confianza en ella ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos compró mercadería en ropa. Menciona además que ya término de pagar sus cuotas, es por ello que participa nuevamente en los créditos. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo y ahorrando sus ingresos económicos ya que tiene planificado abrir su propio consultorio dental dentro de la ciudad de Santa Rosa. Este es su segundo crédito y de ante mano pide la ayuda de todos ustedes para que pueda continuar trabajando. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará variedad de ropa exclusivamente ropa de verano.
texts.en: Ingrid is a 26 year-old widow, and is the mother of a 4 year-old son named Miguel.  She and her son live with her in-laws, and what she wants most of all is to have a better income so that she can have economic stability for her beloved son.   Even at her young age, Ingrid has gone through a lot of suffering; a year ago her husband died of natural causes.  Since then Ingrid has learned to work very hard to care for her son.  She is a dentist who works in the Health Center of Santa Rosa, but on the weekends she sells clothing.  Through her efforts and the earnings she obtains, she is trying to adequately feed and educate her child.  She is grateful to the lenders for the confidence they placed in her, because thanks to their support she was able  to buy merchandise in the form of clothing.
