She mentions that she already paid off the prior loan, and so she is participating in another credit cycle.  She has plans to continue to grow her business and to save her earnings, since she wants to open her own dental office in the city of Santa Rosa.  This is her second loan, and beforehand she asks for the help of all of you so that she can continue to work.  With the loan she requests, she will buy a variety of summer clothing.

loans.use: to buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Dina Raquel

texts.es:
Dina, se dedica a la venta de verduras, vive con su madre, dicho negocio lo tiene en la calle principal del mercado municipal, tiene 4 años de estar en el negocio, su madre le ayuda para atender el negocio, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras para fortalecer el negocio, su propósito es surtirlo de güisquiles, papas, plátanos, jilotes y pipianes, con esto surtirá el negocio, ofreciendo a los clientes verduras frescas.
Con el negocio su propósito es tener mayor variedad de verduras, en un futuro comprarse un vehículo para transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Dina sells vegetables. She has been in business for 4 years. Her business is on the main street of the municipal market, and her hours of sale are from 7:00am to 5:00pm. She lives with her mother, who helps her look after the business.

She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables in order to build up her business. Her intention is to stock it with güisquiles and pipianes (types of squash), potatoes, plantains, and corn, offering her customers fresh vegetables.  

Her goal for her business is to have a greater variety of vegetables, and in the future to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy güisquiles and pipianes (types of squash), potatoes, plantains, and corn, for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and married. She has two children aged 12 and 6. Nancy and her family live in Banga, South Cotabato.

Nancy is a farmer. She has been growing rice and corn crops for 10 years. Nancy sells her harvest at the market and earns about 6500 PHP per month. Nancy works hard to improve her business and provide for the increasing needs in her household.

Nancy has requested a loan to purchase one sack of seeds, two sacks of fertilizers and one quart of herbicide. She hopes to acquire the farming equipment she needs. She also hopes for her children to be able to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of seeds, two sacks of fertilizers, and one quart of herbicide.

loans.name: Saliya's Group

texts.en:
Saliya is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and is married to a driver. Together with the husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both children are studying at school. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 8000 soms Saliya purchased a cow, and since that moment she has been breeding farm animals. Reselling livestock after fattening them, she earns about 10000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for the family to purchase a minibus for transporting passengers. 

With the money received from this loan, Saliya wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a thirty-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family is vested in him and his dream is to educate all his children up to University. He has been in the bakery business for one year  and he got his initial capital from the profits he had made from his retail shop. His hardship  is limited funds to meet the different tastes of his customers and his dream is a modern bakery. Julius needs the loan facility to buy wheat and baking powder.

loans.use: To buy wheat and baking powder.

loans.name: Darine

texts.en:
Darine is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. In 2009, she decided to start her own business. So she opened a flower nursery, an occupation she really likes. Her work consists in selling flowers in addition to arranging and organizing them in order to make original designs for special occasions such as weddings, special events, etc… 

Over the years, her work has been developed and she has been able to build a good business reputation. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her purchases of flowers. In the future, she is planning to further expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her purchases of flowers.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Andresa has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall. She has been in this business for ten years.
In the future, Andresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 38 year old married man.  They have two children, ages 3 and 7. He describes himself as God fearing, honest, and ambitious. 

He operates a rickshaw transport services business where he provides transport services to local people.  He has been involved in this business for one year, near a residential area in Mombasa. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as fluctuating fuel prices. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase another rickshaw.  His business goal is to own a fleet of rickshaws within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have a garage and an auto spare parts shop. He also hopes to give his children a good university level education.

loans.use: to buy another rickshaw

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan tiene 53 años de edad, el tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 12 años la cual la tiene en su casa, el está muy contento porque dice que ha tenido buenas ganancias por que la carretera que pasa por su casa la están arreglando y la están pavimentando y eso lo tiene muy contento porque así su localidad será más conocida, ahí es muy conocido por el cultivo de aguacate de muy buena calidad. Don Juan está pidiendo un crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes el comprara aceite, frijol, arroz, huevo, leche, atún, chiles, papel higiénico etc. Don Juan dice que el comprara en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a su comunidad donde le dan precios bajos. Dice que gracias al crédito él puede tener su tienda surtida para que sus vecinos no se trasladen a otras localidades lejanas.
texts.en: Juan, 53 years old, has run a small general store out of his home for the past 12 years. He is satisfied with his business because he has made a good living. He is also encouraged that they are improving and paving the highway near his home because it will make his store better known. The area is well-known for having excellent avocados. Juan will use the loan to purchase products for his store. He will buy products such as cooking oil, beans, rice, eggs, milk, chilis, and toilet paper. He says that he will buy the products from various stores in a nearby town where the prices are lower. He is thankful for the loan because he can stock his store so that his neighbors do not switch to other shops in other communities.

loans.use: restock his general store

loans.name: Dulcinea De Las Flores

texts.es: Dulcinea D. las Flores D. 38 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y dos hijos. Dulcinea es una mujer increíble la cual ha trabajado toda su vida para llevar el pan D. cada día a su hogar. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar D. residencia en la cual venD. variedad D. productos tales como: cereales, detergente, golosinas, aceite, pan dulce, y muchas cosas más que los clientes prefieren. Ella se caracteriza por ser emprendedora y muy  arriesgada. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida. Todo esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la comprar D. artículos tales como: cereales, aceite, golosinas, detergen, pan dulce, papel y D. mas productos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. Tiene plena confianza en Dios y en sus esfuerzos que D. esta manera logrará sacar adelante a su familia y podrá mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Dulcinea D. las Flores, 38, lives in her own house with her family comprised of her husband and two children.  Dulcinea is an incredible woman who has been working her entire life to bring daily bread to her home.  Several years ago she managed to establish a small, home-based little store where she sells a variety of products like: cereals, detergent, snacks, oil, sweet bread and many other things her customers prefer.  She is noted for being very enterprising and daring.  Her dream is to see her business flourish and to attain a better quality of life.

All this motivates her to request this INTEGRAL loan to invest in her business buying such items as: cereals, oil, snacks, detergent, sweet bread, paper and other products that are attractive to customers.  She has full trust in God and in her efforts that she will manage to move her family forward and improve their quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 31-year-old married man and father of one lovely child.  He sells coffee, hot chocolate, and several other hot and cold drinks to his customers. His business is improving, although he has been working in this field for only a year.  Ziad used to work as a driver, but he wanted to improve his living through starting his own business.  He took a courageous step.  Most of his clients encourage him to expand his offerings, and he is taking a step towards expanding by requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua.  

With the loan, he will buy a new espresso machine, which will respond to more customers at the same time.  Ziad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles.  He is a borrower in good standing and the loans reflect positively on his social situation.  He hopes to keep expanding his business and his customers' trust.

loans.use: To buy new espresso machine necessary for improving his business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Analiza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analiza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María,vive con su familia, ella es vendedora de medicinas, realiza visitas domiciliares para ofrecer sus productos. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, comprando medicamentos para la venta, vitaminas, productos para fortalecer los nervios, antibióticos, y algunos más que sean necesarios y demandados por los clientes.
Con el préstamo quiere incrementar la mercadería, continuar ofreciendo a los clientes buenos productos para contar con su preferencia.
texts.en:
María, lives with her family. She sells drugs. She visits homes in order to offer her products. 

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to strengthen the business, buying drugs to sell, vitamins, products to steady the nerves, antibiotics, and some more that are necessary and requested by her customers.

With the money from the loan she wants to buy merchandise in order to continue to offer her clients the good products of their preference.

loans.use: to buy medicine, antibiotics, and vitamins

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 49 and has four children.  

Huong's husband is a worker. Huong has been earning a living by operating a food stall for nearly ten years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demands. 

Huong hopes that, through the loan, she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food.

loans.name: Miryam Soledad

texts.es: La señora Miryam a sus 40 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida y arreglos de modistería. Gracia a esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Con el ánimo de mejorar los servicios prestados y su producción, la señora Miryam requiere de la compra de una maquina recubridora e insumos como telas e hilos. El sueño de la señora Miryam es poder ampliar su negocio y brindarles educación y bienestar a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Miryam is 40 years old and earns her living by producing custom-made clothes and performing alterations. Thanks to this business, she is able to help her two children (ages 9 and 3) move forward.

With the intention of improving her services and her productivity, Sra. Miryam is requesting to buy a cover stitch machine and supplies such as fabric and thread. Her dream is to expand her business and provide for her two children’s well-being and their education.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch machine, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old and married. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Susan sells ice cream in the local community to earn a living and she has been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. 

In 2010, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Susan wants to expand her ice cream business and to buy more ice cream carts.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 7 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Elizabeth no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado, en sus ratos libres le pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elizabeth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y gaseosas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Elizabeth se siente muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la tramitación y formalización de un pequeño terreno, el cual compró hace poco y en el que pronto iniciará la construcción de su propia vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su pequeño convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 36, lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and her 7-year-old son. She loves them very much and they are her reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, puts all her effort into moving her family forward. Unfortunately, Elizabeth was unable to finish secondary school, because from the time she was young she had to work to help her parents with household expenses. But she would have liked to stud secretarial work. In her free time, she likes to walk through the warm and welcoming streets of her city and sometimes she makes a delicious chicken and rice dish to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, she works in her small business selling beauty products. She also has a small business selling candies and soft drinks. She works every day, from very early in the morning and she can work for about 10 hours. She likes her work and she believes that it is going well for her because of her good prices and the friendly way she treats her customers. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to them, she will be able to cover the expenses of the processing and formalization of the title to a small plot of land, which she bought a little while ago, and on which she will soon start building her own home. She will keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream of seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to cover expenses for the processing and formalization of the title to her land.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en: Mishi is borrowing for the fourth time to renovate her fish stall and educate her children. She is grateful to VisionFund Kenya for changing the lives of her family. She hopes to own a cafe besides her fish business in future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. Rael is a very hard-working woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Rael offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mum, Rael has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. 

Rael has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. 
Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.
During this festive season grant her a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is excited to have the opportunity to post another loan through Kiva. With the help of her last loan, Elizabeth was able to purchase more lamps from Elephant Energy and her sales increased dramatically as a result–in fact, her sales increased so much that Elizabeth was able to pay back her loan almost three weeks early. December is an important sales month in Namibia, making this second loan even more critical than the first! If Elizabeth is able to purchase additional stock, her sales will increase and Elizabeth will end 2015 strong. The lights Elizabeth sells are used by school children to continue studying once the sun goes down, by market stall keepers to keep shops open an additional 4 hours each day, and by families in distant villages to charge cell phones and stay connected.

loans.use: To purchase lighting products for sale to local businesses and sales agents who will then sell the products retail.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is married with four children. He started his business in 1998 he greatly depends on his business for up keep of his family. With the loan of $175 he will be able to restock his shop on which it supplies the community members with items like cloths etc. It would then generate enough profit to support his family.

loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows how to keep records of her business. She needs a loan of $650 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Christopher Simiyu

texts.en: Christopher is a father of six children, all of whom are in primary school.  He started his business in 1982 when he saw that there was a need for it in the community.  He makes fertilizer which he then sells to maize farmers in his community. He is also a farmer. Through his business, he has been able to provide employment to one person whom he works hand in hand with. He has also helped farmers achieve greater and higher quality yields.  With a loan from PEMCI, he intents to increase his stock of fertilizer and meet the demands of his clients by expanding his operations.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Altagracia

texts.en: Maria is a woman who started over 5 years ago selling clothes to her neighbors. Due to difficulties in her life, she had to stop the sales and work on a salon in the meanwhile. With this loan, she wants to resume her sales, therefore increasing her income and helping her husband who works in "edesur," which is an electricity company. She plans on buying her inventory in Elias Piña, a town close to the border line between the Dominican Republic and Haiti. It is a very long trip from Santo Domingo. She doesn't own a establishment, but she is going to sell her goods in her house which is pretty common in the area.

loans.use: To buy clothes and accessories to resume her business

loans.name: Ruhaddin

texts.en: Ruhaddin is a 46 year old resident of the Khachmaz Region in Northeast Azerbaijan. He is a taxi driver and owns his own car. He has been engaged in this business since 2004. He is the only person earning income in his family, which means he has to work very hard. His car brakes down very often as he drives long distances every day. He wants capital to repair his vehicle. He applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow $1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To Buy New Tires and Repaid His Car

loans.name: Faapale

texts.en: Faapale is married with four kids and she is very good at sewing different types of clothes. She applies for a first time loan in the amount of $300USD. She will use the loan to buy all the materials needed for her business especially a new hand sewing machine which is a very expensive tool she currently cannot afford. She sells her sewing stuffs at the flea markets in town and she sometimes has orders from big shops. She hopes that her next loan will be used to make her business big and buy even more materials. She is very happy with her business and hopes to stay in it for a long time.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Masitoh

texts.en: Masitoh is 38 years old and sells snacks and household goods at her small grocery store. She earns about $5 per day while her husband, M., is a laborer who earns $10 per week. Masitoh has applied for a $100 loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Mr. Godwin A. is 49 years old. He is married with five children and lives in Benin City. He sells engine oil and solicits a loan of $525 to buy more gallons of engine oil for sale. He learned the business for a period of three years after which he started his own in 2003. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil for sale

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Mr. Vincent O. is 25 years old and hails from Benin-city, Edo State, Nigeria. He weaves and design fabrics for customers. He has been in business for 3 years and has been a LAPO client for 2 years. He needs a loan of $850 to buy an additional sewing machine and more weaving materials.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and cloth-weaving materials

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira is a 52-year-old woman. She lives with her husband in Borj El Barajneh. Amira is a sock wholesaler. This is her fourth loan from Al Majmoua. Amira is planning to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Masika's Umoja Ni Nguvu Yetu. Group

texts.en:
Masika is 38 years old, married, and has 1 child. Masika owns small business, which she began in 2005. She begins work at 10 AM, and ends at 8 PM. She earns a total of $200 in profits from her sales.

Masika now hopes for a loan to purchase more items for her business. She will share this loan with sub-group members Amina and Chekanao, who run their own small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour O. engages in a unique business. He sells planks and wood. He buys logs of wood and converts them into planks. Favour is 33 years old and he is single. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more timber for conversion into planks. With this he hopes his profits will improve.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Naeem's Group

texts.en:
Naeem B., wife of M., lives in a small city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house. She is a mother of one daughter, who is 13 years old, named Saima Parvez. Saima is in the 4th standard grade and wants to be a teacher. Naseem and her husband Parvez want to fulfill their daughter’s wish. Her husband is a fruit seller. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Naeem successfully completed her frist loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She applies for this loan for her husband’s fruit business.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Kalsoom B. wants a loan for her cosmetic business. Safia B. wants a loan for her husband’s shoe business. Zahida B. wants a loan for repairing her husband’s auto-rickshaw. Bilquis B. wants a loan for her shoe business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve the financial condition of the businesses

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema A. is 36-year-old mother of three, resident of Kitunda in Dar es Salaam. She runs a grocery, a business she has been doing for the past six years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio P. lives on Carlos Romero street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in the city of La Paz. He is married and has children that are completely independent and occupy various bedrooms in the house. Julio has an automobile that is used for public transportation, which helps him to generate daily income (obviously including food and drink). The requested loan is to finish the construction of a room in his house (that will be a family room); Julio's objective is the provide more comfort for his wife and to live better.

His credit history is excellent, therefore, nothing is impeding his credit application.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio P. tiene su domicilio en la calle Carlos Romero de la zona de Tembladerani (ciudad de La Paz), es casado y tiene hijos los cuales son completamente independientes y ocupan las distintas habitaciones de la casa. Julio tiene un automóvil que es usado para el transporte público, lo cuál le ayuda a generar ingresos diarios (aquí obviamente se incluye comida y bebida). El crédito solicitado es para concluir la construcción de una habitación (que será una sala de estar), el objetivo de Julio es brindar mayor comodidad a su esposa y vivir mejor. Sus antecedentes crediticios son excelentes, por eso, nada obstaculiza su solicitud de crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a family room

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia B. is a 35-year-old mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband in taking care of the kids in school. She has operated a sewing workshop for the past twenty years. She is training seven young ladies in sewing to pass on to them her skills and experience for their future careers.

Felicia sews all sorts of women's wear with various styles such as kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. Besides sewing, Felicia also sells grocery products. She wants to use this loan to buy more sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency.

Felicia hopes to increase her savings to support her kids in school. She is a member of the community group called "Nyame na aye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials such as linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Laurinda  Raul

texts.pt:
Laurinda Raul Ngenha nasceu na província de Maputo distrito de Manhiça ao sul de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, é divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 21, 18 e 15 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Laurinda estudou até 2ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras foi criada pela mãe separada e eram 12 irmãos,  aos 18 anos teve o seu primeiro filho e aos 20 anos se casou maritalmente, marido que vieram a separar se em 1993, 3 anos depois de se mudar do distrito de Manhiça para cidade de Maputo. Antes de mudar se já praticava o negocio onde passou de vários no incio vendia carvão, depois vendia ovos e mais tarde começa a vende de cereais e este continua até data hoje.

Laurinda vive basicamente de negocio de venda de cerais  e leguminosas e nao tem empregado apenas contracta temporariamente para o carregamento. Os principais cereais que vende são Milho, Feijão e amendoim, onde adquira a lata de amendoim 200,00mt e vende por 450,00mt. Tem tido rendimento mensal de 18.000,00mt a 20.000,00mt. Nao faz poupança bancária periódico apenas uma poupança vulgarmente chamado por Xitique que consistem numa pagamente de todos contra todos, sendo uma de cada vez.

Assim Laurinda pretende com este empréstimo aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Tem planos para futuro a construção de dependências uma vez que tem um quintal muito garnde.
texts.en:
Laurinda Raul Ngenha was born in the province of Maputo, district of Manhiça, in the south of Mozambique. She is 42 years old, divorced, and the mother of 3 children with ages between 15 and 21. She only supports her children. Laurinda studied until the 2nd grade and stopped for a lack of financial conditions. She was raised by her mother who was separated, along with 12 siblings. When she was 18 years old she had her first child, and at 20 she was married. She separated in 1993 3 years after moving from the Manhiça district to the city of Maputo. Before moving she was already in business selling coal, but she moved on to sell eggs and later began to sell grains and cereals which she continues to sell today. Laurinda lives basically selling grains and legumes. She does not have any employees except for contracting temporarily for shipments. The principal foods that she sells are corn, beans, and peanuts. She acquires a can of peanuts for 200MT and sells it for 450MT. She has had a monthly income of between 18,000MT to 20,000MT. She does not make periodic bank savings, only a common saving called Xitique that consists of a payment of all against all, being one each time. Laurinda intends to use this loan to increase the volume of her business. She has future plans to construct some rooms once she has a big enough yard.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains for resale

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sueri

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah tidak muda lagi Ni Nengah Sueri saat ini tinggal dirumah sendirian. Anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah, namun ada beberapa anaknya yang sudah menikah masih tinggal dalam satu area namun sudah membuat rumah sendiri.Walaupun hanya tingga sendirian Ni Nengah Sueri tidak kesepian karena anaknya masih ada yang tinggal disebelah rumahnya. Usaha yang yang ditekuni sejak lama yaitu Usaha Warung. Warung dibuka didepan rumahnya sehingga dalam sehari-hari Ni Nengah Sueri dapat melakukan pekerjaan dirumahnya.Warung dibuka sejak  pukul 07.00 pagi  s/d 07.00 malam. Barang – barang yang dijual adalah barang yang sering diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitar seperti beras, minyak, aneka macam makanan ringan, sabun cuci, sabun mandi, dll.

Ni Nengah Sueri berencana untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Untuk mengatasi modal usahanya dalam usahanya, Ni Nengah Sueri mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan  pinjaman dana dari Lembaga adat yang ada didesanya yang sudah menjadi binaan Yayasan Dinari. Dengan adanya sokongan dana, Ni nengah Sueri yakin usahanya akan maju.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Sueri has been quite old, and live alone. All her children have got married, and have moved to their own home. Some are near to Ni Nengah Sueri's home, that makes her not too lonely. Ni Nengah Suari runs a grocery store. She has a booth in front of her house that starts to serve costumers from 7 am to 7 pm. She provides all stuffs that usually needed by community surround, i.e. rice, palm oil, various snacks, soaps, detergent, etc. A traditional organization in Ni Nengah Suari's village which earns assistance form DINARI, entrusted her with loan to develop her store. She is sure that by the loan, her business will grow.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital

loans.name: Isabel Alicia

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni”  hace 5 años, vive en el Sector Huaychani del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 23 años, es soltera y se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro ganado porcino y ovino de Bolivia, negocio al cual sigue dedicándose día a día.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles el que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara
01 ganado vacuno a S/. 1.200

Su deseo es realizar negocio de ropa y vender en la Ciudad de Arequipa.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a member of the Communal Bank “Chojchoni” for 5 years. She lives in the Huaychani sector of Copani district, Yunguyo province, Puno, Peru. She is 23 years old, single, and raises livestock. With the first loan for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles she bought pigs and sheep from Bolivia, a business she dedicates herself to day after day. With this loan for S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 1 head of cattle at S/.1.200. Her wish is to have a business selling clothing in Arequipa city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one head of cattle

loans.name: Euloge

texts.fr: Euloge K. s’est marié avec Irène Hodonou. Ils ont quatre enfants, âgés 12, 7, 4, et 3 mois. Ils sont tous scolarisés. Euloge est né le 11 Mars 1965 à Porto Novo, et actuellement il a trois emplois. Il enseigne le physique, il vend les choses informatiques, et il est contractuel. Euloge va utiliser son prêt pour acheter un nouveau photocopieur pour sa deuxième entreprise, une boutique avec tous les trucs informatiques comme les clés, le papier, et les ordinateurs pour réparer. Il a commencé son entreprise en 1998. Il a un autre salarié dans son entreprise. Il lance également un projet de construction avec la terre rouge.
texts.en:
Euloge K. is married to Irène Hodonou. They have four children, aged 3 months, 4, 7, and 12. All the school-aged children are in school. Euloge was born on March 11, 1965 in Porto Novo and currently holds three jobs: he teaches physics, sells computer products, and is a contract employee. Euloge is going to use his loan to buy a new photocopier for his second business, a shop with all sorts of computer products like keys, paper and computers to be repaired. He began his business in 1998 and works with one other employee. He is also starting a construction project on the "terre rouge" (red earth road).

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan S. is married. His family lives in Korolyovo. Ivan sells household chemicals in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Small ventures like Ivan’s become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Ukraine. Ivan’s business has helped him survive when financial recession hit Ukraine again in 2000. Ivan has been in the trade for 5 years. Currently, his inventory amounts to 40,000 Grivnas; his income is about 5,000 Grivnas a month.

Ivan’s business is characterized by stability and positive performance. Inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and other household chemicals. Ivan wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnas to increase his turnover capital. He is hoping to boost further development of his business with this additional assistance.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Gomez

texts.en:
Gomez A. is engaged in selling crabs. He is a 43-year-old father of three children and a fisherman. His own catch is what he sells to provide for all their needs. Every night Gomez goes out fishing, he throws his nets in the sea and hopes to have something to catch. He wants to work hard to send all of his children to college so that when they are older, they will have better lives for their future children. Now, Gomez sells crabs because he can earn more with this kind of endeavor. Aside from the fish he sells, he also markets crabs. 

Gomez is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase crab nets and repair the pump boats. In this way, the boat will be used for fishing, and he can deliver his catch to other places. 

CEVI helps fishermen sustain their livelihoods and businesses. Their being part of CEVI entitles them for easy access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase a crab net and repair the pump boat

loans.name: Lucia Margarita Palacios

texts.es: Lucia Margarita P. vive en Zacatecoluca departamento la Paz, Lucia tiene 41 años edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que han tenido que dejar sus estudios por falta de ingresos en la familia. Si bien el esposo de Lucia  provee económicamente, ya que se dedica a la plantación. Lucia se dedica a la venta de frutas en Zacatecoluca hace 21 años pero con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia, en estos últimos meses ha logrado expandir sus ventas en el interior del país llevando de sus frutas a San Miguel y San Salvador. Ahora Lucia solicita un crédito para compra de mangos; ya que esta época en El Salvador se da mucho esta fruta y los clientes la buscan.
texts.en:
Lucia Margarita P. lives in Zacatecoluca in the state of La Paz. Lucia is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons who have been unable to finish their education due to lack of money. Lucia's husband is able to provide for his family since he has a good job as a construction worker in a housing project. Lucia has been selling fruit in Zacatecoluca over the past 21 years with a lot of effort and perseverance. During these last couple of months, they have been able to sell more fruit in other areas such as San Miguel and San Salvador. Lucia is now requesting for a loan since she would like to buy mangos which are in season in El Salvador and they are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mangos

loans.name: Mario Filadelfo

texts.es: Mario Filadelfo P. de 53 años de edad, reside en La Libertad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad. El posee un negocio de venta de comida y junto a su compañera de vida trabajan arduamente. El lugar de venta está muy bien ubicado, debido a que todos los días llega una cantidad de personas bastante razonable e incluso en su mayoría son clientes frecuentes los cuales llegan a consumir sus alimentos todos los días. Mario solicita un préstamo para invertir más en su negocio y de esta manera tener muchos más productos alimenticios que ofrecer, ya que uno de los mayores deseos de Mario es el de obtener mayores clientes y poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas, ya que dentro de sus principales metas esta el poder brindarles una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Mario Filadelfo P. is 53 years old, lives in La Libertad with his life partner and two daughters ages 17 and 15. He has a business selling food, and both he and his partner work very hard. The shop is very well located, since they get very good foot traffic every day, usually repeat clients who come by to eat their meals on a daily basis. Mario wants a loan to invest more capital in his business so that he can have a greater variety of foods in order to increase his customer base, and thus be able to offer his daughters everything that they need, particularly a good education. de 53 años de edad, reside en La Libertad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad. El posee un negocio de venta de comida y junto a su compañera de vida trabajan arduamente. El lugar de venta está muy bien ubicado, debido a que todos los días llega una cantidad de personas bastante razonable e incluso en su mayoría son clientes frecuentes los cuales llegan a consumir sus alimentos todos los días. Mario solicita un préstamo para invertir más en su negocio y de esta manera tener muchos más productos alimenticios que ofrecer, ya que uno de los mayores deseos de Mario es el de obtener mayores clientes y poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas, ya que dentro de sus principales metas esta el poder brindarles una mejor educación.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de más productos

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Kanté est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle veut maintenir son activité qui consiste à vendre des crèmes, de la glace et des jus. Fatoumata vends auss des bananes. Elle compte, avec ses revenus, payer la scolarité à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Kanté, age 45, is married and the mother of 3 children. She wants to sustain her business consisting in selling creams, ice creams, and drinks. Fatoumata also sells bananas. With her income, she intends to pay the school expenses of her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell creams, ice creams, and bananas

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and has been operating a mini eatery in her village for three months.  Her husband is working as a driver in Saudi Arabia.  They have three children: Jemardan - 15 years old, third year high school; Daniel - 11 years old, grade six and their youngest, Micah, 5 years old.  They are currently residing in Baranggay Centro 2 Angadanan, Isabela.

She wants a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use as business capital.  Maribel hopes to make her business grow to help her husband support the growing needs of their family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Luai

texts.en:
Luai is a 31-year-old man who lives in Palestine with his wife and three children. Luai operates a mini-market where he sells cooking products and simple foods such as seeds, nuts, and candies.

Luai has asked for a loan of US $3000 from Ryada to increase business stock and fulfill customer demands. Let us help this father, who with effort and dedication will continue his hard work for prosperity.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is 45 years old and married with two children. She has a shop where she sells drinks at retail to her customers.  She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Due to the economic crisis, life has become difficult for the family of Marjorie LaT.. Marjorie is married to Henry and they live in Barangay Lamo in Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. The couple aims to improve their status of living and to give their children a better future. They finished college courses but unfortunately did not find good jobs.

Her husband chose to work abroad while Marjorie manages a hog raising business to care for their family. Aside from maintaining her hog raising, Marjorie sometimes sells vegetables and snacks in their village. At present, she seeks a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 to make her business grow.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna K. is a tailor in the town of Patan. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, Makhshi and others. 

Before starting her own business, Mrs. Jamuna took a year training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

She plans to use the loan of 10,000NPR to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self-improvement and for her son's education. In Nepal, the cost of good education is very high. 

Her husband, Mr. Raju K., is a driver. Her son is in primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Raymundo Feliciano

texts.es: Don Raymundo Feliciano V. P. tiene 25 años de edad  vive con su familia cuenta con una hija, reside en el paraje Chopetac, del cantón Xolsacmalaja municipio y departamento de totonicapán Guatemala, actualmente se dedica al la artesania en la elaboracion de muebles lleva 7 años en esta activida, la demanda de sus clientes son buenas por eso se aserco a la asociacion ASIR para solicitar un prestamo para la compra de materia prima tiene un pequeño taller de fabricacion de toda clase de muebles y según los pedidos de sus clientes an incrementado por tal razon es una opcion para el incremeto de su pequeño taller a si poder mejorar sus ingresos y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Raymundo Feliciano V. P. is 25 years old. He lives with his family and has one daughter. He lives in Chopetac, in the municipal district of Xolsacmalaja, and in the department of Totonicapán, in Guatemala. At the moment he works as an artisan, making furniture. He has spent 7 years on this activity. The demand from his clients is good, and for this reason he has come to ASIR in order to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials. He has a small workshop for all types of furniture, and the orders from his clients have increased. For this reason, it is an opportunity to grow his small workshop and so increase his income and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka sells gift items in her shop and she has been in the business for the past two years. She is a single young girl, 24 years old, and lives in Lagos.

Amaka has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and her loans have tremendously increased her business and her profitability. Amaka is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more spiritual items and gift items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items and spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is 31 years old and married with a child. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Suleman sells ties and has been in the business for a long time. He hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more ties to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ties to sell

loans.name: Racma

texts.en: Racma T. is from the village of Malaigang, Iligan City. She is 44 years old, is married, and has ten school-aged children. Racma owns and operates a specialized retail store engaged in a buying and selling business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Racma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Racma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Mr. Savat E., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sophea Soy, 28, have been married for ten years and live about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three sons, one of which attends school; the other two are still quite young.

Since 1999, Savat has been growing rice. In addition to the farming, he drives a motor taxi. His wife has been working in a factory for ten years. Savat doesn’t have enough capital to maintain his farm, so he is applying for his first loan in the amount of $500 to pay the salary for hired help and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To pay the salary for hired help and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 30 years old and married with four children. All her children go to school .She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with six people. Chan takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Chan owns a stall selling cabbages and yellow bananas and doesn’t pay rent because she works from her home. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for two years. Chan buys cabbages and yellow bananas from Nakawa market and so incurs little transport cost to and from shopping.

Her challenges include transportation of ripe yellow bananas and the ever increasing price of food. Chan wants to use this loan to buy more cabbages and clusters of yellow bananas. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow stronger and owning a stall in Nakawa market, the very place where she does her shopping.

loans.use: to buy more clusters of  yellow bananas and cabbages  for resale

loans.name: Muong

texts.en: Muong S., 30 years old, lives with her family in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. Her husband is a fisherman and they have three teenaged children. For over two years, she has been working in the rice trade business, collecting rice from farmers and re-selling it to earn income. She currently earns an average of $5 per day. Muong S. believes her investment is doing well because she is gaining more regular customers. This business is Muong S.'s main source of stable income for the family. In order to continue improving the business, Muong S. is asking for a loan to buy additional rice to sell in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional rice to sell in the future.

loans.name: Maria Transito

texts.es:
La Sra. María F. es socia del banco comunal Las Pauteñitas, vive en la comunidad de Jadan, tiene 52 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión matrimonial ha procreado 4 hijos de 30, 27, 24, 20 años de edad, todos sus hijos se encuentran solteros trabajan todos pero no ayudan en casa solo trabajan para sus gastos personales, su esposo trabaja como chofer, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
María se dedica a la venta de pollo pelado, lleva 8 años en este negocio, compra pollos, los pela y vende en el mercado de San José de Paute, le va bien porque cuenta con su clientela, se lleva con todas sus compañeras del bankito, se encuentra en el segundo ciclo y nos comenta que le agrada el banco comunal por la facilidad de los pagos y por los beneficios que recibe, con el nuevo préstamo que FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregara va a invertir en comprar mas pollos vivos para solventar la demanda de  sus clientes, su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María F. is a member of the Las Pauteñitas Communal Bank. She lives in the Jadan community. She is 52, married, and has four children. They are 30, 27, 24, and 20. All of her children are single and work. They do not help at home; they only work for their personal expenses. Her husband works as a driver. Through the efforts of his work they have been able to build their own house. María sells plucked chickens. She has been in this business for eight years. She buys the chicken, plucks them, and sells them in the San José de Paute market. It is going well for her because she has regular customers. She gets along with all of her colleagues in the bank. She is in her second cycle. She says that she is grateful to the communal bank for the simplicity of the payments and for the benefits that she receives. With the new loan from Fundación Espoir she will buy more live chickens to meet her customers’ demand. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy live chickens

loans.name: Nji Cristina

texts.en:
Nji Cristina is a married mother of six children.  

Cristina and her entire family currently live in Mile 90 Nsogwa, Cameroon. Cristina shares that her primary difficulties in life have been to find funding to pay for her children's school fees.  She is also dealing with a minor illness and the death of relative. Cristina has found these complications make daily life somewhat difficult, but she also finds ways to contribute to her community. Cristina shares that she is active in her support of education within her neighborhood and provides a healthy means of nourishment by selling nutritious food in her convenience store.       

With a loan from GHAPE she would like to purchase firewood, groundnuts, rice, beans, soap and oil in order to expand her inventory and her profits.  She is hoping to use her profits to purchase livestock and reinvest into her business.  

As a member since 2005, Christina has already repaid four loans from GHAPE. She has been quite successful in the past and hopes to continue getting larger and larger loans with which to grow her store.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of food inventory to be sold through her store

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es: María Francisca L. de 66 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, vive junto a una hija. La señora María posee una pupusería en la cual elabora pupusas (comida típica salvadoreña, hecha a base de masa de maíz, rellena de frijoles, queso y chicharrón), en la mañana y en la noche. Ella solícita un préstamo, ya que desea poder empezar una venta de productos perecederos, así mismo tener la capacidad económica para comprar, maíz, frijoles y arroz para la elaboración de las pupusas. La señora María cuenta con la esperanza de poder aumentar sus ventas y esto verlo reflejado en su estabilidad económica, ya que a su edad ella espera tener una vida en la cual cuente con lo más básico y necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María Francisca L., 66, lives in Ilopango with a daughter. María has a pupusería, an eatery where she makes pupusas, mornings and nights. [A pupusa is a thick, hand-made corn biscuit-like flat bread (made using masa de maíz, a maize flour dough used in Latin American cuisine) that is stuffed with one or more of the following: cheese (queso) (usually a soft cheese called Quesillo found in all Central America), fried pork meat ground to a paste consistency (called chicharrón, not to be confused with fried pork rind which is also known as chicharrón in some other countries), squash (ayote), or (pataste), refried beans (frijoles refritos), or queso con loroco (loroco is a vine flower bud from Central America). There is also the pupusa revuelta with mixed ingredients, such as queso (cheese), frijoles (beans), and chicharrón or bacon. Pupusas are similar to tortillas and especially to arepas. In fact, in El Salvador, normal tortillas are about the same diameter and thickness as pupusas, without the filling.)] She needs financing because she would also like to start to sell basic food items as well as to be able to buy ingredients, like corn, beans and rice, that she needs for her pupusas. María hopes to increase her sales to have a positive effect on her economic situation since, at her age, her wish is to be able to count on having the basic things necessary to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Radion

texts.en:
Radion X. was born in 1955. He is married with two children and lives in Khachmaz town.

Radion has been in his taxi business for six years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his taxi to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Pedro Alfonzo

texts.es:
Pedro Alfonzo L. tiene 42 años, su estado civil es casado y separado, y tiene un hijo, Walter, de 10 años de edad.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace casi toda la vida.  Su caballo le ayuda trabajar en el campo.  Crece papas, maíz, trigo, y habas.  Le hacen falta unas maquinas para el comercio.  Actualmente están en una sequia y Pedro no puede sembrar porque no ha llovido.  Espera que pueda sembrar en breve porque normalmente se siembra en el mes de noviembre o diciembre pero ya estamos en el mes de enero.
Solicita el crédito para abonos y semillas para sembrar.  Sus sueños son tener su terreno propio y que siga estudiando su hijo en el colegio.
Le gusta jugar el voleibol y montar el caballo.
texts.en:
Pedro Alfonzo L. is 42 years old. He is married but separated. He has one son, Walter, who is 10 years old. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. He has been working in agriculture almost his whole life. His horse helps him work in the fields. He grows potatoes, corn, wheat, and broad beans. He needs some machines for this business. His area is currently in a drought, and Pedro can’t plant because it hasn’t rained. He hopes to be able to plant soon because normally planting is done in the month of November or December, and it’s already January. He is requesting the loan for fertilizers and seeds to plant. His dreams are to have his own land and also that his son will continue studying in high school. He likes to play volleyball and ride horses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Dolores V. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de tamales con cuajada ofreciéndolos todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y teniendo una gran variedad de clientes que compran dichos productos.
Ella se ha destacado por ser muy persistente en el trabajo y preocupándose por el bienestar de su familia. Por ello es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para realizar la comprar el maíz, hojas queso, cuajadas y leña para la elaboración de dichos tamales.
texts.en:
In the Department of León, El Salvador, Dolores V. works arduously selling tamales with curd cheese. She begins her sales very early in the morning and has a variety of customers who come to buy her products. Dolores has shown herself to be persistent in her work, and she is concerned for her family's well-being. For this reason, she hopes that her loan will be funded in order to buy corn, corn husks for wrapping, cheese, curds and firewood for the production of her tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, curds and firewood

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
Maria Petrona M. B. tiene 51 años, su estado civil es casada y vive con su marido y hijos.  Tiene 9 hijos de 10 a 32 años de edad.  Sale en la foto uno de sus hijos.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria es agricultora y siembra mora en mayores cantidades.  Siembra poquito habas, cebada, maiz, papa, col, y zanahoria para comer.  Ademas, crece gallinas para consumir y vender en el mercado en Guaranda.  Vende las gallinas cada año en Guaranda y vende la mora semanalmente en la comunidad. Solicita el crédito para comprar remedios, abonos, y palitos para la mora.

Su esperanza es que sus hijos estudien y consigan trabajo.  Se encuentra aprendiendo a leer y escribir en sus ratos libres.  Su hijo en la escuela le está ayudando a aprender.  Ella misma también asiste a una escuela para aprender y le dan deberes.
texts.en:
Maria Petrona M. B. is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children. She has 9 children from 10 to 32 years old. One of her children is seen in the foto. She is a member of the rural loan group "Mushuc Nan", a Quechua phrase that means "New Road" in Spanish. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They all live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the district of Guaranda. Each of them has a strong desire to use the loans in order to further their lives. Maria is a farmer and plants large quantities of blackberries. She plants lesser amounts of beans, barley, corn, potatoes, cabbage and carrots to eat. In addition, she raises hens to eat and sell in the market in Guaranda. She sells the hens every year in Guaranda and sells the blackberries weekly in her community. She seeks a loan to purchase medicine, fertilizer, and stakes for the blackberries. Her hope is that her children are able to study and find work. She can be found learning to read and write during her spare moments. Her son at school is helping her to study. She herself helps out at a school to learn and make a contribution.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medecines, fertilizer and stakes for blackberries.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
el grupo Jehova Jireh esta integrado por tres personas las cuales se caracterizan por ser personas honestas, este grupo esta ubicado en la colonia Eben Ezer en la ciudad de Danli. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:
el sr. MANUEL DE JESUS R. C. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de dulces, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de “DULCES R.” su especialidad en la elaboración son los dulces de banano.
Don Manuel R., tiene más de cuatro años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su clientela día a día le exige de mas producto y muchas veces el no puede cumplir las necesidades de sus clientes por falta de capital para la compra de materia prima. 
los clientes prefieren sus dulces por el buen sabor, tamaño de producto y por los precios.
Don Manuel, es casado su esposa le ayuda en el negocio ya que la demanda de producto es bastante, y del matrimonio dependen 2 hijos, los cuales de manera directa también colaboran en el negocio.

la sra. ARSENIA A. tiene más de seis años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación.
se ha sabido ganar la clientela, por el buen tamaño con que elabora las tortillas y por la higiene que muestra en el lugar de elaboracion de su producto.
Sus clientes potenciales son los vecinos de la Col. Eben Ezer, y la Col. Bella Vista, ya que ella elabora las tortillas y las va a dejar a una pulpería, otra parte de las ventas las hace en su casa de habitación, y encargos que tiene permanente de sus clientes.
Doña Arsenia, es casada y su esposo es comerciante individual él sale de manera ambulante a vender achinería (variedades) en diferentes comunidades y aldeas del Departamento de El Paraíso.
Del matrimonio dependen (3) tres hijos, los cuales les brindan a un 100% los gastos de alimentación, Educación, y todo lo que necesiten.

la sra. GLORIA MARINA F. ORDOÑEZ tiene (1) un año de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Donas.
Doña Gloria, elabora las donas en su casa de habitación y se va ha venderlas a  dos fabricas de tabacos que se encuentran muy cerca de donde ella vive, siendo sus clientes potenciales los empleados de la misma.
Doña Gloria, elabora diario 100 donas, de las cuales no le sobra nada y por falta de capital no puede elaborar mas producto y muchos clientes se quedan sin comprar y deleitar de las deliciosas donas que fabrica, además nos comento que los clientes ya no solo le piden donas si no también Osmil y jugos naturales, pero por falta de efectivo no ha podido comprar los termos y hieleras para poder venderle a sus clientes.
Doña Gloria, es madre soltera con (3) tres hijos y recibe una pensión alimentaría de su ex compañero de hogar, la cual no le es suficiente para cubrir todos las necesidades del hogar.- y fue así como ella tomo la dedición de emprender el negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien y ahora lo que necesita es capital para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Jehova Jireh group has three members, all trustworthy. The group is located in the Eben Ezer neighborhood of the city of Danli. Here´s a description of the members´ businesses: Sr. Manuel de Jesus R. C. operates a business making and selling sweets. The business is called Dulces R.--nice play on Manuel´s name--and specializes in sweets made with bananas. Manuel has operated the business for four years. His customers come day after day to buy from him and he can´t always meet demand because he doesn´t have enough capital to buy the ingredients he needs for his sweets. His products are popular because they´re delicious--¨R.¨--and priced right. Manuel is married and his wife helps him with the business because demand is so great. The couple has 2 children who also help with the business. Sra. Arsenia A. has operated a business making and selling corn tortillas for more than six years. She operates the business at home. She has won over her customers with big portions and the cleanliness of her kitchen. Her customers are drawn from the Col. Eben Ezer and Col Bella Vista neighborhoods. She makes the tortillas and sells some of them from her house and others from a corner shop. Still others are delivered to regular customers. Arsenia is married. Her husband is also an entrepreneur, traveling around the ¨departamento¨ of El Paraiso, selling a wide range of goods. The couple has three children and they are 100% responsible for providing them with food, schooling, etc. Sra. Gloria Marina F. Ordonez has operated a business making and selling donuts for about a year. Gloria makes the donuts at home and sells them at two tobacco factories that are near her house, the factories´ employees being her target customers. Gloria makes 100 donuts a day. She sells them all but she can´t make more because she doesn´t have the capital to do so. She would like to expand so everyone who wants her delicious donuts can buy them. She tells us that her customers often ask for Osmil or juices but she can´t supply them because she doesn´t have enough money to invest in thermos bottles and ice to provide beverages to her customers. Gloria is the single mother of three children. Her former partner provides her with some support for food but it´s not enough to cover all the household´s expenses. She started the business to cover the difference and it´s gone well so far. She now needs a loan to help her meet the demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for different food businesses.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin, A. Colette est mariée à GANMADIGBE Léonard, un chauffeur. Il y a près de 25 ans que Colette vit à Sainte Rita à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Colette vend divers produits (huile de palme et d'arachide, condiments de sauce, pâtes alimentaires, savons, couscous, bougies, papiers hygiéniques, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Colette vend du maïs et du "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale). C'est à Houègbo et à Comé au Bénin, que Colette achète ses produits. Colette a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Colette sollicite un autre crédit afin d'accroître son activité et de reconstituer son stock de produits, pour mieux faire face aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Ouidah, a historic village in Benin, Ms. A. Colette is married to Mr. GANMADIGBE Léonard, a driver. She has been living for 25 years in Sainte Rita in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her children and husband. To support herself and to take part in covering family expenses, Collette sells a variety of goods (palm oil, peanut oil, sauce condiments, pasta, soaps, couscous, candles, toilet paper, etc.) out of her home. Secondarily, she sells corn and sodabi (a local alcoholic drink). She buys her goods in Houègbo and in Comé, in Benin. She has already obtained three loans from ALIDé that she has repaid. Colette is requesting another loan in order to grow her business and to replenish a stock of products for coping better with the requirements of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetable oil, palm oil, canned tomatoes, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Dulmaa

texts.en: Dulmaa T. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage sons in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent in a yard which belongs to her relatives. She and her husband are planning to purchase their own plot of land this year with their business profit. Currently, Dulmaa operates a shoe and saddle manufacturing business with her husband at their home. They have been operating their business since 1996, and it has steadily expanded. Her husband, Basan, makes the saddles and Dulmaa manufactures the shoes. Their business is well known to their customers. With their business profit, they purchased the ger which they are living in now. They are planning to create their own workplace after they purchase the plot of land for their family. Their product sales are high especially during the spring, summer and autumn. Dulmaa and her husband are both very hardworking people who are trying to provide better life for their family. Dulmaa says, 'I have been planning to save some money to pay university tuition fees for my two children who will become university students soon.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1465 USD) loan to purchase necessary materials to manufacture shoes and sell them to her many customers.

loans.use: To purchase materials for shoe manufacturing and sales

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 62 años, ya había solicitado financiamiento con Fundación, pues fue muy importante. Actualmente ella está solicitando este crédito para la inversión de su negocio como es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más 45 años que se dedica a esta actividad, cabe señalarse que este negocio empezó de forma ambulante, luego logro establecerse en un tramo pequeño en el mercado y fue allí que sus ventas se incrementaron pues siempre está buscando la forma de atraer a sus clientes. Maria sueña con llegar a tener una tienda grande y una venta de electrodomésticos bastante amplia que brinde mayor estabilidad económica a sus familiares.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora, 62, has asked for financing from Fundación in the past; it was very important. Currently, she’s asking for this loan to invest in her business which is general merchandise sales. She has been in this line of work for over 45 years. It’s worth mentioning that she started out as an itinerant peddler but then managed to establish herself in a small area in the market and this is when her sales began to grow because she is always looking for ways to attract customers. María dreams with eventually having a large store selling home appliances that will provide better economic stability to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros D. is from the village of Dohinob, Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 65 years old and married. To make a living, Milagros provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Milagros from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her tailoring business

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Sakété, dans le département du Plateau, S. Chérifatou est mariée à AKANNI Aliou, un électricien bâtiment. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Chérifatou vit avec sa famille à PK11, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Chérifatou apporte une aide financière à son mari, en ce qui concerne les dépenses familiales. Chérifatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Chérifatou vend divers produits (riz, pâtes alimentaires, sucre, lait, mayonnaise, nescafé, conserves de tomate et de sardines, bombons, bougies, savons, insecticides, sandalettes, etc.), ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins de sa famille. Chérifatou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les vend à son domicile. Chérifatou a bénéficié une fois déjà, de prêt à ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Face aux exigences de sa clientèle, Chérifatou désire renforcer un peu plus son activité et mieux répondre à leurs différentes demandes. C’est en raison de cela que Chérifatou sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Sakété, in the Plateau department, Chérifatou S. is married to Aliou Akanni, a building electrician. The couple have six children, all in school and living under their parents' care. Chérifatou lives with her family in PK11, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. She helps her husband in financial matters related to the family's expenses. Chérifatou did not go to school. For about 15 years, she has been selling various goods (rice, pasta, sugar, milk, mayonnaise, Nescafé coffee, canned tomatoes and sardines, sweets, candles, soap, insecticides, sandals, etc.), which allows her to meet her needs and those of her family. Chérifatou buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and sells them at her house. She has already benefited from one previous loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid it well. Faced with the demands of her customers, Chérifatou wants to strengthen her business a little more and respond to her clientele's various requests. It is for this reason that Chérifatou is seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various products (rice, pasta, sugar, milk, mayonnaise, canned tomatoes and sardines, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Tsetsegsuren

texts.en:
Tsetsegsuren V. lives with her sisters in the Central province of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She operates a consumer goods retailing business. She began her business in 2003 with a working capital of 100,000 MNT. Since then, she has bought a grocery trading stall from which to operate her business and her working capital has grown to exceed 3,200,000 MNT.
