Tsetsegsuren would like to grow her business in order to also sell dairy products and to be able to save money so that she can improve both her quality of life and to get married. In 2009, she purchased a Korean small car with her business profits in order to deliver consumer goods to her workplace. She is hard working and modest person. Tsetsegsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of dairy products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products.

loans.name: Ediberta

texts.en:
Ediberta O. is from the village of Danlugan Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Ediberta is widowed and has 3 adult children. She owns & operates a fish selling business. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ediberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ediberta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Ediberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip A. is from Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 26 years old. Philip is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Philip owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport service. Philip has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Philip joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Philip is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Philip from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 51 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que dependen de ella. Su actividad es la elaboración de cepillos, pastes de baño. Por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy emprendedora. Pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación. Este financiamiento que está realizando es para la compra de materia prima como  hilo, esponja, telas, cloro y leña entre otras cosas. El sueño que siempre le gustaría cumplir es establecer un taller en donde pueda ofrecer trabajo a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 51 and has 3 dependent children. She makes brushes and washcloths. Rosa has always been very industrious and she has worked with the Foundation for a long time. This loan will be used to buy basic supplies such as thread, sponges, fabric, bleach and firewood, etc. The dream that she always has had is to set up a shop where she can offer employment to people who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lorena Alexandra

texts.es:
Lorena de 31 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Ella hace anualidades con fomix y los vende a escuelas y a fiestas. 

Empezó hace 10 años atrás aprender manualidades a base de fomix y cartulina poco a poco quiso que esta actividad sea su principal ingreso, conociendo a gente en fiestas comenzó a promocionar sus manualidades. Hasta ahora que ya tiene clientela fija y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Para poder arreglar su casa y ubicar un lugar para sus manualidades necesita comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena y piedras. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería, y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lorena is 31 years old and lives in El Fortín, a periurban zone of Guayaquil. She sells celebration decorations for schools and parties. She began ten years ago by learning to make crafts using cardboard and the supplies from Fomix, and little by little she was able to turn this into her main income source, and she promotes her crafts to people she meets at parties. She now has an established customer base and works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She needs the loan to buy cement, sand, and stone in order to improve her house and create a place for her crafts. In the future, she wants to have a stationary store and to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, sand, and stone

loans.name: Cresty

texts.en: Cresty S. is from the village of Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is 42 years old and married. She has four children; two of them are adults and two are school-aged. To make a living, Cresty operates a business in fishing. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Cresty has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2001, Cresty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Cresty is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Cresty from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida belongs to a small city of Pakistan called Vehari.  Vehari is a mid-sized city and known for its agriculture industry.  She owns a small house of two rooms in a small village named 57 E/B located in Vehari.  

Rashida is a very talented and caring lady. After she finishes the household chores, she starts sewing clothes for her customers. She charges between 100-150 PKRs from her customers which they can easily pay her. She loves doing this work because she has interest in it. She sews with perfect measurement. In the working experience, she never receives any complaint from her customers. She mainly takes orders from her nearby areas and completes the orders on time to earn profit.  

Her husband's name is F. M. and he has a business selling rice. He buys rice from the wholesale market and sells in his shop to the customers. He has been in this business for the past seven years.  

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy rice in bulk quantity. She is hopeful that her husband will increase his income by selling more rice to his customers.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita R. is from the city of Ledesma Extension, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Charita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Charita owns & operates a business venture providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Charita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Charita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jahayra Elieth

texts.es:
ahayra Elieth de 32 años es soltera, no tiene hijos, es trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3½ años y actualmente se desempeña como Bibliotecaria. 

Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el objetivo de ponerle el techo a una casita que tiene en la comarca El Quebrantadero, la cual es habitada por personas que estan encargadas de cuidar la propiedad los dias de semana que ella trabaja; adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos cosmeticos de AVON y ZERMAT a compañeras de trabajo y otra clientela que tiene, por lo que desea utilizar parte del credito para compra de los productos y surtir su pequeño negocio, pues obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permiten pagar sus gastos. 

El mayor sueño de Jahayra es formar su familia y poder brindarle las condiciones basicas de un hogar.
texts.en:
Jahayra Elieth, 32, is single and has no children.  She has worked for the City of Juigalpa for 3 and a half years, currently as a Librarian.

She is asking for her 6th loan to install a roof on her little house that she has in the El Quebrantadero settlement which is inhabited by people who care for the property during weekdays when she works. In addition, she also sells AVON and ZERMAT brand cosmetics to coworkers and other customers she has so she wants to use the loan to buy the products to stock her small business because it provides extra income for her to meet her expenses.

Jahayra’s greatest wish is to form her family and provide the basic living conditions of a home.

loans.use: To install a roof on her house and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo y sus 2 queridos hijos Nancy D. 10 y Alfredo D. 7 años, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. DesD. muy pequeña Betha aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra cacao, café y hojas D. coca, las cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad D. San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plaga D. insectos que pueden perjudicar sus plantaciones. Su mayor deseo es comprarse nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota D. humor en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para ser aplicados en sus campos D. cultivo donD. se espera mejora la productividad D. sus frutos.
texts.en: Bertha is a 45, cheerful and hardworking woman, lives in her own home with her husband Alfredo and their two children: Alfredo,10 and  Nancy, 7 years, who are the reason for all her efforts. Bertha has been working in a  farm since she was a little girl; her parents taught her everything about how to get a good crop. Now she takes care of her own land with lots of love and patience. She plants cocoa, coffee and coca leaves, and she sells her products in the city of San Francisco. What she likes about her job is the harvest and she feels that after 25 years of dedication, her hard work is paying off. The most difficult aspect of her job is to protect the crops from insect pests that can harm her plantations. Her greatest wish is to buy new land to increase the production. This is the fourth loan with MFP, aware that she has to pay according to schedule, and she is willing to do so. She is a very glad partner of her community bank and always sharing good mood with the group. With this loan she will buy fertilizer to use in the fields, where she expects to improve productivity and results.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda, de 55 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora y muy jovial,  vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. El negocio al que Eduarda se dedica, es la venta de recordatorios y rosarios, asimismo  manualidades en telas, como son bolsas, lazos  y todo tipo de decoración con motivos navideños. Ahora  Eduarda, esta evocada más a la venta de rosarios, por las celebridades religiosas (primeras comuniones), que organizan  los diversos colegios, negocio que le esta yendo muy bien. Por ello, siempre esta al pendiente de alguna celebración que se avecinan, y de acuerdo a ello se esmera en abastecerse diversos productos ya que sus clientes, son  quienes les contactan con otros clientes. Es así que ya tiene 9 años, en este negocio que le resulta muy rentable; por tal motivo desea abrir una tienda y un taller de manualidades. Es su 17avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Es la más preocupada  por el bienestar  y la organización de su  grupo, por ser la líder de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fuegos artificiales para venderlos en la temporada navideña que se avecina, asimismo adornos navideños.
texts.en:
Eduarda, age 55, is a jovial hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and five children. Her business involves selling mementos, rosaries, and woven crafts such as bags, bows, and all types of decorations with a Christmas theme. Eduarda is now seeking to sell more rosaries for religious celebrations (such as first communions) that are organized by different schools. Her business is doing very well. For this reason, Eduarda is always planning for upcoming celebrations and striving to obtain various different products since her customers contact one another. She has been in this business for nine years and has found it to be very profitable. Eduarda wants to open a store and a craft workshop.

This is her seventeenth loan with MFP. She knows that she must complete her payments on time and is willing to do so. Eduarda is very concerned about the well-being and organization of her group since she is the leader of her Communal Bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fireworks and decorations to sell during the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase fireworks & Christmas decorations to sell

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 41 years old and is married with three children between 8 and 19 years old. Candida’s husband works in the government.  Candida is a young entrepreneur who has a business selling African tea and other items in her restaurant.

Candida has requested a loan to purchase more products for her shop. With any extra profits, Candida hopes to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: To improve and expand the business

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eva; ella tiene 52 años de edad, viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de elaboración de tortas para todo tipo de compromisos como matrimonios, 15 años, bodas de plata, cumpleaños entre otros. La socia es una persona muy alegre y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio de venta de tortas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Eva is a member of the ”LOS HERALDOS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Eva is 52 years old, widowed and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making cakes for all sorts of occasions such as weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, silver wedding anniversaries, birthdays, etc.  She is a very happy person and, through her business, she gets her family ahead in life. 

Eva is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for her cake business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cake business

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a very active lady and very helpful by nature. She is not involved in any kind of job or business, but she performs her duties as a housewife very well and takes care of her family effectively.  
She lives in Kamoki,  which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in the area named Mor Amenabad, in a 2 room brick house. She came here 20 years ago. She has 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her daughters are studying while her sons help their father in his business. 
Bushra’s husband is involved in a bread-making & selling business. He has a tandoor (a kind of oven made with sand, which burns wood in it) in the community in which he makes bread for his customers and earns income. He sells each bread loaf for PKRs 5, which is almost the same price in every city.   
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wood and flour in bulk and increase his sales. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years, and Bushra is very confident about the growth of his business in the future. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself  a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra”.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour for bread making & selling

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo tiene 44 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo tambien vende gallinas. Esta actividad es muy popular en nuestro país, pues la mayoría de las personas tienen este medio de vida para sobrevivir. Hace más de 8 años, que se dedica a este negocio cuando dio inicio fue por su familia, pues anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo, fue así que Pedro aprendió de este negocio por tal razón él decide establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cerdos. el desea realizar ciertas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Pedro Pablo is 44 years old and his business is in buying and selling pigs and chickens.  This business is very popular in our country as the majority of the people use this as a means of living to survive.  He has been in this business for more than eight years and started in it because of his family.  His mother previously managed it and that is how Pedro learned the business.  That is why he decided to set up his own business in his house.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of pigs.  He wants to make certain housing improvements.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lisseth Melyssa

texts.es:
Lisseth, tiene 21 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Elisabeth después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a vender artesanía en la plaza de armas de la ciudad del Cusco de forma ambulatoria. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Lisseth requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo artesanía de tipo platería. El sueño de Lisseth es tener una tienda propia y grande donde tenga una variedad de artesanía.    
   
Lisseth pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lisseth is 21 years old. She has a son and lives in the city of Cuzco, Perú. After doing her house work, Elisabeth works selling artisanal crafts in the Plaza de Armas in the city of Cuzco as a street vendor. She has had this business for five years now and it is going very well for her. Lisseth needs the loan to buy merchandise. For example, silver artisanal handicrafts. Lisseth's dream is to have her own large store where she can have a variety of artisanal handicrafts.   

Lisseth belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” community bank, of the Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and committed to making the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise. For example, silver artisanal handicrafts.

loans.name: Piedad Yaneth

texts.es:
Piedad Yaneth inició su negocio de venta de dulces con un plástico sostenido por unos palos, ella trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, sin embargo su negocio ha crecido y necesita comprar mas surtido y así iniciar una tienda donde sus clientes pueden adquirir mayor variedad de productos.

Al crecer su negocio no solo mejora la calidad de vida de su familia sino que también puede ofrecer a otras veredas sus productos.
texts.en:
Piedad Yaneth started selling candy under a tarp supported by posts.  She works from very early in the morning until quite late at night.  However, the business has grown and she needs to buy more variety of candy to start a store where her customers can acquire a larger variety of products.

As her business grows not only does her family’s quality of life improve but also she can sell other varieties of products.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 23 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Barbiyoe de 20 años, y de su pequeño hijo de  tres años, juntos buscan cada día salir adelante. Desde muy pequeña ayudaba a sus padres, grandes comerciantes. Empezó atando flores, luego envolvía las macetas, y conforme pasaba el tiempo desempeñaba labores más complejas. Luego de unos años, decidió empezar con su pareja a comercializar flores y macetas, y luego de un tiempo percibió  que este negocio era bastante rentable. La actividad la desarrollan de la siguiente manera: ella y su esposo compran las flores a mayoristas de la ciudad, y luego de preparar los ramos y macetas, su esposo las traslada a provincias, donde las comercializa a mayores precios. De esta manera salen adelante juntos y viven tranquilos. Pero María sabe que en el futuro solo lograra cumplir con su anhelo, de instalar un negocio de flores en un centro comercial  fijo, si continúa trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con su labor. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de flores y macetas pues su esposo tiene pedidos en provincias y espera cumplir con todos para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 20 year-old Barbiyoe, and her 3 year-old son.  Together they look to get ahead in life every day.

Since she was very young, María helped her parents who were salespeople.  She started out tying up bunches of flowers then wrapped flowerpots.  As time went on she started undertaking more complex tasks.  After a few years, she decided to start out selling flowers and flowerpots together with her partner.  After a while, she realized that this business was quite profitable.  She carries out her business in the following way: María and her husband buy their flowers from wholesalers in the city and then they prepare their bunches of flowers and flower pots.  Her husband takes them to the provinces where he sells them for higher prices.  In this way they get ahead in life and live peacefully.  However, María knows that, in the future, she will manage to fulfil her wish of setting up a flower business in a fixed shopping center if she continues to work hard and with a lot of commitment.

This is María's third loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to let down the people who made her money possible as it will allow her to continue with her work.  María plans to invest her loan in buying a variety of flowers and flower pots as her husband has orders in the provinces and hopes to fill them all in order to improve their profits.

loans.use: to buy more plants and flower pots

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. is currently the head of the group Tunas Mekar Asih. Ni Ketut S. has four children, all of whom are married. She lives with her husband. After getting her fourth loan of 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR), Ni Ketut S. bought 10 piglets at 150,000 IDR per head. S. was ready to buy feed from the sale of pork before. S. is very serious about this business, because with the profits they can meet all their needs. Every day for the kitchen she spends 20,000 IDR and to pay for electricity and water she spends 150,000 IDR per month. Ni Ketut S. and all the group members of Tunas Mekar Asih really hope that MUK will continue to provide loans until the group can actually be independent.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets.

loans.name: Joseph Kilonzo

texts.en:
Joseph Kilonzo K. is 39 years old and married. He has been operating a restaurant business for two years in Tala town, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a group member and he is applying for a second loan from KADET, with which he plans to buy more cereals and meat for the restaurant.

He will invest the anticipated profits into the business for it to grow and be stable financially.

loans.use: to buy cereals and meat for the restaurant

loans.name: Ayitchevo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement AYITCHEVO est composé de 18 membres qui se connaissent de par leurs activités et qui vivent tous dans le même village et dans la même agglomération à Allada. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Célestine est mariée à un certain Eugène et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a une vingtaine d’année que Célestine et son mari se sont installés à Houngbado à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Célestine n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestine mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans environs, la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme puis la vente de ce produit à Allada. C'est à Avakpa (dans l'Atlantique) que Célestine s'approvisionne. Parallèlement à cette activité, Célestine prépare de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) qu'elle vend à Avakpa. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
The AYITCHEVO group is composed of 18 members who know one another through their occupations and who all live in the same village and district in Allada. The president of the group, named Celestine, is the woman who is holding her hand up in the picture. In order to increase the level of their activities to better answer their customers' expectations, this group is requesting ALIDe's financial support.
Celestine is married to one Eugene and has four children, who all attend school. The couple takes charge of the various family affairs together. About twenty years ago, Celestine and her husband settled in Houngbado (in Allada, Atlantic region). Celestine never went to school. To provide for her and her family's needs, Celestine has been in the business of processing the palm fruit into palm oil for about 25 years; she then sells this product in Allada. Celestine gets her supplies from Avakpa (Atlantic region). In addition to this activity, Celestine prepares "akassa" (a local food product based on corn starch), which she sells in Avakpa. Celestine is requesting a loan from ALIDe with the objective to develop her business and to better satisfy her customers. Her ambition is to bring her activity to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits and corn

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer A. O. is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have five children whom they hope to educate to the university level. 

She runs a fish sales business at a busy market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.

She has been operating this business for three years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using this loan of KES 30,000 to buy more fish to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and open a hotel where she will be serving fish fillet and other types of food to her customers. She describes herself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water, but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions to her local neighbours. She also has a decoration business which provides her another source of income. Mwanakombo faces the major challenge of transportation during the rainy season when it becomes difficult to travel. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, paraffin and detergents. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, paraffin and detergents.

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es: Walter de 29 años de edad es soltero, labora para Alcaldia de Juigalpa como obrero desde hace 11 años. Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de comprar materiales para construir un pequeño cuarto en casa de sus padres.   Su mayor sueño es podertener su propia vivienda para cuando tenga su familia  brindarle mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Walter is 29 years old and single. He has been  a worker in the city hall in Juigalpa for 11 years. He is asking for his 4th loan to purchase materials to build a small room in his parents' house. His biggest dream is to own his own home for when he has a family so that he can provide them with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Basilia Solange

texts.fr: Née en le 2 janvier 1969 au Bénin, Basilia Solange est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Basilia Solange a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Basilia Solange n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants, Basilia Solange vend des produits divers (Riz, maïs, haricot, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) depuis une quinzaine d'année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Basilia Solange vend des glaces et des bissaps. Basilia Solange s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les différentes charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Basilia Solange sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born on January 2, 1969, in Benin, Basilia Solange is a widow living alone with her children.  She has three children, all who have completed or are attending school, two of whom are still under her care.  Her education ended after primary school.  To meet her and her children’s needs, Basilia Solange has been selling various products (rice, corn, beans, pasta, etc.) for about 15 years.  Along with this business, she sells ice cream and bissap (a non-alcoholic drink made from hibiscus).  Basilia Solange buys her supplies in one of the largest markets in Benin.  This business earns her income to help her cover her family’s various expenses.  In order to raise the level of her business activity and increase her profits, she is requesting her first loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products (rice, corn, beans, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Doudedji Group

texts.fr: DOUDEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même localité au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Charlotte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Boniface. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Charlotte et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Charlotte n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la couture. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Charlotte exerce cette activité. A côté de cette activité qui lui procure des revenus l’aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Charlotte  vend divers articles de mercerie.  Charlotte s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Charlotte sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe DOUDEDJI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
DOUDEDJI is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same town in Benin. The group’s representative, Charlotte (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 36 years old and married to a retailer by the name of Boniface. They have five children who are all in school and in their care. Charlotte and her husband live together with their children. She did not attend school but learned how to sew. 

Charlotte has been sewing for nearly 18 years. Aside from this business, which brings in the revenues helping her to support herself and her children, she sells a variety of sewing supplies. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, she and the members of the group DOUDEDJI, are requesting an initial loan. They will use this loan to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Jose Jacinto

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres,  cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de La Victoria que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y en transporte público.

José desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que lleguen a su peso y talla ideal para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su familia.   También tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra camote,una vez que cosecha lo comercializa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a sus tierras de cultivo y comprar alimentos para sus aves de corral, una vez que engorden los vende a sus clientes a un buen precio para poder seguir mejorando económicamente.  José es una persona trabajadora y con empeño quiere salir adelante y tener algunas comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
28-year old José is single and lives with his parents in a house which has electricity but not water. It is located in a rural area of La Victoria District, a part of the province of Chiclayo. The area is known for its agriculture, cattle, and public transportation companies. 

For several years José has raised and sold poultry (turkeys and chickens) in the yard in the back of his house, a suitable place for this. He gives them nutritional food and natural grains so they reach an ideal weight and size before being sold at the different markets in the area. His income from this work enables him to pay the daily expenses of his family.

In addition José owns some land where he grows sweet potatoes. Once the produce is harvested, he sells it.

He is now seeking a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy supplies for his land. He also wishes to buy feed for the turkeys and chickens which he sells once they are grown so he can continue to improve his financial situation. José is a hardworking person willing to make the necessary effort to do well in life and have a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his land and poultry feed

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 41 años, convive con Julio. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Digna, Waderle y Analy. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Hace 12 años está emprendedora mujer se dedica a la siembra de café. Con la ayuda de su esposo, siembra, abona y cultiva, posteriormente, después de los cuidados, los comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced.  Lo que más le gusta a Marleni, es poder estar activa y trabajar sin parar, “me siento útil”, asegura. Por ello, cuando tienen la oportunidad, trabaja en diferentes haciendas, donde limpia y sacan la maleza que crece entre los cultivos. Segura de que podrá salir adelante, está planeando renovar sus plantaciones, con los viveros de café que ya muy pronto estarán listos para ser trasplantados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece la confianza que depositaron en ella nuevamente. Además de comprometerse en pagar cada cuota puntualmente. Marleni comenzó a hacer orificios en la tierra para comenzar a plantar en sus terrenos productivos, para trasplantar sus viveros de café, asimismo desea volver a realizar más viveros de café. Por ello de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, bolsas y plantitas de café para concretizar sus planes.
texts.en:
Marleni, 41, lives with Julio.  They have three children: Digna, Waderle and Analy.  They live together in family harmony in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian Central Jungle).  Twelve years ago this enterprising woman started farming coffee.  With help from her husband she plants, fertilizes, cultivates and then, after caring for it, she sells it in the city of La Merced.

What Marleni most enjoys is being able to be active and working non-stop, “I feel useful,” she insists.  Because of that, when they have the chance to, they work at various haciendas clearing and weeding among the crops.  Convinced that she will be able to get ahead, she’s planning to renew her plantations with coffee seedlings that will be ready to be transplanted very soon.

She’s a member of the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza del Palomar” (Unity Makes Palomar’s Strength) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan.  She is grateful for the trust placed in her once again and commits to make each installment payment punctually.

Marleni has begun to dig holes in the soil to start planting her fields and to transplant her coffee seedlings.  She also wants to start new coffee nurseries.  Because of this, she needs to get support and will invest the requested money purchasing several sacks of natural fertilizer, bags and coffee seedlings to actualize her plans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer, bags and coffee plants.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish  in the Philippines. Shiela requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Shiela has been in this business for four years now and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water and charcoal.

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is 37 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  

Lukia has a poultry business, which she has had for 2 years. To help expand her business, Lukia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lukia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.     

Lukia is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Rustamchon

texts.ru: Рустамчон умный, образованный и добросовестный муж. За последнее 5 лет он занимается купля продажей скота. Он покупает скот и рынка, затем откармливает их в определенный период, а когда они набирают вес, Рустамчон продает их в выгодную цену. Он хочет расширить данный бизнес и получить большую прибыль для содержания своей семьи. Он хотел бы получить кредит для покупки скота. Рустамчон заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их доброты и милосердие.
texts.en: Rustamchon is a smart, educated and conscientious husband.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for the last five years.  He buys livestock at the market, then fattens it up over a certain time period and, once it gains weight, Rustamchon sells it at a more profitable price.  He wants to expand his business and make a large profit in order to support his family.  He wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock.  Rustamchon thanks all creditors in advance for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 43 years old. She is married to Daudi and they are blessed with three children who are school-going.

Rebecca owns a bakery in the Kitengela market, where she supplies cakes to shops, schools and supermarkets. She has been doing this business for the last year and gets an income of 8,450 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Rebecca was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD., with which she plans to buy flour, baking powder, sugar and a motorbike for distribution. She will use the extra profit to open a branch in Mlolongo.

Rebecca hopes to establish a big baking factory in which to bake and supply cakes and breads. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for distribution.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.
Mercedes has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising chickens.
Mercedes aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
To earn a living, Edwina has a general store. Edwina is 52 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor. She is married with four children. Edwina earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

Edwina has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one year. In the future, Edwina would like to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Leyla Maria

texts.es: Leyla Maria de 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de artesanía. Desde hace mas de 8 años que tiene este negocio, fue desarrollando su negocio con capital propio, anteriormente ella fue ayudante de ventas en el mercado, fue debido a este negocio que decidió establecer su propio negocio. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de cintas, bolsas, pinceles y pinturas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Leyla Maria, 54, is a hard-working woman who sells handicrafts.  She started her business over eight years ago using her own capital to develop it.  Previously she was a sales assistant at a market and because of that business she decided to branch out on her own.  She is requesting a loan to buy ribbons, bags, brushes and paints.  She has many goals for her business and wants to buy the supplies she needs to make her products.

loans.use: To buy ribbons, bags, brushes and paints.

loans.name: Simperu

texts.en: Simperu is a single man aged 22. He has been operating a business selling goats to make a living. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. His potential customers are the local residents and passerby. In the next 5 years, he plans to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy more goats for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 60-year-old married woman with six children who are all working. Her husband, Alex, is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Lydia has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial help to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Merely

texts.en:
Merely is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Merely has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Merely has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza, tiene 37 años, es madre de 3 niños, es socia de FINCA desde hace una año y medio.
Sonia tiene una tienda de Pasamanería, también vende artículos de librería, en el Mercado Central. Se siente muy feliz porque ha aprendido mucho en su bancomunal, las capacitaciones le han ayudado en su negoocio, y lo mejor es que ahora ella esta progresando. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos para aprovechar la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Firmeza” communal bank.  She’s 37 years old, the mother of three children, and has been a member of FINCA for a year and a half.

Sonia has a decorations store and also sells bookstore items in the central market.  She’s very happy because she’s learned a lot in the communal bank and the training has helped her in her business.  The best part is that now she’s progressing.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in merchandise so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to by merchandise.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old.  He is single and supports his parents. He has been operating a motor bike transport as a primary business and a poultry rearing operation as a secondary business for the past three years.   He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000,  which he uses for his basic needs.

Samuel is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  He will use the loan to buy a motor bike and more poultry feeds.  With the anticipated profit from the businesses, he will service the motor bike. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi, which will help him increase his income.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle and more poultry feeds

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a 19-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Kimberly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Although this is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Kimberly has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 450 Samoa talas (WST) (approximately $280 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Kimberly joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Kimberly requested her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase chemicals such as Gramoxome. The loan will be the first loan taken out by Kimberly from SPBD. Kimberly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals such as gramoxome.

loans.name: Rosa Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, de 51 años de edad, es madre soltera tuvo 3 hijos todos ya independientes, vive en su propia casa con una de sus nietas, ella radica en una aldea de la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, ella se dedica desde hace unos 20 años a la venta de productos alimenticios en su pulpería, y también hace pan tamales, rosquillas, y sale a vender ropa a los barrios y aldeas cercanas a su comunidad.
Doña Rosa solicita el préstamo de 10,000.00 para capital de trabajo ya que desea comprar ropa, sandalias y adornos ya que estamos en el mes que se celebra el día de las madres y desea hacer algo de negocios en esta época, con las ganancias generadas desea seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería para hacerla crecer ya que ha sido su patrimonio por mas de dos décadas.
Doña Rosa sus metas son  mejorar su negocio y desea que su nieta se gradúe y seguirla apoyando.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa, sandalias y adornos para su negocio

loans.name: Mohamed Ali

texts.en:
Mohamed is 27 years old. He studies at Admas University College, faculty of development study. 

Being without a laptop is his major problem. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, download books and to make class presentations. Mohamed goes to an Internet café each week, and he spends more money to get access to the Internet. 

A laptop from Kaaba Microfinance Institution helped him to solve the above-mentioned problem.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 65 years old, married, and has seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Milagros has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Milagros is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Konsulov

texts.ru:
Консулов 50  летная  женщина.  Она  живет городе  Истаравшан,  в кишлаке  Тукузчалак.  Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Консулов очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она уже более 18  лет занимается  животноводством. Также она занимается земледелием. Выращивание сельхозкультур приносит её дополнительный доход.  Консулов имеет 3 крупнорогатых скота и 25 мелкорокатого скота. 
 Консулов   обратилась  в Арванд, чтобы получит кредит  для покупки корма для скота. Консулов  и её семья рады сотрудничать с Арванд.  Она заранее благодарит за поддержку..
texts.en:
Konsulov is a 50 year old woman. She lives in Istarvshan city, in Tukuzchalak kishlak. She is married and has four children. 

Konsulov is a very hardworking woman. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than eighteen years. She is also engaged in agriculture. Cultivating crops brings her additional income. 

Konsulov has three large cattle and 25 small cattle. Konsulov has applied to Arvand for a loan in order to buy cattle feed. Konsulov and her family are happy to cooperative with Arvand. She gives thanks in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy feeds

loans.name: Tezdjan

texts.en: Tazdjan Ismail S. is 26 years old. He was born in Razgrad but now he is a university student in Bourgas and studies “Industrial Management”. During his first year in university he used summer months to work in a sea resort near Bourgas. Then he decided that he is able to start his own business and an year later he found a fast food restaurant very close to the University where he studied. Tezdjan has Turkish origin and in his restaurant he offers traditional Turkish meals. Tezdjan is also a soccer referee and has interests in politics and  public activities. He is member of the Students Council of the University. The loan of $ 2 000 he applies for will be used for a new grill for the restaurant.

loans.use: For a new grill

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes has 5 years experience on her business. She decided to take a course of crafting. Her mom who is in Spain helped her to begin her business creating party souvenirs with just $50. She works everyday of the week from 9am to 6pm.

Mercedes wants a Kiva loan in order to buy raw material to fulfill the requests she has from her neighborhood. Besides she teaches during the weekends and needs materials for her students.

Mrs. Mercedes is a single mother, who has 3 kids, and has been able to provide them education. She wants to finish her house to improve the space where she has her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make party decorations

loans.name: Tati

texts.en:
Tati  is 30 years old and is married with six children. Four of them are girls, and the others two are boys. Her husband, Pardi, is a tricycle driver, earning $3 per day.  

To supplement her husband’s income, Tati sells vegetables, noodles, and coffee in front of her house. In a day Tati can make a net profit of $2. She needs a loan of $50. With this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income. Tati very much wants to earn more money  for her childrens' education and to give them a better life than that which she grew up with.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura is married and has two children. They come from the locality of Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. Her husband works in a company but the salary the he recieves is very low and insufficient to cover the basic necessities of their family. To be able to help with the expenses of the home, 14 years ago, she decided to create her own business with the sale of groceries, conditioning a quater of her home. Little by little she has been supplying the store better and offering better service to her customers.

To be able to increase sales and the variety of the products that she offers, Rosaura is asking for a loan of $250 that she will use on the purchase of merchandise. She offers to repay this amount in only three months. For your important part in the development of this business and help to Rosaura to better the quality of life for her family, they give sincere thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosaura es casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas e su familia, para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar hace 14 años decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes acondicionando un cuatro de su hogar, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y ofreciendo un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Para pode incrementar sus ventas y la variedad de los productos que ofrece, Rosaura está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrecer devolver esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a Rosaura a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise for grocery store - 
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Zamig

texts.en: Zamig is a 26 year old local resident of Aghsu, Azerbaijan. He has a pharmacy business for five years. He wants to invest more money in his business and to repair the shop. For this business he applies to Normicro for the first time for a $500 loan.

loans.use: To repair the pharmacy

loans.name: Shakhin

texts.en: Shakhin (his son is pictured) is a 42-year-old, married man who has one child. He lives with his son in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He has raised cattle for 10 years and finds this a good way to support his family. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy feed and baling presses for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy  feed and baling presses for his cattle

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
I started putting a floor down on the patio of my house because when it rains it floods the walkway. Unfortunately, i don't have the money to finish and thus avoid the humidity that comes into my house and causes sickness in my family, aside from the fact that this pool of water is a breeding ground for infection.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

“Empecé a poner un piso en el patio de mi casa, ya que cuando llueve se hace una laguna he impide el paso, desafortunadamente me falto dinero para terminar de ponerlo y así evitar que en esta temporada haya tanta humedad en mi vivienda y provoque enfermedades a mi familia, aparte de que el estancamiento de esa agua es un foco de infección $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar de poner el piso en el patio de mi vivienda.

loans.use: To finish putting down a floor on the patio of my house.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Rosa Victoria and Marcelina are associates of the community bank Maria Antonieta. They have been members for three years and one year respectively.

Rosa Victoria is married and has four children, three of whom are professionals. She is currently the president of her bank. Marcelina lives with her partner and has two children, one of whom is still in high school. She is the treasurer of her bank.

Rosa has owned a business preparing and selling the typical food from Cuzco, another part of Peru, for the past two months. For three years Marcelina has owned a business making and selling a traditional bread called, “chapla”. Their loans are for 1200 and 200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in improving their businesses by adding decorations, and buying basic groceries such as rice, oil, potatoes, meat, flower, and sugar.

Rosa and Marcelina say that in their community bank they feel happy and capable. It is like a big family where they can share companionship and values such as punctuality.

Their dreams are to continue improving their businesses and one day own a home.

loans.use: Their loans are for 1200 and 200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in improving their business by adding decorations, and buying basic groceries such as rice, oil, potatoes, meat, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is a very successful hairdresser.  She is married and has 1 child.  Felicia runs a local hairdressing salon and currently has 8 employees working for her.  In addition to her hair salon, Felicia also sells women’s clothing and bags.  Felicia is requesting $525 to improve her hairdressing salon, pay employees, and buy jeans and bags for sale.  Felicia is the group leader of a lending group called “Everlasting Grace Association” which consists of 14 women in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To improve her hairdressing salon, pay employees, and buy bags for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in agriculture and various products for his business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 22 years old and is a single woman. Halima is a bite seller since 2004. Everyday, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Edoe

texts.en: Edoe A. sells carved wood. She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She needs a loan of $450 to enable her buy more carved wood for sales.

loans.use: To buy more carved wood

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 24-year old married woman with a lot of experience in elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics). Before, she never had the initative to turn her hobby and talent into a business but through friends that have been loaning with SPBD, she has then decided to have a go at it and see how she will manage in operating such a business.Therefore this loan will use to improve her business.

loans.use: caved design, paint, and raw materials.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi K.. 54 years old, joined the TYM Fung since 2001. She always uses her borrowed money in the food shop. Because she is good at communication, and has a lot of experience in this business, she always has a lot of customers. Since being a member of the Fund, her business has been going very well. She is able to furnish her home. She has 3 children who are grown up. She and her husband is living with one of her children. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to invest more in her food shop. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị K. 54 tuổi, Tham gia Quỹ năm 2001, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào cửa hàng ăn uông, có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm bán hàng ăn, lại là người khéo léo trong giao tiếp nên cửa hàng ăn uống của gia đình chị luôn là địa chỉ của nhiều khách hàng, từ khi được tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ nên viêc kinh doanh của gia đình chị thuận tiện hơn kinh tế phát triển chị đã mua săm được nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị trong gia đình, chị có 3 con hiện đã trưởng thành, vợ chồng chị sống cùng 1 người con. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 16.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn uống. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in food shop

loans.name: Luz De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
This group is comprised of 13 people, 25% men and 75% women. The group was created in the Romero Pampa zone; all the partners reside in this zone. The president of the group is named Luís, a hard-working member with a history of good credit. He drives a taxi. The directing board is stable and is the reason why the group functions well.

Elena has been selling sports equipment for 8 years; Lucia has run a grocery store for 24 years; Nancy repairs shoes; Victoria sews jackets; Mery is an craftswoman; Jimmy sells handicrafts; Rosa sells CD's; Olivia is a permanent employee for a company; Tomasa sells vegetables; Lidia sells sweets; Indira sells blankets and Paulina sells fried potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo conformado por 13 personas 25 % varones y 75% mujeres. El grupo es creado en la zona de romero pampa. Todas las socias y socios residen por esta zona. El presidente del grupo se llama Luís, Socio trabajador con muy buenos antecedentes crediticios, trabaja con auto particular haciendo el servicio de taxi. La mesa directiva es estable y muy correcta por lo que el grupo marchar bien.

Elena se dedica a la venta de deportivos desde hace 8 años, Lucia atiende su negocio de abarrotes ya 24 años, Nancy se dedica a la reparación de zapatos, Victoria costura chamarras, Mery es artesana, Jimmy vende artesanías, Rosa vende CD`s, Olivia es empleada fija de una empresa, Tomasa vende verduras, Lidia vende dulces, Indira vende mantas y Paulina vende papas fritas.

loans.use:
Operating Capital
Capital de operaciones

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años, es divorciada, en la actualidad vive con su hija de 3 años llamada Yanet.
¿Qué hace?	Se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, en su triciclo donde ofrece sus ricos potajes. Al separarse de su esposo y viendo como mantener a su hija optó por poner un negocio, con lo que mejor sabe hacer, cocinar, es así que tras mucho esfuerzo y con muchas ganas puso su negocio de venta de comida, el cual le da buenos frutos o al menos los necesarios para mantener a su pequeña hija.A Rosa le encanta cocinar, ella disfruta elaborar cada plato, al cual le pone mucho empeño y su buena sazón, esto hace que su pequeño negocio tenga muy buena acogida, la parte difícil es cuando no puede abastecerse para atender a toda la clientela.
Rosa trabaja por esa luz de esperanza que es su hijita Yaneth, a la cual quiere brindarle lo mejor.
Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más ingredientes para cocinar y poder abastecer a toda su clientela, en el futuro le gustaría alquilar un pequeño local y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rose is 40 years of age, divorced, and currently lives with her three year-old daughter named Yanet.

What does she do? She sells food on the streets from her cart, where she offers her delicious stews. Upon divorcing her husband and seeing how to support her child, she opted to start a business with what she knows how to do best, cooking. This is how, with much effort and great desire, she started her business selling food, a business that gives her good profits or at the least what is needed to support her little girl. Rosa loves to cook, she enjoys making each dish, she puts her efforts into it and uses good flavors which is what has made her little business so well-received. The hard part is when she is not able to stock up so that she can serve all of her customers.

Rosa works for the ray of hope that is her little girl, Yanet, the one who she wants to provide for in the best way.

With the money of the loan, she will buy more ingredients for cooking and will be able to stock up for all of her customers. In the future, she would like to rent a small space and open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her food sales business with ingredients and supplies for the preparation of different dishes.

loans.name: Motiana

texts.en:
Motiana I., 49, is married with 6 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

Motiana has two previous loans from SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy chemicals, fertilizer, weed killer and bush knives. Her husband is helping her operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase  axe, chemicals, sack of fertilizer, weed killer and bush knives

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulanya Women's Group 1

texts.en: N. Immaculate is a widow of 53 years of age who cares for 7 children and 4 grandchildren. She is a businesswoman with a bar at her home selling local brew of two kinds (waragi and kwete) that she makes herself. On top of this, she also sells beer and wines since variety brings in more income.  She also sells the excess of her home made brew to other bar owners that can not afford to make it themselves, both at wholesale and retail, and this has increased her customer base and revenue. Out of her profits, she was able to start a retail shop that mostly sells snacks and sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour and paraffin to her community. Right now, her life is better and keepsogetting better by the day.  She needs a loan to help with restocking her shop and buying more beers for sale.

loans.use: Namuleme Immaculate needs to buy more goods for her shop and bar.

loans.name: Marielena

texts.es:
L a señora Mariaelena  es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni” del distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 54 años, es casada y madre D. 2 hijos, un menor que mantiene todavía, su esposo trabaja en un taller D. Mecánica en Tacna. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro papa, chuño, oca para vender en Tacna al mismo tiempo  se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles que obtendrá y que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara 01 ganado vacuno (01 toro) para engorD..

Su deseo es que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Señora Mariaelena is a member of the communal bank “Chojchoni” in the district of Copani in the province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 54, is married, and has 2 children, one of whom is a minor and whom she still supports financially. Her husband works as a mechanic in Tacna.

With the first loan she received of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased potatoes, potato flour, and oca (a root vegetable similar to a potato) to sell in Tacna. At the same time, she raises small animals. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase one bull to fatten. Her dream is to see her son finish his studies and become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull to fatten

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: B. Blandine s’est mariée avec DELEKE Coco Germain. Elle est née le 3 février 1963 et elle a cinq enfants, 22, 21, 20, 16, et 3 ans. Elle vend le charbon et le divers comme le lait, le cous cous, les œufs, le savon, et les jars. Sa boutique semble comme un petit supermarché, et Blandine a beaucoup de clients. Elle veut utiliser son crédit pour acheter le charbon. Elle achète son charbon à Dantokpa et elle paie les motos pour le transporter. Elle peut aussi faire les commandes. Elle a vendu ses produits pour 20 ans, et elle veut augmenter son approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Blandine B. is married to Coco Germain Deleke. She was born on February 3, 1963 and she has 5 children, aged 22, 21, 20, 16, and 3 ans. She sells charcoal and various other things such as milk, couscous, eggs, soap and jars. Her store seems like a little supermarket, and Blandine has a lot of customers.

Blandine wants to use this loan to buy charcoal. She buys her charcoal at Dantokpa, and she pays motorcyclists to transport it. She can also take orders. She has been selling her products for 20 years, and she wants to enlarge her stock.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
El señor Magdaleno S. es dueño de unos locales comerciales, en este momento los tiene en renta, pero no cuentan con el piso de concreto en la parte exterior, la prioridad es tenerlos en magníficas condiciones y así sus arrendatarios no se preocupen por la mala apariencia del local. 
Don Magdaleno ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntualmente y desea su cooperación para este préstamo y así realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Mr. Magdaleno S. owns several properties which he rents out to businesses. The properties, however, are in need of concrete floors to get them in better condition, so the tenants don't have to be concerned about the appearance of their stores. Magdaleno has already received two loans from FVP, both of which he has paid back on time. With your support, he will be able to use this loan to make his improvements as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay concrete floors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Jebta

texts.en:
Jebta Jacop sells beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jebta is 35 years old and is widowed.  She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build house and to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a house and pay the school fees for her children

loans.name: Muhtabor

texts.ru: Клиентка Туйчибоева Мухтабор в возросте 55 год, замужем имеет двоих детей, высшего образования не имеет. Проживает в городе Вахдат, клиентка занимается торговлей более 10 лет у неё имееется собственный магазин, который находится, в городе Вахдате улица Туграл .На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, в виде закупа продуктов питания.Увеличив товар, у клиентки увеличится ежедневный доход от торговли.
texts.en:
The client Muhtabor T. is 55 years old, married and has two children. She does not have high education. She lives in the town of Vahdat and runs a retail business for more than ten years. She has her own store which is located on the Tugral street in Vahdat. She wants to use the loan to increase her inventory and buy more food. By doing that Muhtabor will increase her daily income from her sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas D. is 40 years old; he is married and the father of four children. Currently all his children are in school. He is very resourceful and hard-working man who wants to leave a legacy for his children by providing for their education needs. He did not have the opportunity to attend school and he wants to correct that by providing for his children.

Thomas sells car interior decorations such as air freshers, flags, stickers, teddy bird, steering wheel covers, etc. He has been in this business for the past 15 years, taking care of the family. Thomas has a store in a Cape Coast mechanics shop where most car users bring their cars for maintenance. His goods are cheap and for that reason lots of drivers buy from his stand. He therefore requests a loan to buy more goods like air freshers, flags, stickers, etc. to upgrade his inventory. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Jeremiah’.

loans.use: To buy car interior decorations

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en:
Lauriana and her husband are striving hard to improve their way of living. She manages a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She has managed her store for almost two years and she is thankful that it is doing well. Lauriana wants to grab the chance to improve her store by asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 (USD 150) as additional capital. She plans to use the loan to buy more grocery items that she can offer to her customers. She hopes that lenders will give her the opportunity to develop her business.

Lauriana is 57 years old, married to Francisco and blessed with five children: Homer - 36 years old, a security guard in Laguna; Joel - 34 years old; Joey - 31 years old; Jennifer - 26 years old, and Jerry - 22 years old.  Her children were not able to pursue their college education due to financial difficulties.

loans.use: Business Capital - village grocery store.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac T. is single with no children and has received an education through senior high school.

Since 2003 Isaac has sold phone credit cards and accessories at Cape Coast behind the Oguaa Hall. Isaac uses his income to pay for utility bills and other basic necessities. He will use the loan to purchase the latest mobile phones and accessories for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business Isaac plans to reinvest in his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase the latest mobile phones and accessories for resale

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
This man was born in 1979. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Djabrayil region, now settled in Khirdalan town.

Seymur is married, has one child. Four years ago he started his taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Jun

texts.en: Jun S., 39, is a farmer in the Batambong Province which is so famous for producing good rice in Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer too; however, he is also a builder because his income is a bit low.
